Chapter 371: Jealous

“I am unspeakably jealous of you,” Мокси [she] informed Ной [he], crossing her arms and leaning back in her chair.

He’d returned to her room just a few minutes ago and had been relieved to find that everyone had returned safely – although that relief had faded slightly when he’d realized that he had to tell Мокси [she] that he’d watched her hero show off his coolest move.

“I didn’t know he was going to go and do something like that,” Ной [he] said defensively.

“I know, I know. That doesn’t make me any less jealous, though. It’s incredible that he’s managed to keep that under wraps this whole time. I never would have thought he used puppets, but it makes so much sense. That’s why he’s been punching above his weight class so much. He’s using the body of a powerful monster, and he’s probably been reinforcing it with extra Наполнения [he] and magic this whole time.”

“He was certainly something,” Ной [he] admitted. “He brought me and Улия [she] along specifically so we could make him look weaker – and I was supposed to be pretending to be a Rank 6 powerhouse. What a badass.”

“Stop talking him up,” Мокси [she] groaned, running her hands through her hair. “It’s just making things worse. I wish I was there.”

“Sorry,” Ной [he] said with a cheeky grin. “Maybe you can pretend to be the insanely strong mage next time so he drags you along instead.”

Мокси [she] snorted. “Yeah, right. That’ll be the time we get attacked by everyone and their grandmothers. I’ll let you stick to that. But what happened after Сильвертид [he] killed the puppets? That can’t be it, can it?”

“Almost certainly not,” Ной [he] agreed. “I’m certain this is Визен [he] we’re up against. I don’t think he could read any thoughts through his puppets, or he would have figured out what Сильвертид [he] was doing. There’s no way he’s done, though. And, unfortunately, he didn’t give us a scrap of information about what he actually wants.”

“Lovely. I was kind of hoping he’d just spout his plans to look cool before he tried to kill you.”

“Me too,” Ной [he] admitted with a sigh. “I tried, but he didn’t bite. He’s not an idiot, unfortunately. Сильвертид [he] seemed to think it would be pretty hard for him to get his puppets back to Арбитраж [he], though. He might have to come here himself.”

Мокси [she] chewed her lip and leaned back on the rear legs of her chair, rocking back and forth in place as she thought. “Then he’s almost certainly going to go after Сильвертид [he]. After getting stomped that hard, he’s got to be pissed.”

“Given how arrogant he came off? Almost certainly.” Ной [he] nodded. “I think it might be a bit before he pops up again. We should use that time to get stronger and focus the kids’ training. Right now, they’re the weak link and I don’t want Визен [he] thinking they’re easy targets.”

“That’s assuming he cares about them at all, but I agree,” Мокси [she] said. She let her chair return to its normal position before she could fall. “Some of the other продвинутая группа professors were discussing having training matches. It could be worthwhile matching up some of our students against theirs to see where they stand. The first one is next week.”

“Seems like a good goal. More than enough time to try to push them to the next step with formations,” Ной [he] said.

They were silent for a few moments, and Ли [she] took that moment to speak up for the first time since Ной [he] had gotten back, having been in a food coma.

“What did you end up doing with the bodies the puppets had taken?” Ли [she] asked from her spot on the edge of the bed. She’d – mercifully – returned back to her normal form, so Ной [he] didn’t have to look at himself when she spoke.

“Left them to Сильвертид [he],” Ной [he] replied. “I don’t know what he did with them after that. Maybe he took them as proof? Either way, you’ve eaten more than enough for one night.”

“I’m still hungry, though.”

“You’re always hungry.”

“Oh, yeah.” Ли [she] blinked, as if she’d completely forgotten that particular fact. “I guess I am.”

Ной [he] and Мокси [she] both laughed on the completely innocent expression on Ли [she]’s face. Sometimes, it was hard to tell if she was being serious or not. If anything, she was even better of a liar than Ной [he] was.

“What ended up happening at the продвинутая группа party after I left?” Ной [he] asked. “Anything important?”


“I don’t know if I’d say it’s important, but they covered some of what they’d be providing and doing through the year,” Мокси [she] said. “The most important part is that, for the students to stay in the продвинутая группа, they need to score similarly or above the other продвинутая группа members. So our exams are the ones everyone takes, but if we aren’t at the top of the class and also at the level of the other advanced students, they get booted.”

“They’re expected to be that good right off the bat?” Ной [he] raised an eyebrow, but Мокси [she] shook her head.

“No, there’s a warm-up period. They don’t have to perform as good as everyone else immediately, but the top performers get access to information on some rune combinations as well as special training areas and sometimes just straight up runes. They treat the students at the top really well.”

“Noted. More reason to make sure everyone is ready to crush, but we’ll have to approach this in the right way. We don’t want too much attention. Not yet, at least. It’s something we can deal with tomorrow. I’m hearing the bed calling my name, but I want to know one more thing before I can rest.”

“What is it?” Мокси [she] asked.

“What did Джален [he] do after I left?”

“Oh, he kind of just hung around. I was surprised. I thought he’d start trouble, but he stayed out of our way and barely said anything. He escorted us back to the room and left shortly afterward.”

“Seriously?” Ной [he] tilted his head to the side. That really was odd. He hadn’t expected Джален [he] to lie, but doing absolutely nothing felt even weirder. It wasn’t like Джален [he] was around to ask what had happened, so all Ной [he] could do was shrug. “Well, that’s good. Maybe he’s not as insane as we thought.”

“Right,” Мокси [she] said dryly. “More like we didn’t figure out what he was doing.”

“Probably. Either way, I’m exhausted from a day of doing absolutely nothing but thinking that I am going to be doing something.”

“Me too,” Ли [she] declared, about half a second before dropping her head and starting to snore.

It wasn’t long before Ной [he] and Мокси [she] got into bed and followed her lead.

***

Рафаэль [he] was deeply concerned. He’d known that this task wasn’t going to be simple. Killing demons rarely was – but he’d never expected his target to be this deeply entrenched. The demon wasn’t just defended. Everything around them was a veritable fortress.

It had been strange enough when the blood he’d gathered had been more finnicky than it should have been. Instead of leading him right to the demon, it faded and swirled throughout Арбитраж [he], as if it couldn’t make up its mind as to where the demon had gone.

If it had gone up a Rank, Рафаэль [he] could have understood a degree of confusion. Demons changed considerably with every Rank they advanced – but this was different. It was as if the demon couldn’t determine if it existed or not.

And, even in spite of that, he’d tracked his foe. He’d followed its many trails through Арбитраж [he]. His efforts had finally led him to a group – a group that was in with one of the most famous soldiers in the kingdom, Сильвертид [he].

It wasn’t just Сильвертид [he], either. The group, including several people that appeared to be mere students, also had the support of a man and a woman who had completely suppressed their power. And, if there was one thing that Рафаэль [he] had learned in his time hunting demons, it was that anything without even the slightest amount of power had far more power than anyone else in the room.

Rank 5 minimum, probably Rank 6. I’ve never felt such a perfectly suppressed… well, everything. I would have thought the hooded man wasn’t even there if I’d been looking less closely. The woman… the same. I couldn’t get a read of her.

But… which one was the actual demon? Was it the one shoveling food into his mouth like there was no tomorrow? Was it the woman – or the masked man? Damn it.

He’d chosen to remain hidden in the shadows of the meeting he’d followed the group to, staying behind when Сильвертид [he] and the masked man had left. The chances of Сильвертид [he] being corrupted were low, so the others were far more likely to be his targets.

But, to his annoyance, the night had ended without anything even slightly out of the ordinary aside from the man – Вермил [he], if Рафаэль [he] had caught his name correctly – having a seemingly bottomless stomach.

It could be him. Eating that much could be indicative of a demon’s unrestrained personality… but he also seems to care a little too much about the people around him. He keeps glancing at the students to make sure they’re next to him, and with the discussion that was happening in here earlier, it makes sense.

Demons don’t care for others. Shit. Who is it?

They couldn’t have all been demons, and there was a very good chance that at least a few of them had no idea who they were traveling with. Рафаэль [he] couldn’t warn them either – if they did know and were simply hiding it, then he’d be giving himself away.

Damn it. I could try approaching Вермил [he], but what if he made a deal with a demon to protect his students? That would make him an enemy, even if it was for a good cause.

No matter how hard Рафаэль [he] thought, he couldn’t think of anything that would answer his questions. Nobody had given themselves away tonight, which meant it was ever more likely that his target was the masked man or, gods forbid, Сильвертид [he] himself.

I don’t have much time left. I’ll have to observe them over the coming days. And, if nothing reveals itself, then I will be forced to try to isolate them as much as possible and confront them one by one.

Рафаэль [he] took his rosary in his hands and ran his thumb along the beads, forcing himself to take control over his fraying nerves. He was no stranger to great threats, and this demon was no different. No matter how extensive its support network may have been, it was a demon.

And, once it was revealed, he would destroy it. There was no alternative. There were no other paths. Demons were a plague on this world, and they could not be allowed to exist.

Before this week ends, the demon must die.
==========
Chapter 372: Too Late

The next morning, Ной [he] woke up to Ли [she] slipping in through the window. He blinked, locking eyes with her as she froze with one foot into the room, as if not moving would keep anyone from noticing her.

“Ли [she]?” Ной [he] asked, rubbing the sleep from his eyes and sitting up. Мокси [she] had somehow slipped out of bed without waking him up, and it didn’t look like she was in the room.

“I was trying to be sneaky,” Ли [she] said, pulling the window open the rest of the way and dropping into the room. She shut it behind her and frowned back at it.

“You’re normally pretty good at that,” Ной [he] said. “What happened?”

“I was distracted,” Ли [she] said. “Something about the party yesterday felt a bit weird, so I went back to investigate. I haven’t seen anything out of place, though.”

“Weird?” Ной [he] asked. “What part of it? I’d say there were half a dozen different weird things all happening at once.”

“Most of that was the normal weird.” Ли [she] shook her head, clearly searching for the right words. “It was a smell. One that really didn’t fit, and it wasn’t the puppets – I don’t know why, but those didn’t smell different. They just smelled like people.”

“Concerning, but what was the other smell, then?” Ной [he] asked, fully waking up. He slid out of bed and got dressed, snagging his belongings. “Something we should be worried about?”

“That’s what I was trying to find out. It seemed a little familiar… but at the same time, I couldn’t place it at all. And, when I went back today to try and see if I could smell what it was, there was nothing there.”

“I’m not even going to waste time asking if you’re sure it was there, then. Do you think it had anything to do with the puppets, even if it wasn’t them? Maybe Визен [he]?”

“I don’t know. I don’t think I’ve interacted enough with Визен [he] or the puppets to place the smell,” Ли [she] admitted with a frown. She fell silent for a second, then shook her head. “Never mind. For now, just be careful, I guess. I don’t know what it was.”

“Noted,” Ной [he] said. “Do you know where Мокси [she] went?”

“Эмили [she] and Александра [she] stopped by asking to do some extra training today, so she went to practice with them. I saw them leaving while I was headed out to see if I could smell the thing from yesterday.”

Ной [he] nodded, adjusting his hair. He went for the door, then paused. Now that the meeting with the продвинутая группа had passed, he wasn’t actually sure what he wanted to do today. Originally, dealing with Визен [he]’s puppets would have taken that spot up – but those were, courtesy of Сильвертид [he], handled as well.

Well, shit. Normally this would be a great time to bother Мокси [she], but she’s doing teacher things. That’s honestly for the best, considering she’s been trying to find a way to help more in recent classes. Does leave me in a bit of a pickle, though.

Whelp, Formations it is then. There’s still a lot more I know I can get out of the violin, and I need to make sure I’m as strong as possible in the near future. Getting better with Formations and the violin will be a lot more beneficial in the short term than getting some new Tier 4 Runes, but I should keep that in mind as well.

That particular thought gave Ной [he] pause. His first Rank 4 Rune had been pretty easy to figure out. It had just been an extension of his Rank 3 – but he didn’t have that privilege anymore. Even if he used a few Rank 4 Natural Disasters for his Rank 5 Rune, he still needed something else in the mix.

“What kind of magic would pair well with Natural Disaster?” Ной [he] mused to himself, letting his hand rest on the doorknob.

“Unnatural Disaster?” Ли [she] offered from behind him, snickering to herself.

Ной [he] went to roll his eyes, then caught himself as the idea fully registered. Natural Disaster was all nature-based magic. If he continued down the disaster route, adding magic that originated from areas beyond just environmental ones seemed pretty logical.

That would be a great spot to work in some Space Runes or the like. I’m not sure what Rank I’d have to be to create a black hole, but I’m pretty sure that would count as a disaster at some point, especially if it was right on top of some poor bastard’s head.

“That’s not a bad idea,” Ной [he] said with a grin. “Thanks, Ли [she].”

“It wasn’t?” Ли [she] blinked, then cleared her throat. “I mean, of course it wasn’t. I’m a genius.”

“Got plans for today?” Ной [he] asked as he headed into the hall. “I’ll probably focus on some practice. I don’t know how long we’ll have before Визен [he] is back, but we should have at least a few days of being left alone if not more. That’ll be welcome –It’s been far too long since I’ve gotten any proper free time. Are you close to hitting Rank 4 yet? It might be a good idea to try to push through the last bit and advance.”

Ли [she]’s features clouded and she remained in the room, not following after him. “I’m almost there. Maybe I’ll get there this week. Today, I’ll probably just wander around. Maybe I’ll follow after Мокси [she] and the others.”

“Whenever you’re ready,” Ной [he] said. “Let me know if there’s anything I can do to help.”

Ли [she] nodded absently, and Ной [he] headed down the hall while Ли [she] pulled the door shut behind her, likely planning to head out the window rather than take the stairs.

Once I can really get Formations under control, I can look more into my next Rank 4 Rune. With any luck, I’ll be strong enough to give Визен [he] a nasty surprise the next time he comes after Мокси [she].


I still wonder what it is from the Торрин [he] family he wants, though.

***

Ли [she] found Мокси [she], Эмили [she], and Александра [she] without much difficulty. It only took her a few minutes of slipping through the shadows and following her nose before she caught up with their scent at the Transport Cannon.

Тим [he] was sitting behind the counter, fiddling with his thumbs when he spotted Ли [she] arrive and grinned in greeting.

“Hello! You just missed Мокси [she] and the others,” Тим [he] said.

“Yeah. Could you send me after them? I went to say hi to Вермил [he], then realized I didn’t have anything to do today other than bother them.”

“I don’t normally do that, but I’ve seen you lot spending lots of time together, so I suppose it should be fine,” Тим [he] said. He tapped the console of the cannon and grinned at her. “Besides, it’s still set for the same spot. Just hop in and you’ll be on your way.”

“Thanks!” Ли [she] said, hopping into the cannon. A moment later, she was a beam of blue energy streaking across the sky.

The Transport Cannon deposited Ли [she] in the Windscorned Plateau, and her nose led her straight over to Мокси [she] and the students. It wasn’t hard to find them, as none of them had any wind magic.

All three had gathered at the edge of the plateau they’d arrived on, just beneath the sheer wall of a plateau above them. Ли [she] ran over, arriving in just moments and nearly scaring the life out of Эмили [she]. The girl, who had been focused on a swirling ball of ice hovering in her palms, lost control of her magic and doubled over coughing.

“Ли [she]! Where’d you come from?” Мокси [she] asked with a laugh. “And are you okay, Эмили [she]?”

“I’m fine,” Эмили [she] muttered. “I just didn’t expect someone to come at us so fast.”

Александра [she] seemed to be the only one that hadn’t been caught even slightly by surprise, and that was probably because she’d been looking in the direction of where Ли [she] had arrived, meaning she’d likely seen Ли [she] coming for an instant.

“I just used the transport cannon to come over because I was bored,” Ли [she] said with a shrug. “What’s everyone doing?”

“Эмили [she] is practicing with her magic and trying to get a better feel for it that she can translate into Formations,” Александра [she] said. “I’m just warming up so I can spar with Мокси [she].”

“I thought Вермил [he] said not to use magic with our practice,” Ли [she] said, narrowing her eyes.

“I’m not doing Formations or patterns right now,” Эмили [she] explained, forming another swirling ball of ice above her palm. “I’m studying how ice looks and feels. How it interacts with things, you know? So I can get better at my pattern. You can’t embody something if you don’t understand it perfectly, right?”

“Oh, yeah,” Ли [she] said with a sage nod. “That makes sense. It means I should probably eat more. To understand it.”

Мокси [she] rolled her eyes. “I’d say that you understand food more than possibly anyone else in the entire world, but I do have some jerky you can have if you promise not to eat all of it.”

“Why would I promise that when I can just slowly take pieces of it away until it’s all gone?”

Эмили [she] snickered, but Ли [she] didn’t miss her attempt to carefully shift her small travel pack to her other hip. It was pointless, of course. Ли [she] could smell the jerky in it no matter where Эмили [she] moved the bag.

“Just make sure not to distract anyone too much,” Мокси [she] said. “You’re welcome to join us, though. Having someone else to spar with will be a lot of use.”

Ли [she] nodded and sat down cross-legged beside Эмили [she], content to bide her time and wait for the opportune moment to claim some of the girl’s jerky for herself. Figuring out how to defend food was a core element of training.

Part of her was still concerned with the smell from yesterday, but it had been so faint and unreadable that it was almost certainly something to do with Визен [he]’s puppets. Сильвертид [he] had handled that, so there was nothing else to worry about for now. There would be time to worry about getting stronger later. Right now, she was content to sit with her friends.

A footstep echoed through the room, pulling Тим [he]’s gaze away from his favorite window. He hadn’t even heard the elevator activate, but a man stood on the lift, his features concealed by a hood.

For a moment, Тим [he] wondered if Джален [he] had returned, but he quickly dismissed the thought. This man didn’t have the same build – his shoulders were broader and he was almost a foot shorter.

“I didn’t hear you coming,” Тим [he] said with a smile, pushing back from the table and rising to his feet. “Are you new to the transport cannon?”

“Yes,” the man replied in a gravelly tone. “This is my first time. I don’t often take use of Space magic наполнение [he]s. They’re finnicky.”

“They are,” Тим [he] agreed, his smile growing even larger. “That’s why the transport cannon is so impressive. It’s state of the art, and has some of the biggest improvements in travel efficiency that the world has seen. Care for a demonstration?”

“No,” the man barked as Тим [he] reached for the controls. Тим [he] froze, blinking in surprise.

“You don’t?”

“Not at the moment. Please step back,” the man said. Something in his tone sent a frown crawling across Тим [he]’s face.

“I’m sorry? Why? Is something wrong?”

“Nothing is wrong,” the man said, his cloak flowing across the floor as he approached Тим [he]. “Just step away from the controls.”

Тим [he]’s eyes narrowed. He considered himself a pretty good judge of character, and in nine times out of ten, when people showed up with their hoods on and murmured vague threats, they didn’t tend to be anyone good.

“I don’t think I’ll be doing that,” Тим [he] said. “If you have any complaints, feel free to take them to the Office.”

He reached for the reset lever – and froze.

Тим [he]’s eyes couldn’t even widen. His body wouldn’t budge. It was as if every single part of it had completely rebelled against him. He couldn’t so much as blink. The man stepped forward, studying the levers beside Тим [he].

“This one activates the cannon, yes?”

Тим [he] didn’t respond. It wasn’t like he had a choice. He struggled as furiously as he could, trying to so much as wiggle a pinky toe, but his entire body was locked down.

“There’s no point trying to resist,” the man said. “It’s blood magic, and you’re in my domain. Without one of your own, it’s fruitless.”

He held a hand up, running his thumb over a bone rosary. A moment later, the man lowered it. “You have nothing to fear from me. All you’re going to do is pull that lever once I’m on the transport cannon. It’s still set to the same location, isn’t it?”

Тим [he] could do nothing but stare as the man walked across the room and laid back on the cannon. He felt his hand rise up of its own volition and wrap around the lever. It wasn’t mind control – Тим [he] could literally feel the blood shifting in his body, forcing him to move his arm.

That did nothing to change what happened. His hand pulled down. There was a flash, and the man disappeared, leaving Тим [he] standing in an empty office. Control snapped back into his body and his face went pale as his blood started flowing properly again.

The cannon isn’t set up for any custom controls right now. I can’t pull anyone back early. I need to find someone.

Тим [he] sprinted out from behind the counter, nearly tripping over his own feet as he ran into the lift and it started to lower, the rattle of the chains rising up all around him in a mocking cacophony.

All he could do was pray he’d be able to get help before it was too late.

Chapter 373: I'M Faster

Ли [she] was still trying to find the best way to relocate the jerky in Эмили [she]’s bag to her mouth when the air shifted. A shimmer of energy passed through the sky, and it carried with it a familiar scent.

“Did anyone else see that?” Александра [she] asked. “I think it was the transport Cannon. Was Вермил [he] also going to join us?”

“I saw it,” Ли [she] said, uncrossing her legs and standing up, a frown slipping over her features. “And that wasn’t Вермил [he]. He wasn’t planning on coming. He’s doing his own practice today.”

Мокси [she] stood beside Ли [she], brushing the grass off her back. They both squinted at the edge of the plateau, where a dark form had appeared against the grassy ground. The person’s features were obscured by a black cloak, but they were heading toward them.

“It’s not Джален [he], is it?” Мокси [she] asked, the frown deepening on her face. “That isn’t any of the other students, that’s for certain. The build is wrong.”

“No,” Ли [she] said, sniffing at the air. “It’s someone else. I think they were at the продвинутая группа party with us yesterday.”

“Is it a puppet?” Эмили [she] asked nervously. Cold energy swirled around her hands, starting to gather into the shape of a bow. “Do you think they’re coming for revenge?”

“Сильвертид [he] said he handled the puppets, and I’m inclined to believe him,” Мокси [she] said. “It’s more likely that it’s someone else from the продвинутая группа. I swear, if those idiots are trying to test us again, I’m going to lose my cool. They don’t know when to stop.”

They all watched the figure approach them warily. He didn’t seem to be doing anything other than walking in their direction. There was no indication of hostility in his posture or scent – but, at the same time, something about him set the hair on the back of Ли [she]’s neck stand on end.

“I don’t like him,” Ли [she] muttered to Мокси [she]. “We should leave.”

“The transport cannon doesn’t reactivate for a few hours,” Мокси [she] replied in the same tone. A vine rose up from the ground beside her, forming into an armrest for her to lean on. “And I don’t know who we’re up against. If they’re an opponent, attacking first without letting them know we’re aware of a threat might be the smartest way to handle things.”

Ли [she] swallowed and nodded. “Okay. On your go?”

“Yeah. We’ll be polite first – it’s probably just an продвинутая группа member. But, if I attack, follow up immediately. Girls, your job is to run for the hills. I know Александра [she] should be able to climb the plateau if need be, so bring Эмили [she] with you.”

“What? I can fight,” Александра [she] protested. “I–”

“Don’t care,” Мокси [she] said flatly. “If this is someone strong enough to handle Ли [she] and I, then they’re going to be able to kill you two as well. Your job is to stay alive. I’m sure I’m overreacting, though. It just doesn’t hurt to be ready.”

Александра [she] looked like she wanted to protest, but she gave Мокси [she] a small nod and pressed her lips together, turning her gaze back toward the person approaching them.

It wasn’t long before he had crossed the rest of the distance separating them and drew up, coming to a stop a dozen feet away. The man raised a hand in greeting, revealing a flash of pale flesh beneath his dark cloak before he let his hand fall and be swallowed by his long sleeves.

“I hope I haven’t startled you,” the man said, pulling his hood back to reveal a rather average-looking face. He was middle aged, between forty and fifty by looks, with a deep scar to the side of his lip and above his eye. He wasn’t quite bald, but Ли [she] was pretty sure that would be rectified if a strong breeze kicked up anywhere near him. The only reliable hair the man had on his face was in the form of his beard.

“Generally, it’s not polite to follow after someone using the transport cannon,” Мокси [she] said in a curt tone. “Especially when we aren’t friends. You were at the продвинутая группа meeting, right?”

The man paused, the smile on his face locking in place for a second before he got control of himself again. For some reason, Мокси [she]’s words had caught him off guard.

I don’t think I actually saw him anywhere. Was he not part of the продвинутая группа? Someone from a competing program or something like that?

“My apologies. I hadn’t realized you spotted me,” the man said. “My name is Рафаэль [he]. I was simply hoping that I could speak with you.”

“You’re doing that right now,” Мокси [she] said. “If there’s something you need to say, you’re welcome to say it.”

Рафаэль [he]’s lips thinned. “I would prefer to keep it private.”

“And I’ll have to refuse. I have no interest in speaking with you privately,” Мокси [she] said, letting a hand lift to touch the cloak on her shoulders. “Spit it out or leave.”

“I have reason to believe there are… infiltrators in the area,” Рафаэль [he] said, choosing his words carefully.

“We all heard about the puppets,” Мокси [she] said dryly. “And, if anyone is suspicious, it’s you. Get to the point or leave. I’ve got students to keep an eye on, and you’re looking an afwul lot like a threat.”

“I can understand how you feel. I promise you, I hold no ill will toward any innocents,” Рафаэль [he] said, raising his hands. His sleeves fell back once more, this time revealing a string of bone beads hanging around his right wrist.

The world slammed to a crawl as Ли [she]’s eyes locked onto the beads. A cold hand gripped her stomach and squeezed as she realized what the scent that had been throwing her off was.

Рафаэль [he] was an Inquisitor.

“I am looking out for the world’s best interests,” Рафаэль [he] continued, completely unaware of Ли [she]’s realization. “And I do not wish to alarm you, but it is possible that one of your group has been overwhelmed and their body stolen. I simply need to run a simple test that will do absolutely no harm to you and then I’ll be on my way.”

As he spoke, his hand went for the rosary at his wrist. Ли [she] went to move, but Мокси [she] was faster. A deep red vine covered in jagged thorns erupted from the ground at Рафаэль [he]’s feet, winding up for his neck.

A deep hum filled the air and the vine was shredded apart before it even grew close to him. Ли [she]’s heart plummeted into the pit of her stomach – Рафаэль [he] was at least a Rank 4, probably higher based on how powerful his domain had to be if it had destroyed Мокси [she]’s magic so quickly.

“Run!” Мокси [she] yelled, jerking her hands into the air. Vines erupted from the ground around her, writhing up like the heads of a hydra. Александра [she] grabbed Эмили [she] and blurred, sprinting for the rock wall behind them.

Ли [she] went to move, but Рафаэль [he] was faster. His thumb ran over the beads, and a wave of golden energy erupted from the rosary with a melodic chime. A wall of sheer agony slammed into Ли [she], ripping a scream from her throat as she crumpled to the ground.

Stand up, you little idiot! Move!

Energy slammed into Ли [she] and she drew in a ragged breath, scrambling upright as Рафаэль [he]’s eyes flicked, locking onto hers.

“Demon,” Рафаэль [he] snarled. “Not the one I was tracking, but a demon nonetheless. Stand down, woman. I’m an Inquisitor. It should be apparent–”

The ground beneath Рафаэль [he] vanished. His eyes only had an instant to widen before he plummeted down, vanishing beneath the earth. Ли [she] spun to Мокси [she], whose face was pale from exertion.

“I can’t do anything through his domain, but that doesn’t stop me from digging the ground out from beneath him and then just pulling it open from below. You need to run, Ли [she].”

“I can’t leave you to fight him alone!”

“He only wants you,” Мокси [she] snapped. “Just go. You’re faster than he is, so wait until the transport cannon re-activates and then go find Ной [he] or Сильвертид [he].”

Мокси [she]’s words made sense. As much as she hated the idea of it, Ли [she] turned to run – and another wave of agony slammed into her, worming its way into her mind. She crumpled to the ground, gasping in pain.

Рафаэль [he] clawed his way out of the hole behind them, baring his teeth as he stood. “I will only give you one more chance to get out of my way, professor. I do not wish to kill innocents.”

“And I’ll give you one last chance to leave,” Мокси [she] said, but Ли [she] could barely hear her words through the pain. Азель [he] was yelling something in her mind, but it was a swirling mess. Her fingers dug into the grass, trying to find purchase.

Before Ли [she] could even stand, another blast of pain ripped through her. She doubled over, blood splattering from her lips and onto the grass. The resonance from Рафаэль [he]’s rosary was a dozen times stronger than the one that the previous Inquisitor had held, and her innards felt like they were turning to liquid.

A brief instant of reprieve walled off the pain as Азель [he]’s power sank even deeper into Ли [she]’s body, flooding her muscles and pushing Рафаэль [he]’s magic back. She threw herself forward into the cliff face, her fingers digging into the rock as she desperately started to climb.

“No!” Рафаэль [he] roared. “She will not escape!”

Ли [she] glanced back over her shoulder as Рафаэль [he] sprinted after her – only for Мокси [she] to jump forward, thrusting her foot in front of the Inquisitor’s feet. The man stumbled, cursing, and Мокси [she] brought her elbow down on the back of his head.

A loud crack rang out and Рафаэль [he] hit the ground with a grunt. Ли [she] took the mere seconds that Мокси [she] had bought her to force her screaming body to finish the climb up the plateau, joining Александра [she] and Эмили [she] at the top. She ignored the terrified look on Эмили [she]’s face and coughed again, blood splattering against her fist.

“Fool. You chose this. I will not let you interfere!” Рафаэль [he] roared from behind Ли [she]. A deep thrum burned Ли [she]’s ears as Рафаэль [he]’s domain activated. Despite everything Мокси [she] had said, Ли [she] glanced back one more time.

Мокси [she]’s vines had all been ripped to shreds, and she was locked in place like a startled deer. Even in the brief look that Ли [she] took, she could tell Мокси [she]’s posture was unnatural. She’d literally been frozen solid, and Рафаэль [he] was drawing a sword.

He’s going to kill Мокси [she]!

Forget the woman, you stupid girl! The Iniquisitor isn’t as fast as you are. Use Мокси [she]’s sacrifice and get out of here before you die with her!

“Those in league with the demons will fall with them,” Рафаэль [he] snarled, his eyes burning with fanaticism. The sword fell.

“Мокси [she]!” Эмили [she] screamed, beating at Александра [she]’s arm. “Let me go! I need to help her!”

I’m faster.

Stop!

Ли [she] blurred, diving off the cliff. The sword shot for Мокси [she]’s neck, but Ли [she] was far faster than a mere blade. Even as it made contact with Мокси [she]’s neck, her fist crashed into Рафаэль [he]’s face, shattering his cheekbone and sending him rolling across the grass. Рафаэль [he] managed to keep his hold on the sword, but his blow never finished reaching its mark.

Рафаэль [he] rolled a dozen feet before skidding to a stop, snarl twisting his face. Мокси [she] drew in a hissing breath as control returned to her body. Her hand shot up to the cut on her neck.

“We need to run,” she hissed. “He’s got a blood magic domain! If he gets close, you can’t move at all!”

“Too late,” Рафаэль [he] growled, pressing his thumb to the line of blood on his sword as he staggered upright. Мокси [she]’s eyes went wide as her body locked in place mid-step. Рафаэль [he] stalked toward them, baring his teeth. “Your arrogance will not save you. All who consort with demons will die.”

Panic pulsed in Ли [she]’s mind. Мокси [she] couldn’t move. Александра [she] and Эмили [she] were nowhere near strong enough to challenge someone this strong, and she was completely useless against him.

Another wave of agony ripped through Ли [she]’s body as she turned to run for the cliff, hoping to put enough distance between herself and Рафаэль [he] to dive-bomb him again. She stumbled, tripping over her own feet and landing face-first in the grass with a scream.

“Your time will come, demon,” Рафаэль [he] hissed. “But first will be the one hiding her power.”

Ли [she] forced her gaze up, but she was in the range of the rosary once more. Even with the magic Азель [he] was shoving her way, her body wouldn’t respond. Мокси [she] was going to die in front of her, and there was nothing she could do about it.

Chapter 374: The Demon'S Advance

Ли [she]’s throat clenched. Blood pumped in her ears. Рафаэль [he]’s advance toward Мокси [she] spun in her eyes, every step seeming to come slower than the last. Color shifted as the world turned a faint rose, then slipped into black.

Control snapped back to her body, but it wasn’t in the real world. She stumbled forward, finding herself within the darkness of her mindspace. A bloom of flame swirled before her, revealing Азель [he]’s form.

“Idiot,” Азель [he] snarled. “I told you to run.”

“Let me out!” Ли [she] grabbed Азель [he] by his collar. “I need to–”

“What?” Азель [he] shoved Ли [she] to the ground. “What are you going to do, you stupid girl? Your body is locked in place. You can’t move. You can’t even beg. All I’ve done is buy you a few meagre moments. You can feel it, can’t you?”

Ли [she] didn’t have to ask Азель [he] what he was talking about. A burning heat swirled at the back of her neck, working its way slowly up toward her brain.

“What did you do?”

“I’m forcing your brain to run faster than it should be capable of, but there’s only so long you’re going to be able to handle this,” Азель [he] said, thrusting a finger into Ли [she]’s forehead. “That’s your brain stem heating. And, in a minute, you’re going to go up like a candle.”

“Then help me!” Ли [she] begged. “Kill the Inquisitor!”

Азель [he] let out a bark of laughter. “Do you think me an attack dog, Ли [she]? I don’t have a body thanks to Вермил [he]. All I am is energy, and Эвергрин [she] did a lot of damage to me. It’s taken everything I have to shift the majority of my power to you, and you’ve been wasting it at every blasted opportunity.”

“I–”

“No,” Азель [he] snapped. “No more talking, Ли [she]. It’s my turn. I’ve helped you at every turn. If you want to live, you’re going to do what I say. Enough of this cowardice. You’ve got enough energy in your Runes to advance to Rank 4, and that’s what you’re going to do. That’s the only way you survive this.”

“If I advance, can I save Мокси [she]?”

“Save? You should focus on keeping yourself from dying. Reaching Rank 4 will let you keep Рафаэль [he] from freezing you in place with his domain, but that won’t let you fight him for more than a second or two. He’s a Rank 5, and a strong one. Ranking up will give you a chance to run.”

“What about Мокси [she]?” Ли [she] demanded. “I can’t–”

“You will!” Азель [he] roared, flame coiling off his shoulders and lighting the darkness before it was swallowed by the shadows once more. “You are a demon. Beyond all else, we persevere. I do not know where you got this damn fool notion of sacrifice in your head, but the Damned Plains have no room for sentimental idiots. Rank up. Now. Otherwise, sit around and watch Мокси [she]’s throat get slit and then die afterward yourself.”

If I’m Rank 4, I have a fighting chance. It might be enough to catch Рафаэль [he] off guard for even a second, and that could give me time to grab Мокси [she] and make a run for it. It’s my only choice. I don’t have another one.

Азель [he] was saying she’d save herself, but Ли [she] wasn’t so sure there would be anything of herself left to save after she reached Rank 4. Advancing and forming the Rank 4 Rune would very likely be the last time she was ever truly herself – but if she could hold on for just long enough to get Мокси [she] and the others away from Рафаэль [he]…

“Fine,” Ли [she] said, swallowing heavily. “Let’s do it. Will you help me?”

Азель [he]’s smile was cold. “What do you think I’ve been waiting this whole time for? I will aid you. You know your emotion, I trust? This isn’t going to work if you don’t.”

Ли [she]’s hands clenched at her sides. “I do.”

“Then gather your Runes and become what you were always meant to be,” Азель [he] said, his lips peeling apart in a hungry smile. “And have no fear, Ли [she]. We will take our toll on this fool. Once we get out of here, I assure you we’ll return and rip this Inquisitor apart one nerve at a time. We will do it together, you and I.”

Азель [he] lifted a hand into the air, curling his fingers into a fist. Ли [she]’s mindspace trembled as power arced through it and her Runes rose up, the shadows constraining them stretching as they tried to keep their grasp on the power.

“You only have seconds,” Азель [he] warned. “But time is meaningless to us, Ли [she]. Demons are instinct. We know what we are. There is nothing that can ever change that. All you need is an instant to open the floodgates. Your emotion will guide you. Accept it.”

Ли [she] closed her eyes, letting the energy from her Runes pulse through her mind. Then she brought her hands together, pulling the Runes closer. They were all full – they had been for a while.

Like Азель [he] said, the power was there. It lay in wait, prepared to give her what she sought and take everything she cared about in return. There was only one thing left to do.

She reached out and took it.

***

Мокси [she]’s magic was failing. All the vines in the world couldn’t have helped her when she simply didn’t have the power to penetrate Рафаэль [he]’s domain. Her entire body was locked hopelessly in place and her magic couldn’t so much as twitch.


Damn it all. If I hadn’t gotten my Runes shattered at the Торрин [he] Estate, I’d be Rank 4 by now. I can’t die like this. I’ve come too damn far.

Мокси [she]’s thoughts did nothing to slow Рафаэль [he]’s advance. He didn’t look like he was in a talkative mood. He raised his sword, striding toward her with murder in his eyes. Мокси [she] desperately fought against the bonds of his domain, but it was absolute.

There was nothing a Rank 3 could do within it. She couldn’t so much as grit her teeth. Helpless disappointment and anger swirled within her chest, closing around her heart like the hand of the reaper.

I keep hoping that someone is going to pop out in time to save me, but I think I’m all out of that. Fuck. I’m sorry, Ной [he]. I hope you don’t kill too many people because of this.

Рафаэль [he] reached Мокси [she] and reared back, his muscles tightening as he prepared to swing.

I’m going to enjoy watching you get your shit beat in from the afterlife. If your domain lets up for even a second as I die, I swear I’m going to take you with me.

Out of the corner of her eye, Мокси [she] saw a massive ice arrow streak through the air – and completely evaporate the instant it entered Рафаэль [he]’s domain. Evidently, Эмили [she] hadn’t followed her orders.

The blade blurred toward Мокси [she]’s neck, and she was denied even the option to squeeze her eyes shut and avoid the end. In a way, she was just fine with that. Мокси [she] met Рафаэль [he]’s gaze, hoping he could see the derision within her eyes.

And then Рафаэль [he] vanished. His sword spun through the air and embedded itself in the ground behind Мокси [she]. An instant later, a crash echoed through the Windscorned Plateau. Мокси [she]’s body slipped back under her control and she spun to see that Рафаэль [he] drop down from a small crater he’d made in the cliff face.

“She’s mine,” Ли [she] hissed, but there was something off about her voice. It came out overlaid, as if two people were speaking at once. “They’re all mine. You can’t have them. They’re mine !”

Рафаэль [he] rose to his feet, wiping the blood from his lips and pulling his lips back in a snarl. The blood on the ground around him rose up, forming into a pair of twin blades in his hands. “Advancing at the last second to use the burst of power to temporarily match up with me? Not enough, demon. Not nearly enough.”

Рафаэль [he] blurred, and Мокси [she]’s body slammed to a halt once again before she could take so much as a step. He reformed beside Мокси [she], his sword swinging — and a red blur slammed into him. A loud crack echoed out as his chin shot up, blood spraying from his mouth. A second blow drove into his stomach and sent him tumbling across the ground.

For the briefest instant, Мокси [she] saw Ли [she] – but the woman that stood before her didn’t look like Ли [she] at all. Two jagged horns had ripped out of her forehead, curling up around her skull. Smoldering flame raced across them and throughout her hair, traveling down her arms and dancing across her knuckles.

Her fingers had sharpened to black claws, and her teeth had grown from pointed to full on fangs. But, beyond all of it, there was a deep, desperate hunger burning behind her eyes. It was a hunger that Мокси [she] recognized – and it was more than just Ли [she].

Азель [he].

“What is this?” Рафаэль [he] wheezed, staggering to his feet. The blood swirled around his body, forming into armor. He wasn’t playing around anymore. “It’s impossible. A demon at Rank 4 can’t have this much power. Not even with a rank up. What are you?”

Ли [she] vanished in a puff of soot and flame, reappearing before Рафаэль [he] and driving her claws for his throat. This time, Рафаэль [he] wasn’t caught off guard. He spun one of his swords, knocking Ли [she]’s arm to the side but failing to cut her.

He drove the other for Ли [she]’s chest, but she vanished before the blow could connect. Reforming behind Рафаэль [he], Ли [she] sent a brutal spinning kick for the side of his head. He spun out of the way, then let out a roar.

The blood surrounding him erupted, driving out toward her in jagged points. Several of them carved into Ли [she]’s flesh before she could disappear once more. Мокси [she] tried to move, but Рафаэль [he] had her within his domain once again.

All she could do was watch through gritted teeth as Ли [she] flashed and spun around Рафаэль [he], desperately trying to kill him. But, with every movement, Мокси [she] could see Ли [she]’s strength reducing. She’d used up the huge burst of power that had come with her rank advancement. Even though she still had far more strength than she should have, Рафаэль [he] was taking control of the fight back.

“I will study you,” Рафаэль [he] hissed, driving a fist into Ли [she]’s stomach and sending her flying back. She spun, landing on her feet and skidding across the dirt. Her fangs parted in a snarl and she flashed toward Рафаэль [he] again – only to be met with a blast of concentrated blood. Even as it sent her flying, one of Ли [she]’s claws shot out. It caught on Рафаэль [he]’s jaw, ripping a deep furrow down across his neck.

Ли [she] hit the ground on her back, hissing in pain. She tumbled, bouncing once before managing to catch herself with her claws. Blood streaked her face and her chest rose and fell with desperate breaths.

The blood pouring from Рафаэль [he]’s wound slowed. It should have been a borderline mortal wound, but the bastard was cheating – he was literally keeping the blood in his body. Рафаэль [he] reached up to his neck, then cursed.

“I made the right choice in coming,” Рафаэль [he] snarled, thrusting a hand into his pocket and pulling out a glass vial. “A creature such as yourself must not be allowed to grow any further. I can’t believe a newly made Rank 4 pushed me this far, but the fight ends here.”

Рафаэль [he] clapped his hands together, shattering the vial. As he pulled his palms apart, his blood swirled together with whatever had been in the vial. Energy crackled at his palms and Мокси [she]’s skin prickled, even from as far as she was.

The energy between Рафаэль [he]’s palms seemed far too powerful for even a Rank 5. Ли [she] recognized it as well, but she couldn’t get close to the Inquisitor. Blood swirled around him, carving through the ground in a tornado of sanguine blades.

“You should feel honored,” Рафаэль [he] said, gritting his teeth as blood started to trickle from his eyes. “I’ve never had to use a bloodline curse on a demon before, but I refuse to let a creature such as yourself roam this plane. The damage could be irreparable if you continue to draw breath.”

“I’m going to consume you.” Ли [she]’s horns burned with dark flame. “You won’t take them from me. Nobody will.”

“There won’t be anything left of you to take from,” Рафаэль [he] replied. His teeth grit in concentration as he tried to contain the power swirling between his palms, but it was too much to handle. The ground shook beneath his feet and it looked like it was drawing every ounce of power he had just to keep from falling. “I’m not stupid enough to take any more chances.”

“As if I’ll let you hit me with that,” Ли [she] said with a bark of cold laughter that sounded completely uncharacteristic for her. “You can barely aim. The moment you release that magic, you die.”

“I know your emotion, Glutton. And I know how you feel about those who belong to you. You’re fast enough that I’d never be able to land this on you anyway. But I don’t need to land anything when you’ll do it for me.” Рафаэль [he] turned – not toward Ли [she], but toward Мокси [she].

He released the magic that had been gathering around him, sending an arrow of screaming blood carving through the air toward her with a howl of magical energy. And, for the second time that day, Мокси [she] could do absolutely nothing but watch as death screamed her name.

Chapter 375: The Worst Demon

Рафаэль [he]’s magic was fast. Still, if it had been headed straight for Ли [she], she was confident that she could have dodged out of the way. But it wasn’t headed toward her, and with the fuzzy swirl of her newly formed Rank 4 Rune pounding in her head, Ли [she]’s thoughts were a muddled mess.

There was only one thing that she still knew as a fact – and that was Мокси [she] wouldn’t survive the powerful blood arrow screaming toward her. Ли [she]’s skin prickled just from her proximity to it, and every single one of her senses screamed at her to turn tail and flee.

She could feel Азель [he] pulling at her body, desperately yelling something in the back of her mind, but Ли [she] barely even registered him. His words were a droning hum, drowned out by the immense rush of incomprehensible thought and hunger.

Out of the muddled mess, only a single thought managed to take form. And, amusingly enough, it was driven entirely by the sole emotion that Азель [he] had been pushing her to embrace ever since they’d met.

She’s mine. Nobody can have her.

Ли [she] blurred, slamming into Мокси [she] and shoving her out of the way. She’d had plans to continue on, diving out of the way of the blood magic and letting it hurtle past both of them harmlessly, but she wasn’t that much faster than Рафаэль [he].

The bolt drove into Ли [she]’s shoulder. She braced herself for a blast of pain or agony, but nothing happened. Instead, the magic vanished within her, disappearing as if it had never been there. Ли [she] took several stumbling steps, catching herself as Мокси [she] rolled across the ground before her, unable to stop herself while within Рафаэль [he]’s domain.

“Game’s over,” Рафаэль [he] said, letting his hands drop and bracing them against his knees with a pained laugh. “I win.”

Ли [she] tilted her head to the side. She looked down at her body, then back up at Рафаэль [he]. The relief in the Inquisitor’s eyes flickered, then faded as his eyes widened. “How are you still standing? I poured every ounce of power I have into that. You can’t–”

Heat blossomed in Ли [she]’s chest. She doubled over as magic erupted from her body, roaring through the air in a current of crimson fire. The rest of Рафаэль [he]’s sentence was lost to the crackling flame as Азель [he] snapped into existence beside Ли [she], embers rising off his black suit.

“No,” Рафаэль [he] breathed, taking a step back. His back hit the stone cliff, but his eyes never left Азель [he]’s form. “Two demons. But how–”

Азель [he] blurred. Fire streaked across the ground as he shot toward Рафаэль [he]. Blood swirled up around the Inquisitor, starting to form into a shimmering barrier, but Азель [he] crashed straight through it. His fist shattered Рафаэль [he]’s magic and he grabbed the Inquisitor by the hair, lifting the man into the air.

A loud crack followed by a wet squelch ripped through the air. Рафаэль [he]’s arm spun to the side, splattering to the ground behind Азель [he]. The rosary slipped from useless fingers and slid across the grass beside it.

“Well done, Inquisitor,” Азель [he] spat, hatred and fury bubbling from his words. “You found me.”

Рафаэль [he] opened his lips to say something, but Азель [he] denied him the opportunity. The demon’s hand slammed into the Inquisitors face with a loud crunch. Fire erupted around the two of them, swirling up into the air before abruptly snapping out of existence.

The Inquisitor’s body dropped to its knees, then pitched forward, a large hole running through his head. The body hit the ground with a wet squish and didn’t move again. Not even a Blood Rune could save someone when their entire brain had been pulverized.

Мокси [she] scrambled to her feet, raising her hands defensively as Азель [he] turned. His suit smoldered, the ends of his lapels starting to burn away. Ли [she] squinted at him, the world fluctuating around her.

The Rank 4 Rune was still shifting her body. She couldn’t tell what was changing, but there was an undeniable sense of… loss. Something that had once been there was gone, and more was fading with every passing second.

Мокси [she] was alive, though. The kids would be fine. The Inquisitor was dead. That was what she’d wanted. It had been the trade she made. It had been inevitable. There was no way for a demon to advance beyond embodying their emotion.

Ли [she]’s face felt wet. She lifted a hand, wiping away a tear streaking down the side of her cheek. A frown crossed her lips as she stared at the water on her finger.

Why am I crying?

Азель [he] stepped up to Ли [she], the ashes swirling off his body enveloping them like the setting night. Мокси [she] yelled something, but Ли [she] barely even noticed it. Мокси [she] wasn’t the only thing she needed.

There was so much in the world. She’d never thought about it properly before – but the world was beautiful. The plants were lush. The sky was vibrant and blue, and everything between it called her name.

They were hers to take. They belonged to her. Everything belonged to her. All of it but Азель [he]. He was a pillar of sickly fire, a power that was beyond her grasp. She couldn’t take his power – but that only made her want it more.

Ли [she]’s tongue ran along her lips as her eyes darted around, trying to find a way she could rip the energy from the demon. There had to be a way to claim it. A way to –


Азель [he]’s hand moved before Ли [she] could react. His fingers dug into her shoulders and the ashes pouring off his body grew thicker, plunging the two of them into a deep murky fog. Ли [she] could only just barely still see Азель [he] by the smoldering flame that curled off his body.

Before she could rip herself free from the other demon and try to drive a hand through his throat, a dull pang rang through her soul. Her Rank 4 Rune bucked, then shuddered. The power pouring out of it and into Ли [she]’s body ground to a halt.

“Stupid, gullible girl,” Азель [he] said, but it lacked the usual molten heat that his words carried. It sounded – off. Garbled, as if he were speaking through a layer of water. “You used my

Demon Runes to form this, and you dare thing about trying to use it against me? This is my Rune as much as it is yours.”

Ли [she]’s mouth worked, but the enormous hunger that had brought her into its grasp seemed to have abated. Or, more accurately, it seemed to have been stolen. She could still feel it, burning at the corners of her mind and frothing at the mouth to be released, but Азель [he] was holding it back.

At least for a few more seconds, Ли [she] was herself once more.

“Is this it?” Ли [she] asked, her voice wavering. “I don’t want to die.”

“You aren’t going to die,” Азель [he] growled. “You are becoming greater. You have so much potential. With Вермил [he]’s help, your Rune is flawless. A flawless Demon Rune, Ли [she]. Do you understand what you represent? You can become the most powerful demon in history. Do you not realize what I’ve been doing for you? I have paved the path. I gave you the seeds and watered them until they sprouted. All you have to do is continue.”

“I don’t want to be the most powerful demon in history,” Ли [she] said. “I just want to be Ли [she].”

Азель [he]’s fingers dug deeper into Ли [she]’s shoulders as his eyes bored into hers. The fire within his eyes flickered for a second and he doubled over, releasing one of her shoulders and coughing into his fist.

“You are an idiot,” Азель [he] spat, wiping his mouth with the back of a hand. Ли [she]’s stomach clenched as the hunger in her mind tried to push forward again, but Азель [he]’s presence walled it off. He was suppressing the Rune. “I gave you everything, and you reject it?”

“Why don’t you just take it yourself?” Ли [she] demanded. “Ной [he] probably would have given you a flawless Rune if you’d just left us alone!”

“I was going to!” Азель [he] roared, his eyes flaring with flame. He drew in a ragged breath, containing himself before speaking again. “I set everything up perfectly. You took my Runes like a trusting little fool, and I wormed my way farther and farther into your soul with every day. The moment you reached Rank 4, I should have had a Flawless Rank 4 Rune. All the potential that Ной [he] had put into you would have been mine.

”

“And?” Ли [she] demanded. “Why don’t you do it, then?”

Азель [he] let out a bark of laughter. “You can’t bait me into doing anything, Ли [she]. I’m hundreds of years your superior in everything, and that includes manipulation. Do you really think that losing the Rank 4 Rune will let you have a chance of remaining as you are? You wouldn’t survive.”

“It’s a chance. You want the Rune. I want to stay the same. Take it!”

“No,” Азель [he] said, grinding his teeth. “I will not.”

“Why not? I thought you wanted–”

“I did.” Азель [he] cut Ли [she] off with another bitter laugh. “Until you went and ruined everything.”

“What? What are you talking about?”

“Your gods damned delusions,” Азель [he] spat. Another spasm racked his body and he coughed, but he ignored it and pressed on. “You are, without a doubt, the worst demon to have ever lived. You took everything that we should be and twisted it.”

“I think you got hit on the head. Just take my Rune–”

“What is Gluttony to you?” Азель [he] shook Ли [she] by the shoulders. “Tell me!”

“It’s protecting what I love!”

“Wrong!” Азель [he] hissed. “It is loving the feeling of getting more. It is the endless hunger for more. That is what you should have – but your stupid delusions were so strong that you twisted the damn emotion into some perverse… human feeling. Something that we should not be corrupted by.”

“I don’t care about any of this,” Ли [she] said. “The Rank 4 Rune was turning me into what you’re talking about. So, if you take it, you’ll have what you want.”

Азель [he]’s snarl slipped away, turning into a defeated laugh. “I don’t want it anymore, Ли [she]. Your delusion ruined more than just your potential. It ruined my own.”

He reached down to his burning suit, pulling it to the side. Thick lines of red wound through his body, pulsing with sickly energy. They wound around his chest and up toward his neck, turning the skin around them a dull grey.

“What is that?” Ли [she] asked.

“You are such a little shit. It’s the bloodline curse that you jumped in front of. The one that would have killed you instantly if it had connected.”

Ли [she] stared in shock. “You took the hit for me? Why?”

“I don’t know,” Азель [he] said, looking down at the magic carving through his body one inch at a time. “I suppose I may not have been the demon I thought I was. My emotions are Lust and Hatred. I betrayed them. Perhaps this is an apt punishment.”

“I still don’t understand. What are you talking about?” Ли [she] said, squinting at Азель [he].

“Why do you think I let you live when you followed me through the portal in the Scorched Acres?” Азель [he] asked abruptly. “Did you really think you snuck through without my knowledge?”

“I thought you just didn’t care.”

“If only. No. I knew you were there, because I held the portal open for you,” Азель [he] said. His face twisted in a grimace as the blood magic winding around him reached his neck and started to crawl toward his chin. “You were always a poor demon. I had hoped that entering the mortal plane would be the boost you needed.”

Ли [she] stared at Азель [he] in disbelief. “What?”

“When I realized just how worthless were, I decided to harvest your energy once I escaped Ной [he]’s body,” Азель [he] continued with a wry smile. “At least, that’s what I told myself. That’s how I justified giving you my own Runes. It’s why I transferred myself into your soul, even though Ной [he] could have been convinced to perfect my own Runes in exchange for leaving you alone. I suppose that excuse doesn’t work anymore, does it? I can’t take anything when I’m dead.”

“Why didn’t you ever say anything?” Ли [she] demanded.

“Does it matter?” Азель [he] asked. He coughed, then ground his teeth. “Not anymore. You are not the demon I wanted you to be – and you never will be.”

Азель [he] raised his hand, grabbing one of Ли [she]’s horns. Then, with a sharp jerk, he snapped it. Ли [she] let out a pained scream as agony raced through her body, but Азель [he] held her in place with his other hand.

Molten lines of pain ripped through her body, winding through her head. They wrapped around the Rank 4 Rune in her soul, digging into it like jagged knives.

“There. That won’t last forever, Ли [she]. Become more than just a mere demon,” Азель [he] said, a smile flickering across his lips despite the pain in his features. “I want the legends of my daughter to travel so far that I still hear them. It’ll give me something to think about in that line of Ной [he]’s.”

“Wait. You can’t just–”

“Odd,” Азель [he] breathed. The blood magic wound up his cheeks and he tilted his head to the side, his eyes staring straight past Ли [she]. “This isn’t an emotion I recognize. It feels… warm.”

Cracks raced through Азель [he]’s face. His body collapsed, crumbling in on itself. The ash that had been swirling around them twisted into a pillar and dissipated with a gentle pop, leaving only Ли [she] to greet the light as day returned.

Chapter 376: Demons Are...

“Ли [she]!” Мокси [she] rushed over to the demon’s side. “Are you okay? What happened? Where’s Азель [he]?”

Ли [she] stared at the spot where Азель [he] had stood. The only thing that remained of him was a slightly scorched patch on the grass. She wasn’t so sure she actually knew the answer to Мокси [she]’s question.

The power of her new Rune hummed in the back of her mind, restrained by the other demon’s last act. With every passing second, the Rune relinquished more of its grip on her. It had still changed her body, but it had been stopped before it could progress any farther.

I don’t even know what its name is, and I don’t know if I want to. It feels like the more I learn about it, the stronger it’ll get.

“Ли [she]?” Мокси [she] asked again, taking her gently by the shoulders. “Are you with me? Did you get hurt?”

“I – I’m fine,” Ли [she] managed. Her lips felt dry and parched and speaking hurt her throat. The vestiges of pain from Рафаэль [he]’s rosary still wound through her body, reminding her of just how close they’d all come to death. Numbness gripped her as her mind tried to piece together everything that had just happened. Everything that she’d learned. “Рафаэль [he] is dead, right?”

“Most certainly,” Мокси [she] said with a concerned expression. “What happened to you, Ли [she]? Did this all come from ranking up?”

Ли [she] reached up to her head, running a finger along the horn that Азель [he] had broken. It was rough to the touch and warmer than she’d expected. They were a bad idea to keep out in public. It was basically an advertisement as to what she was.

It should only take a moment to remove them.

Her brow furrowed – and nothing happened. Ли [she] blinked, touching the horns again to make sure that she hadn’t imagined it, but they were right where they’d been a second ago. Her brow creased even further in concentration as she focused on her skull.

Almost reluctantly, the horns sank into her skull and vanished from sight. They were far from gone, though. Instead of sinking into her body and turning into mass that she could manipulate, Ли [she] could still feel them waiting to burst free once more.

“How did you manage to defeat Рафаэль [he]?” Мокси [she] asked. “And what was with Азель [he]? I thought he should be with Ной [he].”

“He’s been with me recently,” Ли [she] replied. “Азель [he] helped me kill Рафаэль [he].”

“I suppose that makes sense. I don’t imagine he likes Inquisitors much. We got lucky. Again.” Мокси [she] let out a relieved sigh. Her skin was paler than usual, and Ли [she] saw some of the stress she felt reflected in the other woman’s eyes. “I get the feeling Азель [he] is going to lord that over us for a long time.”

“He isn’t,” Ли [she] said. Her words caught in her throat, but she wasn’t entirely sure why. She hadn’t known Азель [he] that well. She’d barely known him at all. They’d spoken a few times, but he’d always just encouraged her to do the exact opposite of the right thing.

Why did he die for me?

“Are you sure?” Мокси [she] asked doubtfully. “He doesn’t seem like the type to–”

“He’s dead,” Ли [she] said. “He died blocking the last attack from Рафаэль [he]. It was really strong.”

Мокси [she] did a double take. “Азель [he]… is dead? He died for you? Why?”

Ли [she] couldn’t bring herself to voice what Азель [he] had told her. Her head felt like a twisted mess of spaghetti, but even in the confusion and exhaustion, it felt like Азель [he]’s final words had been for her ears alone.

“I don’t know,” Ли [she] said. It wasn’t a complete lie, but it definitely wasn’t the truth. A small, distant part of her mind felt a flicker of amusement. Азель [he] probably would have approved of her answer.

If Мокси [she] suspected anything, she didn’t let it on. She just nodded, then put a hand on Ли [she]’s shoulder and pulled her into a gentle hug before releasing her once more. “You’re okay?”

“For now,” Ли [she] said. “My new Rune is dangerous. I don’t know if I’ll be able to stay myself. You saw what happened in the fight, right?”


“We’ll figure something out,” Мокси [she] promised. She looked over her shoulder to Александра [she] and Эмили [she], who both stood at the bottom of the cliff but far enough away from Ли [she] and Мокси [she] to give them some privacy.

They headed over the moment Мокси [she] turned her attention toward them, giving Рафаэль [he]’s body a wide berth.

“You’re a demon,” Александра [she] said, her features unreadable. “That was an Inquisitor you just killed, wasn’t it?”

Ли [she] considered trying to lie, but she was too tired to come up with something that would have been even remotely believable. She half hoped that Мокси [she] would cover for her, but coming up with a lie that could somehow completely deny everything Александра [she] and Эмили [she] had just seen with their own eyes felt impossible.

But, before Мокси [she] could say anything, Эмили [she] shrugged. “Does it matter?”

Александра [she]’s eyes flicked to Эмили [she] before shooting right back to Ли [she]. “Why wouldn’t it? Demons are–”

“That’s Ли [she], though,” Эмили [she] said. “Изабель [she] and Тодд [he] told me Inquisitors came for Ной [he] before, and they tried to kill everyone, not just him. This is the second time they’ve come looking for trouble. They can only blame themselves for finding it.”

“But–”

“I mean, even an idiot could have told there was something weird with Ли [she],” Эмили [she] said, crossing her arms. “I’ve been around her for a lot longer than you have, and she never once did anything that made me feel like I was in real danger – aside from a few of the stretching lessons. I don’t care what she is.”

A flash of warmth swirled in Ли [she]’s chest. Эмили [she] hadn’t doubted her for a second. The warmth was quickly quashed as a thought slipped unbidden into Ли [she]’s mind.

Maybe she should doubt me. If Азель [he] hadn’t restricted my Rune, I would have become the exact thing that everyone thinks I should be. If I can’t find a way to fix this, I’m going to be a danger to everyone. The Inquisitors would be right in trying to kill me.

“Wow,” Мокси [she] muttered under her breath. “I didn’t expect she’d get over it that quickly. Now I feel like an asshole for causing such a scene with Ной [he] about you.”

“You knew?” Александра [she] asked, her mouth agape, overhearing Мокси [she]. “I don’t understand. Aren’t demons all evil? I thought they only came to this world to kill and feast on human emotion. Why is Ли [she] just… teaching a class?”

“Ли [she] isn’t an average demon,” Мокси [she] said. She walked over to Рафаэль [he]’s corpse and a vine twisted out of her pant leg, winding around the rosary laying by his severed hand. It picked the bone beads up and tucked them into Мокси [she]’s bag. “Эмили [she] is right, Александра [she]. Ли [she] wouldn’t hurt any of us. She’s just trying to live. No different than a certain former criminal.”

Александра [she]’s mouth clicked closed and she winced. She sent one last concerned look in Ли [she]’s direction, then bit her lower lip and sighed. “I find that hard to believe, but I suppose that’s also a little hypocritical of me. Does this have anything to do with all the people that were dying?”

“No,” Ли [she] said, finding her voice again. “It’s separate. Inquisitors have been after me for a long time. I thought they’d stopped, but I guess I thought wrong. The other issue is… separate.”

“And likely solved for the time being,” Мокси [she] added. “Though we should keep that to ourselves until we figure out what the future holds. This could have gone really, really poorly. We’re all lucky to be alive – and that reminds me. I ordered both of you to run.”

“I’m not leaving you to die,” Эмили [she] said, setting her jaw and matching Мокси [she]’s gaze.

“I think Вермил [he] would have killed me himself if I just ran off while you got killed,” Александра [she] added.

“He would not have,” Мокси [she] said. “I don’t want my students throwing their lives away for me. That’s not how this works.”

“Then you should have been stronger,” Александра [she] said.

Мокси [she] blinked, then let out a burst of surprised laughter. It was a mixture of genuine amusement and relief from still being alive, all boiling up now that the threat was gone. Мокси [she] quickly got a hold of herself and shook her head.

“You might have a point, but I don’t want to hear it from you. I’m working on it. I’ve been… delayed.”

Мокси [she] held her hand out and vines twisted out from beneath the ground, binding Рафаэль [he]’s body and dragging him beneath the earth. They tilled the ground around him, making sure every single piece of land around where he’d fallen had been drawn deep beneath the earth.

“I’m not sure I’m in the right state of mind to practice anything else right now,” Эмили [she] said as she watched the last traces of Рафаэль [he] vanish. She swallowed heavily, then stuck her hands into her pockets, hunching her shoulders. “I want to go back to bed.”

“Me too,” Ли [she] said. “I’m exhausted. We’re stuck here until the transport cannon reactivates, though. I–”

A flash of blue carved through the air. Ли [she]’s eyes widened and she dropped into a fighting stance, all the exhaustion vanishing in an instant. “Get out of here. Someone just used the transport cannon.”

“Damned Plains,” Мокси [she] cursed, summoning vines from the ground to rise up around her as her eyes scanned the Windscorned Plateau for any sight of the new arrival. “Another blasted Inquisitor?”

“I don’t know,” Ли [she] said, sniffing the air. The wind was against them, but she could still pick up the faintest traces of something familiar. Her eyes widened. “Wait. It’s–”

A flash of purple split through the air and an enormous man stepped out, a sword of matching size rested on his shoulder. The sword was new, but Ли [she] recognized the one bearing it immediately.

“I was told there was someone flinging around blood magic over here,” Брейден [he] said, turning in a circle. His gaze lingered on Александра [she] for an instant longer than the others, but it was clear that she wasn’t trying to fight back, so he dismissed her quickly and turned to Мокси [she]. “What in the Damned Plains happened?”
