Chapter 377: Right On Тим [he]e

Ли [she]’s shoulders slumped in relief and she flopped back to the grass, too tired to stay standing any longer. Брейден [he] wasn’t going to try to kill them. At least, she was pretty sure he wouldn’t. He’d been pretty mad the last time they’d spoken, but he’d also given her some Space Runes.

“You’re late,” Мокси [she] said, letting out an explosive sigh and letting the vines sink back into the ground around her. “And I don’t think my heart is going to be able to take another surprise today. Why are you here? And I swear, if you tell me someone important is dead, I’m going to lose my shit.”

“Why would someone important be dead?” Брейден [he] asked, baffled and still glancing around in search of the blood mage. “The transport cannon operator ran me down while I was knocking on the door of Вермил [he]’s room, yelling about some blood mage attacking you.”

Тим [he]’s alive. That’s good. He smells nice. Did he really run all the way over to Ной [he]’s room to find Брейден [he], though? That’s a bit much, isn’t it? There had to be someone strong closer. I’m glad he got Брейден [he], though. He also smells good.

Мокси [she] studied Брейден [he] for a few seconds, likely trying to figure out how much she could safely share with him. Ли [she] wasn’t so sure on the answer to that herself. Брейден [he] liked them, and he’d clearly rushed over to help, but telling him everything could be risky.

He should already either know or very strongly suspect I’m a demon, though. Ной [he] called me in to the room with Father when we first met him, so it’s not a big reach to make that the Inquisition would be after me.

“It was the Inquisition,” Ли [she] said finally. There was no point trying to hide it from Брейден [he], considering he’d probably piece everything together pretty soon.

“Was?” Брейден [he] asked, blinking. “You managed to kill an Inquisitor with a domain? I was told they were probably a high Rank 4 or Rank 5. I don’t feel a domain from either you or Мокси [she].”

“We caught him off guard,” Ли [she] said. She didn’t have a domain because she was a demon, not because she wasn’t a Rank 4. And talking about Азель [he]… she couldn’t quite bring herself to do it.

Not yet.

It wasn’t like Азель [he]’s existence would change anything for Брейден [he]. All that mattered now was that Рафаэль [he] had come for them and that they’d managed to defeat him. Everything else was just extra detail.

“This gives me a sense of familiarity that I really don’t want to be feeling,” Брейден [he] said, drumming his fingers on his thigh. “Where’s the Inquisitor?”

“Buried about sixty feet beneath the dirt,” Мокси [she] replied. “Along with everything that was around him. I don’t know how they managed to track us all the way over here, but I didn’t want to take any risks.”

“Smart,” Брейден [he] said, lowering his sword and driving it into the ground. He crossed his arms over the hilt and leaned on it, letting out a sigh. “They likely tracked you with blood magic. From what I heard, there was only one of them. That’s a bit odd, as Inquisitors usually travel in pairs.”

“You think another one of those guys is going to show up?” Эмили [she] asked, her eyes widening in terror.

“Unlikely. They would have shown up by now,” Брейден [he] replied, not even looking back at her. His brow furrowed in deep thought, but he gave up after a few seconds and shook his head. “Must have been an Inquisitor acting on their own volition. Maybe a friend of the ones that showed up the last time. Either way, if you really got rid of the blood, it’s unlikely they’ll be able to track you this easily again. I didn’t think they’d be tracking you at all. Father said he’d handled it.”

“Evidently not,” Мокси [she] said, her voice going cold. “And we all nearly got killed because of it.”

“I’d offer to pass your complaints along to him, but I think we both know how that would go – especially coming from a Торрин [he].”

“Do you have a problem with Мокси [she]?” Эмили [she] asked, her eyes narrowing.

Брейден [he] let out a bark of laughter. He straightened up and pulled his sword from the ground. A ripple of purple passed over the blade and it vanished from his grip. “Surprisingly, no. My broth – ah, Вермил [he] likes her. That’s enough to vouch for her character, even if she is a Торрин [he].”

“Relax, Эмили [she],” Мокси [she] said, walking over to the girl and putting a hand on her shoulder. “Брейден [he] did literally just come running to help us.”

“He was late.”

“The thought was there.”

“Did you say that Вермил [he] was your brother?” Александра [she] asked, squinting at Брейден [he]. Ли [she] didn’t see what the confusion was. Ной [he] and Брейден [he] smelled pretty similar at first take. It was easy to tell them apart, of course, but the matching blood was there.

“Yes,” Брейден [he] said after a moment of hesitation. “We share the same father.”

“Capital or lowercase f?” Александра [she] asked.

Брейден [he] chuckled. “Both. And who would be asking? I don’t believe I properly recognize you.”

“I’m Александра [she]. One of Вермил [he]’s students.”

“A new one?” Брейден [he] asked.


Александра [she] nodded. “Yes. As of this year.”

“I see,” Брейден [he] said. He glanced at the tilled earth, then back to Александра [she]. “And you aren’t perturbed by the Inquisitor?”

Александра [she] didn’t respond immediately. She was silent for a few seconds, her features unreadable. Then she inclined her head. “I don’t suppose I am. I had a pretty bad reaction at first, but I think he had it coming, even if his original intentions might have been good. To be honest, I just want to get stronger. I don’t care what I have to do to achieve that.”

“Interesting,” Брейден [he] said. “I can see why you chose Вермил [he] as your teacher.”

“What’s that mean?” Александра [she] asked, but Брейден [he] had already turned away from her. He walked over to Мокси [she], pulling out a healing potion from a pouch at his waist and handing it to her.

“Here. Drink.”

“I’m not that wounded,” Мокси [she] said.

“Вермил [he] is going to lose his shit if he sees you hurt,” Брейден [he] said, turning away before Мокси [she] could respond. “Drink the potion.”

Мокси [she] scrunched her nose, then did as Брейден [he] asked. By the time she’d drained it, Брейден [he] had handed a matching potion to Ли [she]. She threw it into her mouth without a word of complaint – healing potions tasted like cherries, and the glass added a nice, spicy texture.

“What are you–” Брейден [he] raised a hand, then let it lower and shook his head. “Why do I even bother?”

“With what?” Ли [she] asked, swallowing the mouthful of glass and potion. “Oh. Did you want to eat the vial? Sorry. I didn’t realize. I could probably throw some of it up for you. It might be a bit digested by now, but–”

“I’m quite all right, thank you,” Брейден [he] said hurriedly. “I’m here for twelve hours, because I had no idea how long it would take me to find you guys and fight off the Inquisitor. Evidently, you’ve already handled that. How much longer until you’re pulled back?”

“Probably a few hours,” Мокси [she] replied.

Брейден [he] nodded. “Then sit down and relax. I’ll watch over you, and we can all speak once we return to Арбитраж [he] and can get in contact with Вермил [he]. I doubt I even have to say this, but if you want to remain alive, I strongly recommend nobody shares a single breath of what happened here. If the Inquisitors find out you’ve gone and killed one of their own – again – you’ll never live in peace again.”

***

“That,” Возрождение [she] said, leaning forward in her chair to stare at the shimmering image in the air before her, “was not at all what I was expecting.”

“It took me by some surprise as well,” Декрас [he] admitted from the chair beside her. He reached over to the box of chocolates on the table between them, and Возрождение [she] smacked his hand away. She took one of them for herself, throwing it into her mouth without letting her eyes leave the scene playing out before her. “Have you ever seen a demon kill itself for someone else?”

“No, I don’t believe I have. I didn’t think they had the capacity to feel like that,” Возрождение [she] admitted. “Not with the damage their Runes do to their psyche. Honestly, I feel bad for the poor creatures. Failed experiments.”

“Nothing great can come without failure,” Декрас [he] said. He snagged a chocolate before Возрождение [she] could stop him and threw it into his mouth to keep her from reclaiming it. “The girl… interesting. I didn’t think there would be two people in the same group that caught my attention.”

“Hands off,” Возрождение [she] warned. “I refuse to let your stupid acolytes destroy my only good source of entertainment in years.”

“I thought you were only keeping the thief around to study his Runes once you caught him,” Декрас [he] said with a wry smile.

“Oh, stuff it,” Возрождение [she] muttered. “I do what I want. I’m a goddess.”

“A very humble one,” Декрас [he] said with a snort of laughter. “You think the little demon will actually manage to repair her flawed Demon Rune? I don’t know if her body would even be able to handle such a change.”

Возрождение [she] shrugged. “Ной [he] has both of our Runes. He has the power to do it, if the demon can live for long enough to survive the change. Why do you ask? Feeling threatened?”

Декрас [he] let out a low laugh. “They’ve got a long way to go before they could come anywhere near threatening me. And I can’t believe you bothered to actually remember any of their names. They’re a bunch of mortals, Возрождение [she].”

“We’ve been watching them for some time,” Возрождение [she] said defensively. “And that mortal stole more of your Rune than he stole of mine. I’d think you’d be smart enough to remember his name before he steals even more of your power from right under your nose.”

Декрас [he] narrowed his eyes. “We’ll see about that. My little surprise should still be on the way. The Inquisitor was interesting, but I want to see what the thief can do, not just the demon girl.”

“Your surprise isn’t going to make it until they’re all two hundred at this rate,” Возрождение [she] said, eating another chocolate. “Can’t you move faster?”

“You’ve gotten impatient,” Декрас [he] said. “Better work on that if you don’t want to go insane.”

“Bah. It’s not impatience. Have you seen how fast they’re growing? By the time you actually get around to doing anything, they’ll be ten times stronger than what you guessed they would be and the threat won’t even bother them.”

“Do you really think I didn’t account for that?” Декрас [he] rolled his eyes. “They’ve got their hands full already. If my surprise showed up anytime soon, it would be too much for them to handle. I’ve already accounted for their growth and the time it’ll take them to deal with that Rune Хранитель [she].”

“You’re sure they’ll beat him?” Возрождение [she] raised an eyebrow. “For his Rank, he’s quite the menace. He might win, and then we’re going to lose everything. I’m not going to watch him for fun. He’s just a scurrying rat dragging around something he stole.”

“Is our own target really any different?”

“Yes,” Возрождение [she] looked away from the screen to glare at Декрас [he]. “He’s actually comprehended what he took and improved upon it. Визен [he] is just a power-hungry man with a Rune too dangerous for him to handle properly.”

“And now you’re remembering the names of the unimportant roadblocks.” Декрас [he] crossed his arms. “Did you get hit on the head, Возрождение [she]? How much attention are you spending on these mortals?”

“Oh, get over it. You’re doing the same thing, just making up your own names for everyone. If you ask me, that’s even more effort just to pretend to be more mysterious than I am.”

Декрас [he] cleared his throat, immediately telling Возрождение [she] that she’d been right on the money. “Either way, I suspect we’ll have quite the show. And, if not, I’m sure we’ll get our entertainment soon enough. The pieces are already moving, Возрождение [she]. Maybe you should focus on getting your Church closer to the scene. Right now, they couldn’t be farther from actually finding the thief.”

“And whose fault is that?” Возрождение [she] asked. “Your little temptress got in Ferdinand’s way.”

“I’d argue the opposite. Гарина [she] would have captured the little shit by now if the stupid baldy didn’t get in her way and start waving those damn sandwiches around. I swear, when I next talk to her–”

“Interfere and I’ll rip your throat out,” Возрождение [she] growled. “I want to see this play out.”

“You’ll try,” Декрас [he] said with a wry smile. “Relax, would you? Гарина [she] might not listen to me now, even if I asked her to do something. She’s always been rebellious. We’ll just let things play out and see what happens. Either way, I think we’ll have more than enough entertainment for quite some time.”

Возрождение [she] couldn’t help but agree.

She hoped Ной [he] would find a way to get out of the situation closing in around him in a way that would keep his companions alive. She’d never admit it to Декрас [he], but she was actually starting to get somewhat invested.

It would be a shame if Визен [he] killed them all.
==========
Chapter 378: Don'T Shake The Cat

Ной [he] nearly blew himself up. All things considered, it had been quite some time since he’d last mistakenly killed himself, so perhaps it had been a long time coming. But, even so, he was pretty happy with his streak of only dying when he wanted to.

The only thing that saved him from splattering as his Formations shattered and released all their magic directly on top of him was the fact that he’d been in the very final notes of the song he’d been playing when the snap tore through his mind.

Ной [he] stumbled, a wave of shock slamming into him like a stormfront and turning his fingers stiff around the bow of his violin. His breath caught in his throat, the final note turning from melodious into a grating screech.

The Formation he’d been practicing slipped away and the violin vanished from Ной [he]’s hands as he braced himself against a wall while his mind reeled and spun. For a moment, he thought that Визен [he] himself had shown up and attacked him.

But, as Ной [he] forced himself to turn in a circle and search for his assailant, his search turned up nothing but an empty room. His thundering heartbeat started to slow as he took slow breaths, gathering himself.

What the hell was that?

Ной [he] plunged into his mindspace, searching for what had happened. Natural Disaster, Разлом [he], and the Fragment of Возрождение [she] all greeted him with waves of pressure as he arrived, but nothing was off about any of them.

His eyes scanned the darkness, trying to figure out what had happened. There was no way that snap had been his imagination. It had been too visceral, too intense. Even now, he felt like a portion of his mind was… different. Empty, somehow.

And then, finally, Ной [he] realized what had changed. It wasn’t that something had happened to him . It was that something had left. The thread that had connected him to Азель [he] was gone. It had snapped, peeling away from his soul and leaving him alone in his mindspace.

For several seconds, Ной [he] stared in disbelief. He sent his senses out, trying to feel and see if Азель [he] was somehow hiding elsewhere or playing a trick on him. Ной [he] found nothing. His soul was entirely his own once more.

A grin started to form on Ной [he]’s lips, but it died as quickly as it arrived. Being free of Азель [he] was undoubtedly a good thing, but the demon wouldn’t have severed their connection for no reason. It probably meant he’d found a new host – and that had disastrous consequences.

Goddamn it. The last thing I need is Азель [he] running around with someone else wreaking havoc on the school. Don’t we have enough problems right now?

Ной [he] yanked himself out of his mindspace and returned to the real world. He grabbed his grimoire, slinging the large book over his shoulder before attaching the gourd to his hip and striding out of his room – and nearly tripping over Маскот [he] with his first step into the hall.

Cursing, Ной [he] grabbed onto the doorframe and managed to keep from falling flat on his face. He turned as Контесса [he] ran down the hall, scooping Маскот [he] up into her arms and sending Ной [he] an apologetic look.

“Sorry. He teleported out again.”

“Again?” Ной [he] asked, narrowing his eyes at the smug-looking cat. Маскот [he] was definitely more rotund than Ной [he] remembered him to be. “What has the little shit been up to?”

“Mostly just killing rats and the like,” Контесса [he] said. “He’s been really relaxed as of late. I don’t know why he suddenly ran out here.”

That seems like it might be an ill omen. Маскот [he] seems to enjoy showing up whenever things are about to go poorly. I’m not sure if that’s because he likes helping or because he likes watching, but I suspect it’s probably a mixture of the two.

“It’s fine,” Ной [he] said, shaking his head and closing the door behind him. “Have you seen Мокси [she] or any of the others?”

“Just Карина [she],” Контесса [he] replied. “Are you expecting someone?”

“I don’t think so, but you never know. Just let me know if any продвинутая группа members show up at the door, okay?”

“Advanced track?” Контесса [he]’s eyebrows rose, but she didn’t press any further. “Okay.”

Ной [he] turned to head off.

“Oh, one more thing,” Контесса [he] said. “Your pay from Arbirtage showed up. The girl delivering it looked pretty confused that I was accepting it for you, but I figured you’d rather I take it than have to go to the Office to receive it instead.”


“Much appreciated. Can you hold onto it for now? Use it for expenses or the like, I don’t really need it right now. Just don’t spend all of it.”

Контесса [he] blinked. “Are you sure?”

“It should cover some of your promised salary for a while, right? Арбитраж [he] pays peanuts anyways,” Ной [he] said with a sigh. “I’d make more money hunting two monsters and selling them for parts than I would from their pay.”

Especially since they’ve probably got me listed as a Rank 2 still, the idiots. I highly doubt the attendant at the Office actually recorded that I hit Rank 3, which is perfect for my purposes but less than ideal for the pay.

Whatever – it’s crap either way, and I’ve got a much better way to make money in the form of that noble I met at the auction. I just have to wait for someone to roll up using the abilities of the Вайолет [she] Transference Rune… whatever those would be. He said it would be easy to tell, so I’ll deal with that when I get there. For now, I need to figure out where the hell Азель [he] is.

Ной [he] waved farewell to Контесса [he] and headed out of the T building in search of the others – particularly Ли [she]. Азель [he] had been spending time with her, which meant that she was probably involved in whatever had happened to him.

I just hope everyone is safe. Where did they head off to practice? Maybe I should find Тим [he].

***

Тим [he] wasn’t in the transport cannon when Ной [he] arrived. Nobody was – the area was deserted. There weren’t any signs of a fight or indication anything had gone wrong. It was just… empty.

Growing concern building in the pit of Ной [he]’s stomach, he walked up and down the streets of Арбитраж [he] in search of someone who might know what was going on. He considered going to the Office but dismissed that thought right out the gate.

If he’d known where Сильвертид [he] lived, Ной [he] would have set off to find him. Unfortunately, he had absolutely no idea where to find the elderly soldier. Ной [he] returned to the transport cannon several times, over the course of the next few hours, the tension building within him rose.

Why don’t I have a damn way to track Мокси [she] and the others? Shit! I should have made them take my gourd with them. Then I could have just killed myself and found them instantly. Wait, that wouldn’t work. I’d show up without magic and wouldn’t be able to do anything.

Damn it. Even that would have been better than wandering around and wondering what the hell happened to everyone. Maybe I should find Изабель [she] and Тодд [he]. Where’s Джален [he] when you need him? Shit, shit, shit. What if Визен [he] showed up while they were practicing?

Ной [he]’s stressed pacing intensified as he ascended the transport cannon one more time, arriving in a now-unsurprisingly empty room. A flash of anger built in Ной [he]’s chest and he resisted the urge to kick the wall.

“Damn it!” Ной [he] snarled, spinning to head back onto the elevator, only to trip over something.

He hit the ground with a crash, rolling to his feet with a slew of curses. Маскот [he] stared at him with wide eyes, then licked his paw.

“You ornery little shit,” Ной [he] snapped, but a moment later, his eyes lit up. “Wait. You can find Мокси [she], right? Can you take me to her?”

Маскот [he] stared at Ной [he], then rolled over onto his back and scrunched his body, starting to groom his backend. Ной [he]’s eye twitched.

“I know you can hear me,” Ной [he] said. “Stop licking your asshole and help me find Мокси [she]. I’ll give you some fish, or something. I don’t know. Just find her!”

Маскот [he] paused mid-lick and glanced up at Ной [he]. Then he got back to his duties. Ной [he] ground his teeth and rose to his feet, preparing to reach down and grab the cat by the scruff of its neck. He was pretty sure there was absolutely nothing he could do to Маскот [he], but that wasn’t going to stop him from shaking the damn furball until it brought him to Мокси [she] and Ли [she].

Energy buzzed at Ной [he]’s back. He grabbed Маскот [he] reflexively and the horned cat let out a surprised yowl as Ной [he] spun toward the source of the energy, taking Маскот [he] with him.

Мокси [she] shimmered to existence at the base of the cannon’s tube, her hair frazzled and expression weary. She blinked as she spotted Ной [he] and Маскот [he].

“Ной [he]? What are you–”

The rest of Мокси [she]’s sentence was lost in a yelp as Ной [he] ran over to Мокси [she] and scooped her into a tight hug. She let out a muffled grunt into his shoulder, unable to speak through his embrace.

Маскот [he] let out an affronted hiss and batted at the back of Ной [he]’s legs before sending everyone a smug look and stepping through a portal, vanishing.

“Where’s Ли [she]?” Ной [he] asked, finally releasing Мокси [she] and taking a step back, though he kept his hands on her shoulders just to make sure she was actually there. “I–”

Another crackle filled the air and Александра [she] materialized at the base of the cannon, followed shortly thereafter by Эмили [she].

“She’s safe,” Мокси [she] said, putting a hand on Ной [he]’s chest. “How did you find out? Did Тим [he] find you?”

“Тим [he]? No, he’s bloody missing,” Ной [he] said, letting out a relieved breath. “I’ve been running all over campus trying to find out where you guys are. Wait – what do you mean by find out?”

“Someone attacked us,” Эмили [she] said, lowering her voice and glancing around the transport cannon.

“Who? Where are they?” Ной [he] demanded.

“Dead,” Мокси [she] replied. “Don’t worry. None of us got injured.”

“Визен [he]?”

“No. It was the same group that attacked you some time back,” Мокси [she] said, giving Ной [he] a pointed look. “The one that has reason to dislike Ли [she].”

“You’re kidding me,” Ной [he] said, his fists clenching at his sides. “They found us? Where’s Ли [she]?”

“Maybe I should give you the full story,” Мокси [she] said gently. “Ли [she] will be here soon. She entered the transport cannon after us, remember? And Брейден [he] is here as well.”

“Брейден [he] showed up?”

Father did say he’d send Брейден [he], but that was to deal with the Визен [he] problem, not for goddamn Inquisitors. What the hell is going on?

“Yeah. Just after everything was done,” Александра [she] said. “Мокси [she] is right, Professor Вермил [he]. Ли [she] is safe.”

Ной [he] drew in a deep breath and let it out slowly, trying to reign in his anger. Ли [she] and Мокси [she] were more than capable of defending themselves, but that didn’t make him like hearing they’d been attacked any more.

“Maybe filling me in would be for the best,” Ной [he] said. “But, before that, where is Азель [he]? Did he have anything to do with the attack?”

“No,” Мокси [she] said, a frown flickering across her lips. “He didn’t have anything to do with the attack, but he’s probably the reason we survived it. He died protecting Ли [she].”

“He what ?”

Chapter 379: I Promise

Мокси [she] convinced Ной [he] to wait until Ли [she] showed up for the full explanation of what had happened, keeping the students from sharing too much and only heightening his distress.

He was pacing back and forth in a line like a trapped tiger when Ли [she] appeared with a flash of blue at the base in the transport cannon’s tube a few minutes later – but the Ли [she] appeared wasn’t the one that Ной [he] recognized.

It wasn’t an external change. Sure, Ли [she]’s eyes were slightly sunken and an aura of exhaustion wrapped her like a heavy cloak, but she still looked like Ли [she]. That was where the resemblance ended.

Ной [he]’s domain prickled as it washed over Ли [she], swirling around her body but failing to grow close to it. He couldn’t quite put into words what the sensation was, but it almost felt like an air of hunger and desire encircled her entire body.

She reached Rank 4. Did it change her that badly? I remember how worried she was about it. If I need to, I’ll rip the Rune right back apart.

“Ли [she]!” Ной [he] exclaimed, taking a step toward her. She flinched back and Ной [he] froze in place, his features creasing with concern. “What happened, Ли [she]?”

“Don’t get close to me,” Ли [she] said. “I – I’m different. It’s not as bad as I thought it would be, but it will be.”

“Bah,” Ной [he] said. “We’ll see about that. You aren’t injured, right?”

“Only small cuts,” Ли [she] said with a shake of her head. “But–”

“That’s all that matters,” Ной [he] said, crushing the information his domain was sending him. He didn’t care if Ли [she] didn’t feel the same as she used to. As long as Ли [she]’s mind was intact and she was who she wanted to be, he refused to see her any differently.

And, if her Runes were going to stand in their way, then they’d find a way to shatter them and reform everything until Ли [she] was safe.

“Maybe I should take the kids and let you talk privately with Ли [she],” Мокси [she] said. “I think she needs someone who will understand her situation a little more, and an audience is going to make it harder for her to speak.”

“Hold on,” Ной [he] said with a frown. “Are you sure it’s safe considering what just happened? How do we know there aren’t more?”

Мокси [she] considered his question for a moment, then shrugged. “We can’t live in terror permanently, and Брейден [he] said it was only the one. I trust him. Сильвертид [he] also said he handled Визен [he]’s clones, so we should be fine.”

Ной [he] drummed his fingers against his thigh, but Мокси [she] had a point. The threats should have been handled – for the time being, at least. He couldn’t follow everyone around permanently, and Арбитраж [he] was still technically a neutral ground.

Ли [she] and I should be the only ones at risk of any attacks from normal people, and Визен [he] has been sent packing for the time being.

“You’re right. Can you stay at the room after you’re done, though? I know how you felt when Джален [he] kidnapped me, and I can’t say it’s a particularly enjoyable feeling. I was really damn worried.”

Эмили [she] made a gagging noise. “Could you do this somewhere you don’t have company? It’s gross.”

“I was worried about you too,” Ной [he] told Эмили [she].

She snapped her mouth closed and looked to the side while Александра [she] laughed.

“Just not as much as Мокси [she], huh?”

Ной [he] blinked in surprise, then chuckled. Александра [she] wasn’t the type to make jokes often, and he was pleased to see that she was relaxing at least a little, even if it was in the face of nearly getting killed.

“Let’s go,” Мокси [she] said, rolling her eyes. She herded Александра [she] and Эмили [she] onto the elevator and it rattled down, leaving Ли [she] and Ной [he] alone in the top floor of the transport cannon. It struck Ной [he] that Тим [he] was still nowhere to be seen.

“Not to delay our conversation, but do you know where Тим [he] is?” Ной [he] asked.

“He should be fine,” Ли [she] said, chewing her lower lip and staring at her hands. “Брейден [he] said that Тим [he] was the one that found him. He’s probably at the Office or something. I don’t smell any blood or fear in the area – none other than yours, at least.”


“Then this should be pretty private, at least for the time being,” Ной [he] said, stepping closer to Ли [she] despite her warning. He put a hand on her shoulder and gave it a soft squeeze. “I won’t force you to say anything, but I’m not going to sit around while you clearly suffer. What happened while you were out, Ли [she]?”

She didn’t respond immediately. For several seconds, she waged an internal battle within herself. It played out on her features in a mix of emotions that finally ended in her shoulders slumping.

“A Rank 5 Inquisitor showed up. He didn’t seem to know which of us was a demon, so he must have been following our group as a whole. The weird scent I smelled while we were at the party was him.”

“Shit. He might have been tracking me or Азель [he], then,” Ной [he] said.

Ли [she] shrugged. “Maybe. Either way, he wanted to test us. Мокси [she] attacked him, but he had a really strong domain with his blood magic that made it impossible to move while we were in it. He was going to kill Мокси [she]. I was strong enough to reach Rank 4, and it was the only way I’d be able to move inside his domain.”

“Wait, you reached Rank 4 mid fight?” Ной [he] asked, blinking in disbelief. He could still recall just how much effort and concentration it had taken to advance his Runes to Rank 4. Sure, the actual process hadn’t taken that long, but making sure that everything was set up and getting himself into the right place to do it had.

“Азель [he] helped,” Ли [she] said, a flicker of emotion that Ной [he] couldn’t place passing through her eyes. It might have been sadness, or it might have been anger. It was gone so quickly that by the time he registered it, it was gone.

“To save himself? I know he was transferring large portions of himself to you, so I suppose that makes sense.”

Ли [she] shrugged in a way that made Ной [he] suspect she didn’t agree with his guess in the slightest, but she was just too tired to come up with a better answer. He didn’t press and just remained silent, waiting for her to start speaking again.

“I managed to reach Rank 4, and that made me strong enough to move. Азель [he] wanted me to run,” Ли [she] said. “But, if I ran, then Мокси [she] would have died. I might have been able to save Александра [she] and Эмили [she], but not Мокси [she]. She was in Рафаэль [he]’s domain. So I attacked him.”

“You attacked a Rank 5? On your own?” Ной [he] asked, unable to contain his surprise. He’d fought higher tiers himself, but Ли [she] didn’t have any of the advantages that he had – and she’d been the one that had gotten attacked rather than the other way around.

“I had the boost from Ranking up. It’s stronger in demons than it is in humans because of how closely tied our bodies and souls are,” Ли [she] explained. “But… that wasn’t it. When Азель [he] realized I wasn’t running, he helped me. Filled me with magic that helped me resist the Inquisitor and hurt him.”

I suppose the aid of a Rank 5 demon, even a weakened one, would be enough to let her trade blows with a Rank 5 for a short time. But I still don’t see how she could have killed him – not unless Ли [she] is much, much stronger than I thought she was.

“I was holding him off for a bit, but I started to lose,” Ли [she] said. “So Азель [he] gave me even more of his power. The Inquisitor got scared and used something called a Bloodline Curse on Мокси [she]. I could tell it was really strong, and she couldn’t dodge, so I jumped in front of it. He thought it would kill me, so he used most of his energy.”

“It didn’t, though.”

“It didn’t.” Ли [she] nodded. “And he wasn’t ready for me to attack again, so Азель [he] and I killed him. But… the reason I lived through the Bloodline Curse was becase Азель [he] took the hit for me.”

“Shit,” Ной [he] muttered, trying to figure out what had been running through the demon’s head. Азель [he] had saved Ли [she], and it had killed him. Nothing else would have caused their connection to snap the way it had.

Why would Азель [he] do that for Ли [she], though? He could have retreated to my body.

“That… isn’t it, though,” Ли [she] said softly. “My Demon Rune was too strong, and it nearly turned me into a real demon. Азель [he] stopped it – temporarily, at least. It was the last thing he did before he died.”

If Ной [he] had been confused before, now he was completely baffled. Whoever Ли [she] was describing didn’t sound like Азель [he] at all.

“Just like that? Why?” Ной [he] asked.

Ли [she] swallowed. “Before he died, he talked to me. I – he said he was my dad, Ной [he]. And I think he was telling the truth.”

And, finally, the pieces clicked into place. Азель [he] had known about Ли [she] from the start. He’d always planned to leave Ной [he]’s mind and enter hers.

I never thought Азель [he] was the type to care about his offspring, though. I would have thought Ли [she] would have just been another tool for him. What changed? Or did he play me from the start?

It only took one look at Ли [she]’s face to tell Ной [he] that now wasn’t the time to pry. He gave her shoulder a gentle squeeze.

“It sounds like Азель [he] made his choice clear, Ли [she]. He wanted you to live – and it sounds we all owe him a thank you.”

“He’s dead,” Ли [she] said, staring at her feet. “I’ll never get to find out anything that I wanted to. He’s just gone. It doesn’t make sense.”

“He’s not completely gone,” Ной [he] said. “He gave you his Runes, Ли [she]. I’ll be honest. I don’t know why he changed, and I didn’t like the person he used to be. But it sounds like he died as someone better than what he was.”

“It doesn’t matter,” Ли [she] said bitterly. “What good is it now? He’s dead.”

Ной [he] let out a soft laugh. “Death is just the beginning, Ли [she]. It’ll be millennia before the last traces of Азель [he] are gone. We can still get you those answers.”

Ли [she] blinked. “What? How?”

“I’ve seen the afterlife, and my goals have always been to get strong enough to never fear it again,” Ной [he] said. “I’ll make it, and you will to. All of us will. Then we’ll find Азель [he] and get your answers.”

“But… what about my Demon Rune? It’s going to consume me,” Ли [she] said. “It’s only a matter of time if you don’t Разлом [he] it. Азель [he] said what he did wouldn’t hold forever.”

“Did you forget who I am?” Ной [he] asked. “We’ll find a way to fix it. One way or another, we’ll all make it. You’ll see Азель [he] again, and you aren’t going to lose yourself to your own Runes.”

“Promise?” Ли [she] asked.

Ной [he] held her gaze. “Yeah. I promise.”

Chapter 380: Don'T Eat The Potion

“Was there anything else that happened while you and the others were out?” Ной [he] asked after giving Ли [she] enough time to fully process their conversation. “Or was that the extent of the damage?”

“That’s it,” Ли [she] said. She hesitated for a second, then wrung her hands together. “Should we break my runes now? So they can’t hurt anyone?”

“Do you feel like it’s going to overwhelm you?”

“I… don’t think so, but I don’t know. I don’t know how long whatever Азель [he] did will hold, though.”

“Then we’ll take a look at it as soon as we get home with a Mind Meld potion,” Ной [he] said. “If it really looks like everything is going to fall apart, then I’ll separate it on the spot and we’ll figure out a different way for you to reach Rank 4.”

“What if it looks like it’s going to hold, then breaks later?” Ли [she] asked. “I could hurt someone.”

“Possibly,” Ной [he] admitted. He wasn’t going to deny it on the spot – that would have just been plain stupid, not to mention dismissive of Ли [she]’s feelings. “But even Азель [he] wasn’t strolling around and randomly killing people. I mean, sure, he was stuck in my head, but he feeds on emotions, not murder. And his emotions were definitely more aggressive than yours, right?”

Ли [she] nodded slowly. “I – yeah. I guess so.”

“For that matter, did you figure out what your Emotion was? What is this Rank 4 Demon Rune you made?”

Ли [she] rubbed the back of her neck, her cheeks reddening as she looked to the side. “I don’t know.”

“What? How?” Ной [he] asked. “You can’t make a Rune without knowing what it is. Can’t you just… read it?”

“I don’t want to. The more I know about it, the stronger it’ll become.”

“I’m not sure I follow,” Ной [he] said. “Your Rank 4 Rune should be made up of all the Rank 3s you put together, and you had to put them together with intent. How could you do that without knowing what Rune you were making?”

“It doesn’t work the same way for demons as it does for you,” Ли [she] explained, pausing as she searched to find the proper words. “We’re similar, initially. But the stronger we get, the more that changes. Think about it. You don’t have Human Runes, do you? They’re just Runes.”

“Yeah,” Ной [he] allowed with a thoughtful frown. “I suppose that’s true. I didn’t really think too much about it, but maybe I should have. You don’t have domains either, right?”

“Not the same way humans do.” Ли [she] nodded. “At Rank 4, our runes and our bodies become much closer. They’re two parts of the same whole. So, while humans keep their runes exactly as they are and combine them without interference, the Rank 3s that I had were more like fuel for the combination, not the only components.”

“Your body played a part as well,” Ной [he] muttered, finally realizing what Ли [she] was getting at. “It was like an 8th rune?”

“Something like that. It took the other runes and changed them into what fit me – but how do you know what that is? How do I know what that is? I don’t know what kind of rune fits me, and my body is just going to choose the one that lets me survive. That means it’s probably some kind of emotion, and obviously not a good one.”

“I could be talking out of my ass here, but that doesn’t seem like the full story,” Ной [he] said after thinking for a few seconds. “Everything I know about rune combinations tells me that they become what we tell them to be. Runes don’t have minds of their own. Are Demon Runes different?”

“No, I don’t think so. But they can affect your mind. It’s the same thing.”

“It isn’t,” Ной [he] said, shaking his head. “You still made that rune, Ли [she]. There is a part of you that desired it to be the way it is. It might not have turned out exactly how you wanted it to, but it should have still become what you wanted.”

“You mean you think I wanted to become a monster?” Ли [she]’s features crumpled. “Like it’s latent in me, or something?”

“No!” Ной [he] exclaimed. “That’s not what I meant at all. I meant you’re assuming this rune is so bad, but you don’t even know what it is. Understanding something isn’t going to make it stronger. If it’s dangerous, then we’ll find a way to control it. If it’s truly just evil and a threat, then we’ll destroy it. But don’t treat a part of yourself as… reprehensible, or whatever it is you’re picturing. You’re you. I didn’t care that you were a demon before, and I don’t particularly care now. We just have to make sure you can make it to the point where you can control yourself like Азель [he], right?”


Ли [she]’s brow furrowed in thought. A second later, her eyes went wide. Ной [he] would have laughed if Ли [she] hadn’t looked so stressed. It didn’t look like she’d registered the fact that Азель [he], despite being a Rank 5, was fully in control of himself.

Sure, he’d been an asshole, but he’d also chosen to sacrifice himself for Ли [she]. If he’d really been completely consumed by his Runes to the point where he was just a slave to his desires, it shouldn’t have been possible for him to make any decisions like that.

“You’re right,” Ли [she] muttered. “Maybe I just need to reach Rank 5.”

“Whatever it may be,” Ной [he] said with a shrug. “We’ll figure it out. Worst case, you stay at Rank 3 while we gather runes and fill them up so you can jump all the way up to Rank 5 in a single session.”

Ли [she] nodded, some of her usual energy entering her posture as a small smile pulled across her lips. “Yeah. We can do that. But… if for some reason my Rune gets away from me and I do try to hurt someone, will you make sure I can’t?”

“You don’t even have to ask, but I don’t think it’ll come to that,” Ной [he] said. He nodded to the lift in the center of the tower, which had returned shortly after Мокси [she] and the others had left. “Shall we? If you’re concerned about that rune, we should go get a Mind Meld potion and check it out as soon as possible.”

“Yeah,” Ли [she] said, stepping onto the lift. Ной [he] followed after her. It rattled away, lowering them down to the bottom floor, and they started across the grass in the direction of the market so they could buy a potion.

“By the way,” Ной [he] said. “I was told Брейден [he] showed up. Did he leave already or something?”

“No. He got sent back for a longer amount of time. It’ll be a few more hours before he gets back. I think he was expecting a really difficult fight. He kind of showed up after everything was done, though. He didn’t do anything.”

“Well, I suppose it’s the thought that counts,” Ной [he] said. “What about Тим [he]? He’s always in the tower. Мокси [she] said he was the one that ran into Тим [he], but do you have any idea where he went? Can you smell him out or something?”

“I probably could,” Ли [she] said. “His scent was really strong back in the tower, but aside from the concern he left behind when the Inquisitor first pushed past him, I can’t smell anything else. I think he’s fine.”

“Huh,” Ной [he] said, chewing the insides of his cheeks. Тим [he] had done his absolute best to save everyone’s lives. He’d been saying that he’d find a way to replace the elderly man’s runes for far too long.

Ли [she] seems confident he’s fine, so I’m going to find Тим [he] tomorrow and just straight up tell him that I’m fixing his runes. Forget hiding my abilities – the old guy is in our corner and I’m not leaving him hanging any longer.

***

Ной [he] and Ли [she] got back to Мокси [she]’s room about an hour later. They’d initially just planned to stop at the markets on the way back to get a Mind Meld potion, but the literal instant Ли [she] spotted the first food vendor, Ной [he] realized they weren’t going to be leaving without spending at least a gold or two on snacks. At least, he’d only planned to spend a few gold.

All things considered, any amount of gold was a small price to pay to get Ли [she]’s mind off what had happened. She mowed through twelve pies, a dozen hot dogs, some dead rats, and a not-so-dead squirrel that hadn’t been fast enough to avoid her watchful gaze – and that was just on the way over to the alchemist.

Ной [he]’s pockets were lightened of more coins as Ли [she] ate her way through all the vendors on the way back over to the T building. He still had no idea where she put all the weight, but he wasn’t about to ask.

The food seemed to bring Ли [she] at least a little distraction, and he didn’t want to bring her thoughts to anything possibly related to being a demon. They got back to the room and Ли [she] opened the door for Ной [he], whose arms were full of meat pies that he’d picked up for Мокси [she] whilst following the wake of Ли [she]’s tour de force.

A tiny flicker of concern passed through Ной [he] as the door opened and he didn’t immediately see anyone, but a relieved sigh replaced the worry as he finally spotted Мокси [she] at her desk, balancing on the back two legs of her chair.

She hurried to stand as Ной [he] and Ли [she] entered the room, nearly knocking her chair down. A vine shot out, grabbing the chair at the last second and straightening it before sliding it back over to the desk.

“How are you doing, Ли [she]?” Мокси [she] asked.

“Ной [he]’s gonna look at my Rune,” Ли [she] replied, sitting down at the base of the bed. “But I’m alive, and I think I should be fine.”

Мокси [she] nodded, looking over to Ной [he]. Her eyes caught on the pies in his arms. “Are those–”

“For you, yes,” Ной [he] said. “It’s probably a stupid question considering you’re just sitting here, but I have to ask – the kids made it back okay?”

“Yeah. They’re both fine. Эмили [she] is a bit shaken up, but Александра [she] was talking formations with her on the way back. That girl has been through a lot,” Мокси [she] said with a sigh. “She shouldn’t be so used to near-death situations.”

“Aren’t you only a little older than her?” Ли [she] asked.

“Oh, I already get that from Эмили [she]. I don’t need it from you,” Мокси [she] said with a mock glare. “Just because I had to live through shit doesn’t mean I want others to, you know?”

Ной [he] laid the pies out on the table and handed the Mind Meld potion to Ли [she]. She raised it to her mouth and Ной [he] grabbed her wrist. “Make sure to only drink half . No eating the glass.”

“Oh. Right,” Ли [she] said, working the first wax seal off.

Мокси [she] walked up beside Ной [he] and tapped him on the shoulder, a pie in her other hand. He glanced over to her just as she leaned in and pressed her lips to his.

“It was my turn to apologize for almost dying,” Мокси [she] pulled back and gave him a small grin. “Thanks for the pies as well. And don’t worry, Ли [she]. We’ll figure something out with your runes.”

“I know,” Ли [she] said, tipping the potion back and swallowing half of the shimmering liquid. She handed the bottle to Ной [he], who removed the second seal and sat down beside her.

“Keep watch to make sure no stupid shit happens?” Ной [he] asked.

“What else would I do?” Мокси [she] replied, rolling her eyes. “Besides, I’ve got a bunch of pies to keep me occupied. I’ll be here. Good luck.”

“Thanks,” Ной [he] said, tipping the potion back. “But we won’t need it. Ли [she]’s determination is going to be more than enough.”

A familiar buzz enveloped his mind, and then the world was gone in a swirl of color.

Chapter 381: Mix And Match

Ли [she]’s mindspace was different than Ной [he] remembered it. Inky darkness still surrounded him when he took form, strands of jet-black crisscrossing through the air around them. Where there had once been seven runes remained only a single Demon Rune. The rune was, as expected, completely unreadable to Ной [he]’s eyes. It looked like a child had been force-fed sugar and let loose with a growing crayon.

Squiggles and lines twisted around each other, pulsating with faint energy. Even though the rune was a Rank 4 – the same as Natural Disaster – a faint sense of unease settled on Ной [he]’s shoulders.

But, even if Ной [he] could have read the Rune, he wouldn’t have been able to see all of it. Thick bands of grey energy wrapped around it, faint motes of dull orange ember rising off them.

Ной [he] went to take a step and nearly tripped over his own feet. The ground felt softer and more pliable than he recalled, and he could feel his feet sinking ever so slightly into it. It took a little more effort than he’d expected to raise a foot, and tiny strands of black snapped away from it.

It’s like putty. Odd.

Ли [she] barely even seemed to notice Ной [he]’s arrival. She stood beside him, staring up at the Demon Rune with wide eyes. The faint orange-red light washing off the Rune illuminated her face in a ruddy hue.

“You okay?” Ной [he] asked, squelching over to Ли [she].

“Yeah,” Ли [she] said after a moment, not even looking in Ной [he]’s direction. She reached up to her head, massaging her temple with a pained grimace. “There it is.”

“So I can tell,” Ной [he] said. He craned his neck back, squinting into the darkness in search for the Broken Enveloping Dark Master Rune. He couldn’t seem to spot it, but that wasn’t that much of a surprise. Ли [she]’s mindspace was pitch black, and the pressure coming off the rune wasn’t enough to give Ной [he] much hesitation. His own Master Runes were considerably stronger, and it being broken probably wasn’t doing anything to help its power.

Maybe that’s for the best. I want to figure out what I can do with a Broken Master Rune and maybe fix it at some point, but Ли [she] doesn’t need more things to deal with right now. Having it weakened should go a pretty long way for reducing its power and any potential problems – but damn, it shouldn’t be this hard to find. It was a bloody Master Rune.

“Ли [she]?” Ной [he] asked.

“Yeah?” Ли [she] still didn’t pull her eyes away from the glowing Rune.

“Where’s your Master Rune?”

Ли [she] finally tore her eyes away and looked up. The frown on her lips deepened and she blinked, her features furrowing in confusion. After a second, she shook her head. “I – I have no idea. It vanished!”

She sounded as if she were half-drunk. As Ли [she] turned back to look at her Rune again, Ной [he] caught her by the shoulders and gently turned her so that her back was to it.

“Look at me,” Ной [he] said, tightening his grip slightly to keep Ли [she]’s attention. “You’re stronger than the Rune, Ли [she]. It’s part of you, not all of you. Take a deep breath and let it out slowly, then focus on me.”

Ли [she] gave him a weak nod and did as he said. Her eyes sharpened faintly and she repeated the breath, shaking her head.

“Okay. I’m here. Sorry. The rune is just so… beautiful. I want to touch it – but I don’t want to touch it either. I don’t know what will happen if I do, but I get the feeling it might get stronger and break Азель [he]’s bonds.”

“Perhaps let’s hold off on that until we figure out what’s going on,” Ной [he] said. “Remember, we’ve only got around thirty minutes to deal with this, so let’s go as quickly as possible. What’s the name of your Rune?”

“I’m not sure,” Ли [she] admitted reluctantly. Her head twitched but she caught herself before she could look back at the glowing energy. “I was so certain it was Gluttony. It would have made sense. I like eating.”

“So you do.”

“But it isn’t Gluttony,” Ли [she] said. “I know the rune for Gluttony, and that isn’t it. I don’t recognize whatever that Rune is.”

“I didn’t realize that was possible. I thought you could read Demon Runes.”


“I thought I could too,” Ли [she] muttered. “I don’t know why I can’t read it. I should be able to. It’s literally meant to represent me. How am I supposed to be represented by a rune I can’t even understand?”

Ной [he] squinted at the rune over Ли [she]’s shoulder. It really didn’t look all that different from any other Monster Runes that he’d seen. If it hadn’t been for Азель [he]’s magic binding it together, he would have assumed it was just a random powerful rune.

Is it possible that Азель [he]’s magic is actually hiding the identity of the Rune from Ли [she] to keep her from understanding it?

“That’s fine,” Ной [he] said. “Don’t stress over it. It would have been nice to figure out what the rune does, but it’s not mandatory by any means. We already know it’s powerful, so what’s more important is figuring out if it’s actively hurting you and if there’s anything we have to do to make sure it doesn’t break free.”

“Right,” Ли [she] said, but she didn’t sound particularly convinced.

“Just stay here for a second,” Ной [he] said. “I’m going to take a closer at your rune. Don’t turn around, okay? Not until I’m back, at least.”

“Okay,” Ли [she] said. “I can do that.”

Ной [he] stepped past her and approached the rune. Energy prickled at his skin and pressure built the closer he got, but his own runes were still more powerful than Ли [she]’s. Compared to Разлом [he] and the Fragment of Возрождение [she], this Demon Rune was nothing.

Ной [he] drew to a stop just before it, studying the energy wrapping it. Whatever Азель [he] had done looked pretty sturdy. He didn’t want to mess with it in risk of possibly damaging the demon’s work, but the restraints around the rune didn’t show any signs of giving in.

Energy crackled faintly along where Азель [he]’s bindings met the rune, but he couldn’t feel the energy from either the rune or its constraints weakening in any way. At least as far as he could tell, the restraints would hold for quite some time.

His primary purpose accomplished, Ной [he] took a few minutes to just study the rune itself. It was definitely more complex than the other Demon Runes that he’d seen in the past nestled within Ли [she]’s mindspace, but that wasn’t really a surprise.

The other runes Ной [he] had seen had been Rank 3s, while this was a Rank 4. But, even in comparison to his own Rank 3 and 4 Runes, the complexity of this rune felt like it was a little higher than it should have been.

I wish I could read the damn thing. Normally, this is where I’d ask Азель [he] what the hell I was looking at, but I guess I won’t be doing that anymore.

Ной [he] was surprised to find that he felt a faint sense of regret at that, and not even because of what Ли [she] had revealed. He’d always known that things were likely to end in a fight between him and Азель [he], but he’d actually started relying on the demon.

Unfortunately, regret wasn’t going to change anything. Азель [he] wasn’t around to help, which meant Ной [he] had to figure something out on his own. He couldn’t read a Demon Rune, but that didn’t mean he couldn’t try to decipher it.

Ной [he] walked around the rune, chewing the insides of his cheeks as he thought. Every rune had a pattern. That was a fundamental of nature, and the core of what his studies had revealed to him. There was no reason that demons would be an exception, so there had to be a pattern in this one as well. It wasn’t easy to find, but it had to be there.

And, as Ной [he] studied the rune, he occasionally found lines and swirls that felt like they were part of a pattern – but the thread of logic vanished into squiggles the moment he started to follow it.

The pattern just didn’t make any sense. Ной [he]’s frustration grew as minutes ticked away. Ли [she] had claimed that demons and humans were different, but he refused to believe that there was such a chasm between their races.

Magic is magic. It might be different magic, just like music and rune circles are different ways to use Formations, but I refuse to believe that demons are just random worthless squiggles while humans have nice patterns in their Runes. There’s more to it.

Ной [he] completed another loop around the rune, then came to a stop before it again. He wasn’t even sure how much time had passed now, but he still hadn’t come any closer to understanding how the rune worked.

Ли [she] had been patiently waiting for him all this time, and he didn’t want to come back to her with nothing more than a shrug and an empty promise that things would turn out all right. If he wanted to be able to tell her anything, he needed to understand.

Come on. There’s a pattern in there. I know there is. I see the traces of one, but none of them go anywhere. It’s almost as if –

Ной [he]’s thoughts ground to a halt and his eyes went wide. He walked back to the other side of the Rune, staring at it for a few seconds before making his way back over to the first side. He walked a few more circles around it, excitement building in his chest.

“I figured it out!” Ной [he] exclaimed.

“You did?” Ли [she] asked. “What is it? What did you find? You can read the Demon Rune?”

“No, not that,” Ной [he] said, rubbing the back of his neck sheepishly. “Possibly something more important, though. I know why you can’t read your Rune.”

“You do?” Ли [she]’s hands twitched at her sides as she fought to keep herself from turning around to face Ной [he]. He took pity on her and walked back over so Ли [she] could see him again.

“Yeah,” Ной [he] said. “I thought it was weird that I couldn’t find the pattern in it, you know? I mean, sure – Demon Runes aren’t the same as normal ones, but there still has to be some form of pattern in them. That’s how magic works!”

Ли [she] squinted at Ной [he]. “Please just tell me what’s wrong with my Rune.”

“Oh, right. Sorry. There’s nothing wrong with your Rune, Ли [she]. At least, I’m almost certain there isn’t. The reason you can’t figure out what the heck is going on with it is because you aren’t looking at a Demon Rune at all.”

“What?” Ли [she] asked, frowning. “How is that possible?”

“It’s the reason your Master Rune is missing,” Ной [he] said, shaking his head in disbelief. “When I was studying your Rune, I realized that the reason I couldn’t find a pattern was because there were two patterns overlaid on top of each other. You somehow merged your Demon Rune with the Master Rune, and I’ve got no idea what it left you with.”

Chapter 382: Fine For Now

“My Demon Rune… ate my Master Rune?” Ли [she] asked. She glanced over her shoulder in surprise and locked in place. Ной [he] carefully turned Ли [she] so she wasn’t looking at the rune anymore and she shook herself off like a wet dog. “I really hate that. I can’t get hypnotized every single time I look at it.”

“We’ll find a way to deal with it soon enough,” Ной [he] promised. “For now, I’m almost certain that’s what happened. The two patterns are overlayed.”

“What does that mean, though? I didn’t think Master Runes and Demon Runes were the same kind of Rune.”

“I didn’t either,” Ной [he] admitted. “I don’t actually know what this means. I suspect it probably has something to do with the fact that your Master Rune was broken. If it was whole, I don’t think there would have been any way it could get absorbed, though I could obviously be wrong.”

“Why would being broken make anything different?”

“It’s just a guess right now, but generally things want to be whole,” Ной [he] theorized. He didn’t remember all that much of his high school science classes about atoms, but he did remember that the little dots around the ones in the center tended to try to fill the layers and would then become harder to separate or change. “It’s possible that the Broken Master Rune was basically an energy magnet. It was waiting for something to attach to in attempt to fix itself, and your Demon Rune ended up filling that slot.”

“Why wouldn’t it have tried to do something earlier, then?” Ли [she] asked with a frown.

“No idea,” Ной [he] admitted. “Maybe because it was looking for a specific wavelength or amount of energy? Probably the former, because if it was just looking for energy, I’d assume it would have sucked up your normal Runes.”

“Huh,” Ли [she] said. They were silent for several seconds. Ли [she] scratched the side of her head. “Can you fix it?”

“Probably,” Ной [he] said. “But I’m not sure if we want to yet.”

“What do you mean?”

“It’s a Master Rune, even if it’s broken,” Ной [he] said. “I don’t know what happens if we use Разлом [he] on that. I mean, it can’t be viewed as a whole because it’s got broken in the name. So, if it gets chopped up, what state does it revert to? It can’t be whole either – that would be making something from nothing.”

“I – oh. Shit,” Ли [she] muttered under her breath. “I could lose it?”

“Or it could do something to your other Runes. I don’t know, but I suspect the best way to go about dealing with something like this would be to preemptively get energy that the Master Rune can absorb again the moment it gets split apart.”

Ли [she] nearly looked over her shoulder again, but she caught herself before she could turn all the way around. She shook her head and let out a huff. “So what about dealing with the problem? It could be dangerous, right?”

“Could be,” Ной [he] allowed. “But more to you than to anyone else, I think. Remember how we had that talk about how demons tend to keep their magic within their bodies and aren’t as good at projecting it externally unless they’re really strong?”

“Yeah.”

“Well, I figure this isn’t all that different. I don’t think your rune will hurt anyone at the moment, and Азель [he]’s bindings on it look pretty damn strong. As long as those are holding, I doubt this will be too dangerous. You just need to be careful yourself and avoid pulling too deeply on it until we find a way to get around to fixing everything.”

“So you think I should just keep it for now,” Ли [she] concluded.

“So long as you’re fine with it, yes. I don’t see anything about the rune itself that make me concerned for anyone’s immediate health,” Ной [he] admitted. “I think we should try to salvage the Master Rune and see what we can do in preparing to get you the Rank 4 Rune that you really want – but only so long as you don’t mind keeping this one for now.”

Ли [she] thought in silence for nearly a minute before finally giving Ной [he] a nod. “Okay. If you think it’ll be fine, then I’ll trust you. Maybe you can study it and learn more about Master Runes. I don’t know much about ‘em, but I’ve never heard of anything like this happening before.”


“Yeah, I’m definitely not going to pass up on the opportunity if you keep the Rune,” Ной [he] said. “You’re sure you’re fine with keeping it, then?”

“Yeah,” Ли [she] said, speaking more confidently now. “I don’t have a logical reason to think it’s going to be a problem right now. Not as long as Азель [he]’s bindings are holding, like you said. But, if they start breaking, I think we should remove the rune.”

“I can do that. Just keep me updated, and I’ll get some more Mind Meld potions so we can keep an eye on things as well as try to figure out what’s going on,” Ной [he] said. “Does the whole hypnotization thing only happen when you’re in your mindspace? I didn’t see you acting odd outside.”

“Yeah. Only when I see the rune, though I haven’t tried using it since the fight. I didn’t feel very hypnotized during the fight, for what it matters.”

“Noted,” Ной [he] said. “Well, I’ll keep a close eye on you and we’ll let Мокси [she] know as well so there’s no chance of anything slipping through. Don’t stress too hard though, Ли [she]. We aren’t going to let you lose yourself.”

“Thanks. Did you want to study the rune a little longer before the potion ends? Just in case we missed something?”

Ной [he] gave her a nod. He wasn’t sure if Ли [she] wanted him to research the rune because it was useful or because she was still worried about what effects it would have on her, but spending some more time trying to figure out how it worked certainly wouldn’t be remiss.

He headed back over to the rune and started studying it closer, trying to completely pull the two patterns apart in his mind. They were both incredibly complex, so it was far from simple work. Even all the time Ной [he] had spent studying and memorizing runes in the past months, it was still difficult.

It was one thing just memorizing the pattern of something he was looking at. It was a whole different problem when he was trying to pull the patterns apart, even when he recognized that there were two of them.

Whenever he started getting into a flow, he’d mistakenly start down a line that was part of a different pattern and have to start over. Тим [he]e slipped by, and he was slowly starting to make progress, but he wasn’t quite able to finish before the familiar buzz of the Mind Meld’s potion started to set in.

“Ah, damn it,” Ной [he] muttered. He took one last look at the rune, committing as much of it as possible to memory. He didn’t even have time to turn back to Ли [she] before the effects wore off and he was yanked away, sent hurtling back to his own body.

Ной [he]’s eyes snapped back open at the base of the bed beside Ли [she]. Мокси [she] had moved to lay on it behind them, a book in the air over her head. She lowered it and rolled over to watch as Ной [he] and Ли [she] shifted.

“Any luck?” Мокси [she] asked.

“Yeah. Things are fine for now,” Ной [he] said, rolling his neck to get some of the stiffness out if it. He’d evidently chosen a bad position to sit in. “It does look like Ли [she]’s Demon Rune somehow absorbed her Master Rune, though.”

Мокси [she] set the book down. “What?”

Ной [he] spent a few minutes describing everything that he’d learned to her. By the end of it, all Мокси [she] could do was shake her head and laugh.

“Ridiculous. I’m glad you’re fine though, Ли [she].”

“Me too,” Ли [she] said, her stomach punctuating her words with a loud rumble. She cleared her throat. “And I am also hungry.”

Ной [he] snorted. “At least that hasn’t changed. We’ll go get some food, then. There are a few errands I want to run while we’re out anyway.”

“What are they?” Мокси [she] asked, arching an eyebrow. “I didn’t realize you did anything other than practice or blow yourself up.”

Ouch. I don’t think this was her intention, but now that I think about it, I don’t think I’ve taken Мокси [she] on a proper date since we got together. Визен [he] might still be something we need to deal with, but I should really do something there at some point before we get so busy that I can’t.

“I want to find Тим [he],” Ной [he] said. “Maybe not today, but I want to fix his runes. He’s done too much for us to just sit around and do nothing in return.”

Мокси [she] and Ли [she] both nodded.

“I think he’s trustworthy,” Мокси [she] said. “Maybe don’t tell him exactly how you do things, but I know you’ve got more than enough runes in that grimoire of yours to share. I have no idea where Тим [he] went, though. He wasn’t in the cannon.”

“Ли [she] said it smelled like he was safe, so I’m thinking we’ll find him back to work tomorrow,” Ной [he] said. “If not, I’ll have to hunt around. But there’s another thing as well. I want to go find Сильвертид [he].”

“Визен [he] stuff?” Мокси [she] guessed.

“Yeah. I want to bring him up to speed on everything we know. I probably should have done it earlier, but I’m so used to playing my cards close to chest that I didn’t. Also, do you still have that dagger we took from Джентил [he]?”

Мокси [she] slipped out of bed and walked across the room to her shelf, taking out a small, cloth wrapped bundle after a minute of searching. “Yeah. It’s over here. I’ve had it sitting around because it hasn’t really been a priority, but I was researching it a bit ago to see if it might have anything to do with the clones. I couldn’t find any plant-related magic in it.”

“That’s fine. I want to show Сильвертид [he],” Ной [he] said. “I think it’s better to get more eyes on it. Even if he doesn’t know anything, he can show the Исполнители. Визен [he] might be too big of a threat for us to try to keep information to ourselves.”

“So long as we’re careful with who we share with,” Мокси [she] warned, handing Ной [he] the bundle. “Визен [he] already has his eye on us. We don’t need even more of that attention. Right now, he’s up against a whole lot more than just our group. No need to bring his focus in.”

“Agreed,” Ной [he] said. He slid the wrapped dagger into his bag and stood up, stretching his arms over his head and shaking his stiff limbs off. “Right. Shall we go get some food, then? After that, I’m drafting Ли [she]’s nose to help me find Сильвертид [he].”

Chapter 383: Tea For Your Troubles

After lunch, Ли [she] seemed to feel considerably better. Ной [he] wasn’t sure if she was just faking it for their sakes or not, but food did generally improve her mood. Мокси [she] – who had foolishly offered to pay for their meal – ended up spending nearly fifty gold on Ли [she]’s endless appetite.

They drew a crowd large enough that Ной [he] wished they’d charged a silver just for the show. If they had, he was pretty sure they’d have made their money back and then some. Once they all finished their food and headed off, it didn’t take long for Ли [she] to pick up on Сильвертид [he]’s scent and set off, guiding them toward the old soldier.

“I still have no idea how you can do this,” Ной [he] said as they walked. “Aren’t there so many different scents in Арбитраж [he]? How can you track down Сильвертид [he]’s so easily, especially when we don’t have anything for reference? If your nose is that strong, aren’t you constantly getting overwhelmed by information or something like that?”

“If I’m not careful, I can be,” Ли [she] said, coming to a stop at a junction in the street and sniffing at the air before turning to the left and continuing on. “But it’s not really that bad once you get used to it. Some scents are stronger than others, and you can filter them out pretty easily once you get used to it.”

“Which scents?” Ной [he] asked.

“Stronger ones.”

Ной [he]’s eye twitched before he realized that Ли [she] didn’t just mean scents that smelled more intense – she meant stronger scents.

“Like from people that are more powerful?”

“Yeah. Higher ranked people have more magic. It’s easier to track, even if they haven’t been using it too much recently. Сильвертид [he] is basically a walking stick of magic because of his leg. It’s impossible to miss him.”

“Interesting,” Ной [he] said. “What about Джален [he]?”

“He smells strong too, but he’s got some way to contain it,” Ли [she] said, pausing for a moment to think. “It’s weird. I know he’s powerful, but his smell is covered by… a blanket, I guess. It’s hard to describe, but he conceals it somehow.”

“Probably something to do with his Rank 6 domain,” Мокси [she] theorized. “When you get that strong, you get really good control over your powers. I’d be surprised if Джален [he] wasn’t intentionally reining it in so people couldn’t track him down as easily. Ли [she] probably isn’t the only person good at tracking others down.”

Ли [she] came to a stop in front of a small restaurant with an open patio, then pointed at it. “Сильвертид [he] is here.”

“Huh. That was closer than I thought,” Ной [he] said. It only took him a moment to follow Ли [she]’s finger over to a table near the edge of the patio, where Сильвертид [he] sat drinking from a ceramic cup.

Their arrival hadn’t been unnoticed. The elderly soldier raised the cup in greeting, a wry smile flickering across his lips. He took another sip as they walked up to join him.

“I’d say it’s a coincidence seeing you here, but judging by the way the little one was sniffing the air, something tells me I may have been sought out,” Сильвертид [he] said with a chuckle. “Or was it the tea? This restaurant is quite good at it. Never quite figured out what leaves they’re using, and the bastards won’t tell me. I’ve been trying to steal it for years. Give it a shot every time I come to Арбитраж [he], but they always manage to catch me.”

“We’re here for you,” Ной [he] admitted. “It’s about our plant mage problem. I’ve got some more information on him. Is now a good time?”

Сильвертид [he] took another sip of his tea, then shrugged. “Tell me, and then I will decide.”

That was enough of an agreement for Ной [he]. He took the wrapped dagger out of his bag and set it on the table before Сильвертид [he], who took yet another sip before finally setting his cup down with a slight frown.

He pulled the wrapping away from the dagger, revealing its black blade. His eyes narrowed faintly as he studied the weapon. Nearly a minute passed in silence. Finally, Сильвертид [he] moved – his hand toward the tea pot.

Сильвертид [he] poured himself another cup and, ignoring the steam rising up from the scalding liquid, took a sip from the cup without even blinking. He set it back down on the table with a soft click.

“Interesting,” Сильвертид [he] said, a sage air surrounding him.

“You know what it is?” Мокси [she] asked, leaning forward. “I’ve been trying to figure it out, but I have no clue where to even start. I’ve never seen it’s like before, but I know it’s got some form of magic in it. There are Runes, but they’re well-hidden and either broken or not normal.”


Сильвертид [he] gave her a nod. “Yes. There are.”

“So?” Ной [he] asked. “What is it? Is it useful?”

“Oh, I have no idea,” Сильвертид [he] said. “Tea just makes me feel very intelligent. I’ve never seen something like this before.”

Ной [he] coughed into his fist, trying to muffle his laugh as Мокси [she] visibly deflated. Ли [she] patted her on the shoulder.

“That said,” Сильвертид [he] continued, a wry smile passing over his features before he abandoned it in pursuit of another sip of tea, “this is useful. As you said, Мокси [she], it has some strange runework on it. How do you know it’s connected to the plant mage?”

“Because I think I know who it is,” Ной [he] said. “The mage’s name is Визен [he], and I’ve come into conflict with him before.”

That got Сильвертид [he]’s attention – but not enough to completely pull him away from his drink. He took one last sip before pushing the cup to the side and interlacing his fingers on top of the table. “Go on.”

“When I was traveling in Dawnforge with Мокси [she] and Ли [she], we ended up stumbling into a criminal underground by accident,” Ной [he] said. “Some idiots came after us and we traced them back to their base.”

“And you met Визен [he] there?” Сильвертид [he] asked, tilting his head to the side.

“No. We met someone else – his name was Джентил [he]. Real shitstain of a human. He pretended to be benevolent, but he was a psychopath. He wanted to capture Мокси [she] for some reason, and he had Александра [she] around as one of his soldiers. Визен [he] used some form of Mind Rune to force Александра [she] to do what Джентил [he] wanted.”

Сильвертид [he]’s lips pressed thin and his eyes narrowed. “Mind magic. Despicable, wretched magic. What happened to Джентил [he]? Can we question him?”

“Only if you can contact the afterlife,” Ной [he] said. “He’s dead. I sent him to kingdom come. There might be a few scraps of his flesh scattered around the remains of his base, but I doubt it. We took that dagger from him, though – and Джентил [he] revealed that Визен [he] wanted Мокси [she]. We never found out why.”

“I see,” Сильвертид [he] said. He drummed his fingers on the table, his displeasure evident. “Визен [he] has both powerful Plant Runes and Mind Runes, then. And, considering the way he was using the former, he’s focusing on magic that lets him control things from afar, without getting his own hands dirty. Do you know anything else?”

“Not much,” Ной [he] admitted. “Most of our information came from what we heard from Джентил [he] as well as a talk I had with Father. The only thing I know about his motivation is that he’s after the Торрин [he]s for some reason. They must have something he wants, but I don’t know why he’d want Мокси [she] in particular. It’s not like she’s in good standing with the rest of the family.”

“Curious,” Сильвертид [he] said. He was silent for several seconds. Then he seemed to remember that he had perfectly good tea in front of him that might risk going from scalding hot to just merely warm if he didn’t drink it, so he rectified the problem. “And Мокси [she], you can’t think of anything that may have drawn his attention?”

“Nothing,” Мокси [she] said. “I have no idea what the Торрин [he]s would have that he’d want so badly, and even if I did, I don’t see how he’d accomplish anything by attacking Арбитраж [he]. Why wouldn’t he go for Blancwood?”

“My thoughts as well. The Торрин [he]s don’t have a strong presence in Арбитраж [he], so it doesn’t make much sense if it was his end goal.” Сильвертид [he] picked up his pot, going to pour more tea, only to find that it was empty. His nose scrunched in disappointment.

“Is there anyone you know that could help with the dagger? Maybe some of the other Исполнители?” Ной [he] asked.

“Yes. Нейр [he] may very well be of use here. He’s always enjoyed studying old Runes,” Сильвертид [he] said. “I didn’t realize your group was so wrapped up with this problem, but I suppose I shouldn’t be surprised. You seem to have a talent for it.”

“Thanks,” Ной [he] said.

“That was not a compliment,” Сильвертид [he] replied. He reached into his pocket in search of something, then paused. A grimace passed over his features for a second, then faded away. He brought his hands back to rest on top of the table and let out a sigh. “If you’d be willing, I’d like you to accompany me to a meeting in three days’ time. You know enough about this that I believe the other Исполнители would benefit from speaking to you all.”

Ной [he] shrugged. “I think I’d be fine with that, especially if it keeps Визен [he] out of our hair. As much as I want him dead, I’ve also got a class to teach and a life to live. I don’t care to spend it with my skin crawling because Визен [he] could be lurking in the shadows.”

“Oh, trust me. I know what you mean,” Сильвертид [he] said darkly. He pulled the top of the tea pot off and peered into it, reaching in and pulling out a small pinch of leaves to rub between his fingers in thought. “This will be helpful. We haven’t had any good leads before, but the dagger changes things. Thank you for bringing it to my attention. Do you mind if I hold onto it for a short while?”

Ной [he] glanced to Мокси [she], who shrugged.

“Sure. I don’t want the stupid thing. Just let me know if you figure anything out.”

“I will. Say, have you ever eaten at this restaurant before?” Сильвертид [he] asked.

“No, I don’t think so. Why?” Ной [he] asked.

“You really should. Their tea is fantastic. It can be a little expensive, though,” Сильвертид [he] said. He brought the pinch of leaves toward his pocket, still nodding.

The door to the restaurant flew open and an elderly woman skidded out, thrusting an accusatory finger toward Сильвертид [he]. “No! Hands off the leaves, thief!”

“I’ll see you in a few days!” Сильвертид [he] flew from his chair, vaulting over the patio’s railing and sprinting off, his cane clutched at his side. The old woman didn’t even flinch. She sprinted after Сильвертид [he], hurling curses as she gained on him. The two of them turned a corner down the street, then vanished – though the old woman’s voice marked their position as they faded into the distance.

A polite cough caught Ной [he]’s attention as he turned, still baffled, to find a neatly dressed waiter standing at their table.

“The tab for today’s meal still hasn’t been covered,” he said. “Сильвертид [he] said he knew you, and I’m afraid I need someone to pay for the meal.”

Ной [he]’s eye twitched.
