Chapter 411: Infinite Void

Ной [he], Мокси [she], and Ли [she] got a few looks as they walked out of the arena. The min stone training arena had definitely caught some people’s attention, but nobody approached them on their way out and back toward the T building.

There was still quite some time before the продвинутая группа meeting was due to start. That suited Ной [he] quite nicely, as he had more than enough to do in the meantime including continuing to see if he could get his hands on a Space Rune.

The potential first step of that was walking alongside him, chewing on a strip of jerky she’d slipped from Мокси [she]’s bag and eyeing up the local wildlife. Ной [he] took a moment to make sure nobody was anywhere near them before he spoke.

“Ли [she], are all the runes you’ve got equally as bonded to your body as the other?” He asked. “Or do you have something similar to us with the extras after the first seven?”

Ли [she] waggled a hand back and forth. “It depends on a few things, but that bit is similar for us and you. The runes we’ve got in our soul bond more closely to our bodies the more we use them. And, by being in one of the seven active slots, we’re basically permanently using them. Self-fulfilling prophecy.”

“So any spares… are they also bonded?”

“Eh. They’re in there more than a random one is for you, but I wouldn’t say they’re bonded. More like they’re jabbed in there. We could take them out with a lot less effort than it would take a human. Why?”

“I was going to ask if you had a spare Space Rune still. I’m thinking of getting into making a Rank 4 based off Space Runes, but they’re painfully expensive and I don’t want to keep taking things from Брейден [he].”

“Oh, sure. I’ve got some Rank 1 Space Runes sitting around waiting to give away.” Ли [she] scrunched her nose and scratched the back of her neck. “But there’s a small problem. I don’t have any spare Runes.”

“Huh? What do you mean? I thought you just said–”

“I formed a Rank 4 Rune,” Ли [she] reminded Ной [he]. “All those extra Runes moved into my main slots. I’m not using them, but they’re a little bit stuck in there now. It might actually be a bit annoying when I get more runes. It’s harder for us to swap things between slots. Possible, just a bit harder. I’d need to have something to replace them if I wanted to shift anything out.”

Ной [he] nearly slapped himself in the forehead. He’d somehow forgotten that the spare Runes Ли [she] had wouldn’t just be sitting around in the shadows forever. That said, if they weren’t very bonded to Ли [she]’s soul, it wouldn’t be that hard to pull them out with Разлом [he].

“You mind if I take one of them when we get back?” Ной [he] asked. “I can use the Fragment of Возрождение [she] if it ends up hurting more than we expect.”

Ли [she] shrugged in response. “Sure. You can take another look at my Rune when you do and let me know if everything looks correct.”

“Perfect,” Ной [he] said. “Thanks.”

“No problem.”

They took a brief detour to the apothecary so Ной [he] could buy several more Mind Meld potions – it seemed like he was spending the majority of his money on those nowadays – and then headed back to the T building.

Once they got to Мокси [she]’s room, they wasted no time in downing one of the potions and sitting down against the bed. It wasn’t long before Ной [he] and Ли [she] were standing within her mind.

The first matter of business was checking Ли [she]’s Rank 4 Rune. Ной [he] still had absolutely no idea what it was or what it did. The weird mixture of a Demon Rune and a Master Rune had made it something entirely new to him.

Whatever Азель [he] done to bind it still held. At least, it did for the time being. Ной [he] spent nearly half their time double checking the restraints and studying the rune while Ли [she] pointedly avoided looking at it.

“I think it’s fine,” Ной [he] confirmed as he walked over to rejoin Ли [she]. “No difference from last time. You’re safe.”

Ли [she] breathed a sigh of relief. “Good. I was worried something shifted. The bindings are still holding?”

He glanced over his shoulder. Even though he’d just spent fifteen minutes studying the magic holding the rune down, he took another moment to squint at it before nodding. “Yeah. Completely held down. Азель [he] did a good job.”

“Yeah,” Ли [she] agreed, a pensive look on her features. She shook her head, then held a hand out. The shadows that made up the ground before her twisted as a small purple rune pushed up from beneath them, strands of black clinging onto it like stretching cheese. “Here’s one of the Space Runes.”

“Damn, I thought you said it wouldn’t be too worked into you,” Ной [he] said with a concerned frown. “This looks pretty bound, Ли [she].”


“It’s not as bad as you’d think. It’s still weak,” Ли [she] replied.

“Sure, but some of the runes I removed from you were just as connected as this one, and those were ones you were using,” Ной [he] said. He waited to see if her soul would release the rune any further, but it kept a firm grip on it. “This is just a spare rune that slid into a slot.”

“I think it’s because I’m stronger now than I was then. My soul is more powerful, so its hold on anything in it is stronger as well. My main runes will probably get so worked into it at Rank 4 and 5 that I’ll barely even be able to pull them up.”

That was mildly concerning. It was easy to forget how different demons were from humans when Ной [he] wasn’t actively thinking about it. Something didn’t quite sit right with him about it.

Ли [she] has been talking about how demons and humans are just different, but it really seems like she’s getting some enormous drawbacks without benefits to make up for them. Demons bond to runes way harder than we do, making them part of their bodies. Sure, they get to be a lot physically stronger and faster because of it, but humans can do body наполнение [he] to match a lot of that.

Sure, demons also get to feed off emotions rather than food, but that doesn’t seem like a huge boon either. Ли [she] also can’t project her abilities beyond her body very much, which is apparently a common issue through most demons since their magic is so tied to their body.

They might be immensely powerful when they do get strong, but doesn’t this mean that everything is harder for them overall? It almost feels unfair.

There wasn’t going to be an answer he could find here. Telling his concerns to Ли [she] wasn’t going to make her feel any better. And, in the end, all that mattered was the end result, not how hard it was to get there. Even if things were more difficult for Ли [she], he could just keep cutting apart her runes with Разлом [he] and fixing her soul with the Fragment of Возрождение [she].

“Right,” Ной [he] said with a shake of his head. “Sorry about that. Got lost in thought. You ready to get this done? I’m going to cut the rune out. I’m definitely using the Fragment after this. I don’t want to risk hurting you.”

“Okay,” Ли [she] replied. “I’m ready. It won’t be as bad as you’re thinking. My soul might be holding on stronger, but it’s also more powerful so the relative loss shouldn’t be all that bad.”

She didn’t sound completely convinced of her own words. It wasn’t like they had any way to find out the extent of the damage removing the rune would do beforehand. There was nothing to do now but act.

Ной [he] drew on Разлом [he] and his veins blackened as power coursed through them. The familiar, icy river of power that was his Master Rune churned through his body and gathered in his fingertips.

He extended his hand and brushed it across the strands holding the Rank 1 Space Rune down. The magic ripped free of his body and poured out through his palm. It sank into Ли [she]’s soul and a line of black carved through the air.

The shadowy strands severed instantly and the rune peeled away from Ли [she]’s soul, fluttering in her soul space. Ной [he] pressed his hand to it and closed his eyes, drawing its pattern within his own mind.

It only took a second. The rune, Space or not, was just a Rank 1. Power poured back through his palm and into his body as he absorbed it. Ли [she] had managed to fill the rune a fair amount just by holding onto it and it seemed like it was just a few decent fights away from being completely full.

Ной [he] didn’t waste time investigating it any further. He spun to Ли [she], already calling on the Fragment of Возрождение [she]. Her face was distressed, lips pressed thin, shoulders hunched. Despite the obvious discomfort, she didn’t look much worse for the wear.

He didn’t take any chances. Gentle pink smoke poured out of his hands and swirled around Ли [she]. It sank into her soul and she blew out a breath, her shoulders relaxing as she gave him a nod.

“Thank you. That wasn’t too bad. You didn’t have to use the Fragment.”

“I’m not taking the risk, and you shouldn’t have to suffer for me,” Ной [he] replied without missing a beat. “You were doing me a favor anyway. The only other thing I need the Fragment for right now is healing Тим [he], and he’s got so much attention on him right now that I’ll have to wait a day or two to do that anyway.”

Ли [she] nodded. “Okay. I’m not going to complain. The Fragment of Возрождение [she] feels warm and fuzzy. I like it.”

“Don’t get too used to it,” Ной [he] said with a laugh. “Thanks for the rune, Ли [she]. I appreciate it.”

“It was a gift to me, so I can’t even take much credit for it.” Ли [she] scratched the back of her head. “But no problem. Do you know what kind of Rune you’re going to try to make with it?”

“Not yet,” Ной [he] admitted. “I have some strong ideas, but I’m going to really need to study just what a space rune is. I want to make something disaster related, but it can’t be so specific that it won’t’ combine well with Natural Disaster.”

Ли [she] flopped down to the ground, crossing her legs beneath her and planting her chin in a palm. There were still a few minutes before the potion’s effects wore off, so Ной [he] sat beside her.

“What kind of disasters are space related?” Ли [she] asked.

“Probably something like black hole or some form of spatial rift?” Ной [he] guessed. “That’s the hard part. Figuring those out enough to fully comprehend them won’t be easy.”

“Can’t you just randomly combine things until you stumble into the right path?”

“I wouldn’t quite go as far as to say randomly combine, but I can definitely test a lot of different options until one works,” Ной [he] said with a nod. He drummed his fingers on his knee, his brow furrowing. “The thing is, that would be really expensive and time consuming. I want to keep growing. With the people we’ll eventually be up against, I can’t risk falling behind.”

“Yeah. I get that,” Ли [she] said. Her head twitched as she stopped herself from looking back at the Master-Demon Rune hybrid floating behind them. “Well, I’ll happily take any space-related runes you buy and don’t need.”

Ной [he] let out a snort of laughter. “How generous of you. I’ll make sure to send them your way.”

Ли [she] gave him an unabashed grin. “No problem. Now let’s start brainstorming some space Runes you could make for Rank 2. What about devouring stomach?”

“That doesn’t seem quite up my alley.”

“No? Well, we’ve got time until the potion ends. I’m sure we can come up with one. How about infinite void?”

“That… seems a bit excessive for a Rank 2.”

“Infinite void in the stomach?”

“I think you’re just hungry.”

“Yeah,” Ли [she] agreed. “I am.”

Chapter 412: Surprise Meeting

The Mind Meld potion wore off right on time. Ной [he] was pulled out of Ли [she]’s mind and back into Мокси [she]’s room where she sat in wait.

“How’d it go?” Мокси [she] asked.

“Well,” Ной [he] replied. “Got the rune I needed and everything is fine with Ли [she]’s rune. Nothing to worry about right now. We can focus entirely on dealing with the продвинутая группа meeting tonight.”

And I can kill the time by trying to figure out what Rune I’m going to make.

“You can do that,” Ли [she] said as she stood up and stretched her arms over her head with a long yawn. “I’m going to get breakfast.”

“It’s midday,” Мокси [she] said. “This would be lunch.”

“Lunch makes it sound so close to dinner, and that’s the end of the eating for the day,” Ли [she] replied. She scratched at a cheek, then wiped her nose with the back of a hand. “If this is breakfast, then I still have two more meals.”

It was hard to argue with that impeccable logic. All Ной [he] and Мокси [she] could do was nod their understanding of Ли [she]’s sage words as she pulled the window open and slipped out, dropping to the ground and sinking into a shadow before zipping off in pursuit of what was likely her third breakfast of the day.

“If I didn’t know better, I’d say her emotion was gluttony,” Мокси [she] said with a shake of her head. “You know, I still wonder what exactly it was that made Ли [she] so different from the other demons.”

“My best thought is her lack of a proper Demon Rune for a long time – or perhaps the lack of advancing it. We haven’t really seen other demons at her Rank before. Maybe they’re all… kind of like that.”

A shudder ran down Мокси [she]’s back at the thought. “I love Ли [she], but I don’t know if I can stand by the idea of entire cities of Ли [she]s walking around in the Damned Plains. Forget the big scary demons like Азель [he] – just one city of Ли [she]s with absolutely no malicious intent would be enough to completely destroy all four Bastions.”

“It would probably bring about the greatest famine the world has ever seen,” Ной [he] agreed with a nod. He pushed himself upright and took a page out of Ли [she]’s book, stretching his arms out before leaning down and reaching for his toes to work a knot out of his back. “On another topic, how are your runes doing?”

“Well,” Мокси [she] replied. “I’ve been doing a good amount of hunting and meditation to push them to where they need to be. I’ve filled out the rest of my roster as well.”

“You have? Unique runes?”

“No, duplicates. I’m going for a Rank 4 Rune that focuses on blooming or flowering plants. I haven’t figured out the exact final composition, but it’ll need a lot of earth and plant related runes, both of which I have.”

“Sounds good. I can’t help much with the first part, but when it comes time to combine them, let me know if you have any trouble and need to Разлом [he] it back apart.”

“I will. You can count on it. I don’t plan on leaving myself with a sub-par Rank 4 Rune when I’ve got access to one of the most unfair runes in existence,” Мокси [she] said with a snicker. “But what about you? Space Runes… not exactly an easy medium to work with. I take it I’d be reaching if I said you’ve got a plan?”

“Reaching pretty far,” Ной [he] agreed. He reached down and snagged his grimoire, lugging it onto Мокси [she]’s bed and flipping it open to leaf through the pages. “I know the general direction I want to go. My first Rank 4 is Natural Disaster – so I want the others to all be different kinds of disasters. Maybe I could do some duplicates, but I still need the initial one.”

“So you’re going for Disaster as your Rank 5, I take it?”

Ной [he] nodded. “It seems like it would fit the current path pretty well. I don’t know how things will change between now and then, though. Who knows what it’ll actually end up being. I can’t plan for that – but I can see that Space Runes are really powerful. I’m also starting to get jealous of everyone teleporting around.”

“Don’t forget they also consume a huge amount of energy as well,” Мокси [she] reminded Ной [he]. “But yes, Space Runes are powerful for obvious reasons. Maybe ask Джален [he] about them? He’s clearly got some, and they’re probably fairly high rank.”

Considering how often Джален [he] teleported around, he definitely was. Ной [he] wasn’t so sure he wanted to ask Джален [he] for help with regard to runes. Their relationship was built off the fact that Джален [he] found him entertaining.

If he started asking the older mage for handouts or advice, there was a chance that he’d get bored. Джален [he] had made it clear he had absolutely no plans of fighting any battles for Ной [he].

I’d probably have to find something to trade for the runes or information. Maybe I could make him give it up over a game of darts or something? That’s honestly the most likely way I’d get anything from him… but then I’d have to bet something myself, and probably been practicing darts since we last played.

“What are you thinking?” Мокси [she] asked.

“That Джален [he] has probably been practicing playing darts.”

She blinked, confusion passing over her features. “What? I thought we were talking about asking him for Space Runes.”

“We were.”

Мокси [she] squinted at Ной [he]. She shook her head and shrugged. “Right. Well, I’m not going to poke into that rabbit hole. I can try to help you with the theory portion, but I don’t know all that much about natural or unnatural disasters. They’re both pretty broad concepts. What kind of disasters are there that involve space?”

The narrative has been taken without permission. Report any sightings.

“Well, I’ve got two ideas right now. You know what a black hole is?”

“An area of collapsing space. I’ve heard of Space Rune users working with them before, but there’s a reason almost everyone that has said runes only uses them for transportation. They end up killing themselves with their magic more often than anyone else.”

“Брейден [he] doesn’t.”

“Брейден [he] is special,” Мокси [she] said. “But he also seems to use his runes mostly for mobility and to create barriers of condensed space. Basically defensive and utility applications that he uses offensively. That’s different from trying to literally collapse space.”

Ной [he] nodded. “Right. But you have heard of them? That’s what I’m thinking for one Rune. Black hole. It might be a bit too powerful for a Rank 4, though. I may have to find a weaker version of it. Either way, something to do with increasing the density of space in a small area until it collapses.”

“Remind me not to be anywhere near you when you start on that,” Мокси [she] said dryly. “Where are you even going to get the runes to do that, though? What do Space Runes combine with to create something that can collapse space?”

“I haven’t figured that bit out yet. Брейден [he] might have some advice, and I think I could wheedle it out of Джален [he] if I approach things the right way. Then it’ll just be a matter of getting my hands on the runes. Until then, I’ll just split up the Space Rune I got from Ли [she] and make enough copies to fuel the rest of my combinations.”

“Going to feed some to your book?”

“Probably. Why?”

“It looks hungry.”

Ной [he] glanced down at the grimoire. It had raised its own front cover, and the eye on its center was looking straight up at him. He let out a surprised curse and yanked his hand back. The grimoire fluttered, possibly either in amusement or annoyance, then closed itself and returned to plain leather.

“Damn it,” Ной [he] muttered as he shook his hand off. “Why is everything and everyone I know perpetually hungry?”

“I’m not,” Мокси [she] said defensively.

Ной [he] squinted at her, then turned to pick his grimore up. “You never know. Maybe you’ll start taking lessons from Ли [she]. I don’t know if I can trust anyone.”

Мокси [she] rolled her eyes and poked him in the side of his stomach. He jumped, nearly dropping the grimore, and spun to glare at her. She gave him an innocent look.

“What?”

“You are a brat,” Ной [he] said, slinging the grimoire over his back and picking up his travel bag. “Want to go try to scope out the продвинутая группа area before the other professors get there? There’s someone I’m keeping an eye out for.”

“Really?” Мокси [she] asked, tilting her head to the side. “Who? Годрик [he]?”

“No. Well, maybe. I don’t actually know the name of the person. I kind of need money, especially if I want to go around buying runes to combine with my Space Rune,” Ной [he] said. He rifled through his bag and pulled out the badge that they’d gotten in the auction some time ago. “I think it’s time to try to find the owner of this thing.”

“Ahh,” Мокси [she] said, her eyes lighting with understanding. “The one who had the Вайолет [she] Transference Rune. You think they’re in the продвинутая группа?”

Ной [he] shrugged in response. “Maybe? They’re probably either there, an Исполнитель [he], or someone else high up in Арбитраж [he]’s ranks. They seemed to imply it wouldn’t be hard for me to find them, but we haven’t seen any traces of them yet.”

“Probably because they assumed we ran in the same circles they did,” Мокси [she] said with a knowing nod. “I bet you’re right. I honestly have no clue what kind of rune Вайолет [she] Transference would even be. Something with space, maybe?”

“Space magic is purple, and the name sounds pretty space-y. Could be that,” Ной [he] said with a nod. “We’ll just have to keep an eye out. We’ll get to know the продвинутая группа professors better after today and the Исполнители tomorrow. With any luck, our rich friend will be in one of those two groups.”

“As good a guess as any. We’ll go hunting for him if not. Just don’t get too caught up looking and forget about the kids. We still have to pick them up from the transport cannon before the meeting actually starts.”

“I know. We’ve still got a few hours before then, though. More than enough time to kill snooping around.” Ной [he] turned his head to look back at Мокси [she] as he stepped ahead of her to pull the door open.

She’d been midway through parting her lips to respond when she stopped, a furrow creasing her brow as she looked past Ной [he]’s shoulder. He followed her gaze across the hall. Улия [she] sat, her head leaned against the hooded figure of one of her puppets, and her eyes fluttering to fight off sleep.

A start jolted Улия [she] awake and she jerked her gaze up. She scrambled to her feet, brushing her clothes off hurriedly as they watched on in bemusement.

“I just got here,” Улия [she] said lamely.

“Is something wrong?” Ной [he] asked.

“No. Why would something be wrong?”

“Considering something has been or gone at least slightly wrong every other time we’ve met, I’d say it’s a fair guess.”

“That’s… okay, it is fair,” Улия [she] admitted as she rubbed the back of her neck. “But no. Nothing is wrong. I just came to pick you both up for the продвинутая группа meeting. Контесса [he] said you’d be in here. I was going to ask if you were busy, but she looked like she was in a big hurry so I didn’t bother her long.

“So why were you just sitting outside? You could have knocked,” Мокси [she] said.

“Well, you had a very soft white cat sitting outside the door. I… got a little distracted petting it.”

I think I found what Контесса [he] was in a hurry about.

“How long were you petting it if you were falling asleep?” Мокси [she] asked, squinting at Улия [she].

“Not that long. A few minutes.” Улия [she] coughed into her fist. “I just started to drift off because I was a little tired. I’ve been working a lot.”

The bags under her eyes told the same story. She looked better than she had when Визен [he]’s clones had first become a problem, but not by much.

“I see,” Ной [he] said slowly. “So… you came to get us? This early?”

“Oh, yes. Right. I was going to bring you to a meeting,” Улия [she] said, a flash of panic running through her features. “I forgot.”

“A meeting?” Ной [he] asked. “I thought the meeting was at night.”

“Not that one.” Улия [she] shook her head and winced. “There’s another professor in the program that wanted to talk with both of you. He’s been waiting for a bit.”

Ной [he] and Мокси [she] exchanged a glance.

“Might as well,” Ной [he] said with a shrug. This was as good a spot as any to feel out how the продвинутая группа felt about them and their standing. Meeting with someone one on one would be much more beneficial than trying to figure anything out in a group setting. “I’m sure he hasn’t been waiting for all that long.”

Judging by the look on Улия [she]’s face, that probably wasn’t true. That was hardly his fault. Ной [he] didn’t mind waiting as long as he wasn’t the one doing it.

“Lead the way, then,” Ной [he] said. “And did you see where the cat went?”

“No,” Улия [she] replied. “I think I dozed off and it left.”

Ной [he] let out a thoughtful grunt as they started off down the hall. Маскот [he] going missing was rarely a good sign, but he got the feeling the cat would turn up again sooner rather than later.

Chapter 413: A Stranger

“So, who is it that wanted to see us?” Ной [he] asked as they headed down the stairwell that led into the продвинутая группа meeting area. They’d been walking for a few minutes in silence, the only noise out of place being the clicks coming from Улия [she]’s puppet as it moved.

“Верруд [he],” Улия [she] replied. “He’s a water mage and solidly in the middle of the pack as far as the продвинутая группа professors go. His students are as well.”

“Interesting,” Ной [he] said. He took a moment to draw his domain in, trying to contain it as best as possible. He still wasn’t great at controlling it perfectly, but he hoped it was enough to avoid being completely egregious. “Was there a reason he wanted to talk to us? And why are you running his errands?”

“Because I just joined the track,” Улия [she] said, sending Ной [he] a flat stare over her shoulder. “Though I suppose you, Мокси [she], and Сильвертид [he] have taken that role from me.”

Ной [he] let out a snort of laughter. “If you think I’m going to run around delivering messages for the продвинутая группа, you’re sorely mistaken. They don’t provide anything nearly important enough to get me to waste time doing that.”

“Thanks,” Улия [she] said dryly. “I appreciate it.”

“Hey, someone has to do it. Your work is definitely useful. I just have no plans of doing it myself. Why don’t you just have your puppets do it, though?”

“I used to,” Улия [she] said, coming to a stop at the doors at the bottom of the stairwell and pausing in a failed attempt to conceal her annoyance. “A pair of certain someones broke them all.”

Ah, right. I took out a few and then Сильвертид [he] used the rest as bait to take out Визен [he]’s other puppets. That’s rough.

“Right. Forgot about that bit,” Ной [he] said with a sheepish grin. He rubbed the back of his neck. “Couldn’t you use the thing you’ve got walking around with us now?”

“I’d leave myself defenseless if I did that. All my Runes are specifically for puppets. I don’t know how to fight in any other way. Not effectively, at least.”

She pushed the doors open before Ной [he] could respond. The banquet hall stretched out before them, considerably emptier than the last time they’d been there. There was only one person in the room.

Верруд [he] sat at the far side of the table, a book in his hands. His dark hair draped around his face, obscuring it from sight, but the golden nametag on his uniform would have given his identity away even if Ной [he] hadn’t recognized him.

He looked up as the three of them approached and closed the book in his hands with a snap. Ной [he] hadn’t gotten a great look at him during the previous meeting. The man’s features were pinched and serious.

He had thin eyes that seemed to be permanently locked in a half-asleep droop and lips that were borderline indistinguishable from the rest of his face. Верруд [he] set the book to the side and interlaced his fingers, leaning forward and inclining his head in greeting.

“Professors. I’m pleased you were able to make it.”

“I was unaware there was an option to refuse,” Ной [he] said. “Is there a reason you wanted to speak to us before the meeting? We would have been here in a few hours anyway.”

“Of course there was,” Верруд [he] said. “Do you think I ask Улия [she] to run around bringing people places for no reason whatsoever?”

That remains to be seen.

“I’d certainly hope not,” Ной [he] said. He and Мокси [she] walked over to sit down at the table across from Верруд [he]. Улия [she] hung back, watching with undisguised interest from the corner of the room. Ной [he] didn’t blame her. He would have done the same thing.

“Does this mean you’re about to enlighten us?” Мокси [she] asked.

“It seems we’re going to skip the niceties.” Верруд [he] shrugged. “That works for me. You joined the продвинутая группа at an interesting time, both of you. Amid the debacle with several of our members dying out of the blue, we barely got time to get to know much about each other.”

“I get the feeling you’ve already looked into us, though,” Ной [he] observed.

“Of course I have. We don’t allow just anyone into the продвинутая группа. I’d already done some research, but you two have a rather interesting background. A professor who was Rank 1 only a few months ago and the exiled aide of the Торрин [he] family’s head. Quite a ways you’ve come, isn’t it?”


“Are you leading somewhere with this? I thought you said were doing away with the niceties,” Ной [he] said, tilting his head to the side. He hadn’t quite figured out what Верруд [he]’s angle was yet. The man obviously wanted something.

Is it to do with our students, maybe? He could be scouting out the competition to see if his own are at risk from us. Either that or he’s interested in me or Мокси [she] specifically. Is he part of one of our families?

“I was just stating a few observations. Observations that I only grow more curious in. A number of professors in the track believe you have a powerful backer, especially after you showed up with two highly ranked mages at the last meeting. Is that true?”

“Does it matter?” Ной [he] countered. “Even if we did have backing, the only thing that matters for the продвинутая группа are our students and our own abilities.”

“Very true. I doubt you’ll be willing to give me much more information with regard to yourselves, so I won’t waste time asking. I suspect it will come out soon enough regardless. The reason I called you here today is to warn you.”

“Warn us?” Мокси [she] asked. “About what?”

“Not everyone in the program is pleased at your acceptance – particularly you, Magus Мокси [she]. Your student Эмили [she] is no longer in line for Торрин [he] leadership, but she still poses a threat. There are those that want to be rid of her, and they have since even before Эвергрин [she]’s demise.”

Ной [he]’s brow furrowed. It seemed like Верруд [he] was being honest… but the information he was sharing also wasn’t really all that much of a surprise. Эмили [she] had been in line to lead the Торрин [he]s after Эвергрин [she] died.

It was only logical to assume that there were other Торрин [he]s that didn’t like that, and they were a big enough family that it was quite likely that there were other Торрин [he]s from different branches that wouldn’t think much of Мокси [she] or Эмили [she].

None of that was a reason to call them over to the meeting room hours early, which meant one of two things. Either Верруд [he] was trying to gauge how much the information would worry them, or this situation was considerably more than just someone that didn’t like Эмили [she].

The way he’s worded this sounds like Эмили [she] or Мокси [she] are directly in danger – probably Эмили [she]. Nobody would dislike Мокси [she] enough to bother trying to do anything to her. She’s not a political threat when she’s exiled, but Эмили [she] is a different story. I suppose she could still try to claim the leadership position even if Эвергрин [she] is dead.

“I don’t suppose you’d be willing to elaborate on that?” Ной [he] asked casually.

Верруд [he] gave Ной [he] a wry smile and shook his head. “You’ll find that out soon enough. I’m not sticking my neck out that far. It will be fairly obvious, I’d say.”

“Fair enough,” Ной [he] allowed. “When you say that Эмили [she] is at risk, how much are we talking here? Are there going to be threats on her life?”

If there are, I’ll be responding in kind.

“Directly? Most certainly not. What kind of place do you take Арбитраж [he] for?” Верруд [he] exclaimed, staring at Ной [he] in disbelief. It took everything Ной [he] had not to laugh in the other professor’s face.

It looked like he’d never had the misfortune of finding out that Арбитраж [he]’s neutral zone was really more of a neutral suggestion. That actually spoke rather well of the man – unless, of course, he was lying.

“I see,” Ной [he] said. “So what are we expecting, then?”

“If I knew, I’d tell you. I’m not the one interested in Эмили [she] failing out of Арбитраж [he]. I value the продвинутая группа for what it is. A way for students to push themselves and grow stronger together with their professors. I have no interest in the politics. Not everyone sees things the same way.”

He said he wouldn’t tell me and then proceeded to do just that. Whoever this is will be trying to make it hard for Эмили [she] to graduate, then? Sounds like they’ll be interfering with tests or otherwise trying to make her look incompetent.

Ной [he]’s eyes narrowed as a thought struck him. Some time ago, at the survival exam, someone had been interfering with his students. The amount of monsters attacking them was abnormal and none of them had possessed the tokens that they were supposed to collect.

He’d never completely confirmed the reason as to why that had happened. There had been bigger problems to worry about at the time, and it had seemed possible that Эвергрин [she] herself had caused the trouble to try and hinder Эмили [she] so she’d lose her bet.

Is it possible that was something more that Эвергрин [she] just took advantage of – or didn’t plan entirely? If that’s the case, we can expect someone to be messing with just about every exam from here on out. But… why would Верруд [he] come out and tell us this? I don’t see what he gets out of it.

“A proper fight,” Верруд [he] said.

Ной [he] blinked. “What?”

“You were probably wondering why I bothered telling you any of this and didn’t just wait to see how everything played out during the next exam,” Верруд [he] said. “It’s because I want a proper fight. My students and I joined this program to push ourselves. The resources are convenient, but we have enough power from our own noble families. We don’t truly need them. What we need are competent opponents.”

“And you think that we can be that?” Мокси [she] asked, her words failing to reveal any emotion. “Are you sure? You did point out yourself that our position is pretty tenuous. Вермил [he] was a Rank 1 just a short while ago. Most of our students aren’t nobles.”

“Even if it weren’t for the two mages accompanying you last time, it is clear that you have something interesting about you,” Верруд [he] replied. He pushed back from his chair and rose to his feet. “And your students have come a far way. Far enough for me to suspect it to not be a fluke. I look forward to seeing what you and your groups are capable of later tonight during the meeting.”

“That’s all?” Мокси [she] asked. “You only called us here for that?”

“I have gotten everything I wanted,” Верруд [he] replied with a thin smile. He stepped past them, heading down the hall and up the stairs until the echo of his footsteps faded into the distance.

“He’s… surprisingly decent,” Мокси [she] observed in a hushed tone. “I wonder what noble family he’s from.”

“Yeah,” Ной [he] said thoughtfully, looking out in the direction that Верруд [he] had left. “As do I.”

Chapter 414: Change The Game

“So, how much of that do you think was Верруд [he] trying to play us against someone else?” Мокси [she] asked once several seconds had passed after the other professor’s departure.

Ной [he] rubbed his chin. Улия [she] was still standing in the corner, but he was pretty sure she was at least temporarily on their side. She didn’t have any puppets beyond the one beside her and probably didn’t think too much of the other professors if they kept using her as an errand girl.

Probably relatively safe to speak honestly as long as I avoid giving anything too important away.

“He definitely wants something from us that he hasn’t said. That guy was trying way too hard to come off as magnanimous and considerate. I mean, it’s great that he’s told us that someone’s gunning for Эмили [she], but I figure we would have figured that out soon. Really soon.”

“During the meeting tonight, probably,” Мокси [she] said with a nod. “The Торрин [he]s aren’t discreet about their opinions. If someone’s looking to make a fool out of Эмили [she], they’re going to try to act hard and fast. There’s no way they’ll wait all the way until the first exam.”

“I’m of the same mind,” Ной [he] said. “Which means this guy probably called the meeting now just to make sure his kind advice actually felt useful when it’s actually completely worthless. Улия [she], how do you feel about picking sides?”

“Are there sides to pick?” Улия [she] replied with a weary laugh. “It’s the продвинутая группа. Everyone is on their own side. Верруд [he] was right about one thing. We’re in this because we want to push ourselves to be better – and that generally comes at the cost of taking out the ones in our way.”

Ной [he] pushed his chair back and rose from the table. “Right. I get that, but I’ve always been pretty bad at following instructions. Мокси [she] and I are just two people, and we don’t know anything about the продвинутая группа. You do.”

Улия [she] tilted her head to the side and crossed her arms. She leaned against the back wall, watching Ной [he] through half-lidded eyes. “Where are you going with this? You want me to throw my lot in with you? Have you forgotten that you’ve destroyed a solid half of my puppets?”

“At least one of those was your fault,” Ной [he] replied. “Blame the people that sent you to me, not me.”

“Okay, fair enough,” Улия [she] admitted. She stepped out of the shadows and into the light cast by candles on the table, meeting Ной [he]’s gaze with steely eyes. “So what do you want, then? And why should I help you?”

“First, you owe me a favor.” Ной [he] held a hand up and ticked off one of his fingers. “You came to me for help when Визен [he] showed up, and I helped. Second, I can help you rebuild your missing puppets. The only thing you need is Runes, right?”

“You say that like it’s easy to get Runes,” Улия [she] said with a short laugh. “Catchpaper is expensive and hunting is dangerous, especially for monsters that are strong enough to give worthwhile Runes – unless you plan to spend months getting Rank 1 Runes?”

“Forget how difficult it is for a moment. I didn’t ask you if it was hard to get Runes or not,” Ной [he] said. “I said I needed someone in the продвинутая группа on our side, and I’m partial to you because you aren’t a raging scumbag. That doesn’t mean I need you.”

Улия [she]’s brow furrowed as she studied Ной [he] for a few seconds. He could see the thoughts churning in her head, likely recalling his so-called ‘teacher’ and Джален [he]’s presence at the last продвинутая группа meeting.

“How do I know you’re telling the truth?” Улия [she] asked. “You could just be trying to use me for information and then leave.”

Ной [he] stared at Улия [she]. “I wasn’t lying about not needing you, Улия [she]. We’ve already worked together and you seem like an intelligent woman. That doesn’t mean I can’t find someone else to work with. Someone in the продвинутая группа will take me up on my offer. Do you really think I climbed from Rank 1 to where I am now so quickly without any ability? Верруд [he] clearly disagrees.”

Neither of them spoke for several seconds. Then Улия [she]’s lips pressed thin and she gave him a sharp nod.

“Fine. I’ll play, at least for now. What do you want?”

“Верруд [he]. Who’s he in with?”

“He’s a Herron.”

Ной [he]’s eyes narrowed as old memories churned. The Herrons were the 2nd strongest family in the kingdom, just behind the King family. And, more importantly, he knew the Herron name. It had been a while since he’d heard it, but he hadn’t forgotten that Сильвертид [he] had told him that he suspected a Mind Mage from the Herrons called Calo had been involved with the manipulation of the survival exam a short while ago.


“Well, isn’t that interesting,” Ной [he] said. “The Herrons were the ones that screwed with the exam.”

“Hold on. Why would he warn you of the Торрин [he]s planning to mess with Эмили [she] if he’s working with them?” Улия [she] asked. “Are you sure the Herrons have something against Эмили [she]?”

It’s not Эмили [she] they were after. It’s Изабель [she]’s Master Rune – but I don’t trust Улия [she] nearly enough to tell her that.

Ной [he] didn’t respond for a few seconds. He sifted through the information he had, lining up the puzzle pieces. A grin crossed his lips and he let out a bark of laughter before speaking again. He made sure to keep his voice low enough that, just in case someone was listening from the stairs or anywhere else nearby, they wouldn’t be able to pick up on it.

“Yes. I’m sure. Сильвертид [he] was the one that got me that information – but Verrod doesn’t know that. We never publicly made any moves. He has no reason to suspect we know the Herrons want us to fail.”

“They’re partnered with the Торрин [he] family, then. Мокси [she]’s eyes lit up with understanding. “That’s what this meeting was for. He was trying to get into our good graces so they’d have someone on the inside and focus our attention on the Торрин [he]s.”

“That’s a lot of work just to humiliate one disgraced heir,” Улия [she] said. She flicked her hand and her puppet clicked to life, striding across the room and heading up the stairs. Ной [he] followed its path with a curious gaze, then raised his eyebrow in question.

“Making sure we aren’t being listened in on,” Улия [she] said. “If I’m throwing my lot in with you, I’m not getting screwed on the first move.”

Ной [he] grinned. “Good. Now, who’s the Торрин [he] we need to be aware of?”

“The professor’s name is Якоб [he]. He’s got two students – Марли [he] and Юлина [she]. Марли [he] is in Exal’s family branch, and he–”

“Is the current head of the Торрин [he]s,” Мокси [she] finished with a nod. She tapped a finger on her chin. “So Марли [he] is probably trying to make sure he secures his position by showing up Эмили [she]. What rank is he?”

“Two,” Улия [she] said.

Ной [he] and Мокси [she] exchanged a glance. The Продвинутая Группа students were definitely ahead of the normal curve – but, at the same time, Ной [he] was pretty confident Эмили [she] would be able to take out another Rank 2. Between her pattern and her flawless Runes, he was confident she’d win.

Winning wasn’t enough. If the Herrons were trying to kill Изабель [she] or steal her Master Rune from her, then there was only a single option that Ной [he] could see before him.

Completely and utterly crush them, just like the Торрин [he]s before them.

“Do you know if a mage called Calo is in the продвинутая группа?” Ной [he] asked.

Улия [she] shook her head. “No. The only members from the Herron family are Верруд [he] and his students. I know of Calo – there’s no way a Rank 5 Mind Mage would be wasting time for something like this.”

You might change your mind if you realized this was a game for an incredibly powerful Master Rune, not a pissing contest between two prospective family heirs.

That said… Rank 5?

A grin stretched across Ной [he]’s lips. Визен [he] was one thing, but he could handle a Rank 5 if he approached the battle on his terms. He just had to make sure he didn’t play his cards too early. From what he’d learned, Mind Magic was for utility – they couldn’t control people unless their guard was completely down or they had a long time to work.

Верруд [he]’s warning likely meant that Якоб [he] and his students would be trying to make some form of move during the продвинутая группа meeting. He’d already expected there to be opposition from people that didn’t think he and his group belonged, but this changed things.

“Right. We’re playing good cop, bad cop,” Ной [he] said.

“We’re doing what now?” Улия [she] asked.

He scrunched his nose. “Верруд [he] is pretending to be nice. Якоб [he] and his group are going to be the assholes. They’re going to pull out all the stops to crush Эмили [she] in the first round to prove that Верруд [he]’s warning was ‘good’ and then we’ll trust him.”

“And when you trust him, they screw you over even harder later?” Улия [she] asked, catching on.

“Probably,” Ной [he] said.

Likely by picking a moment during an exam when Изабель [she] is trusting them to watch her back. Her guard would be down and it would be easy to make her disappear and claim she just couldn’t hold up in the продвинутая группа.

“We should be careful,” Мокси [she] said. “The fact they’re doing all this means they know we’re not pushover opponents.”

“That’s fine,” Ной [he] said. “They think we took the bait, and that means we’ve got them exactly where we want them. Nothing suits our position better than pretending to be the mouse in the face of a cat.”

“You’ve got a plan, then?” Улия [she] raised an eyebrow. “The look on your face has me interested despite my better judgement. What is it?”

“We shift the game. This whole thing only works if they can make a joke out of Эмили [she] to prove we need Верруд [he]’s help. They’ll keep trying to do that as long as they don’t think their cover is blown.”

“Logically,” Улия [she] said. “But how are you going to avoid it? If they’ve gone to these lengths, then Марли [he] is going to be strong. He’s likely to win in the fight.”

“That’s certainly possible,” Ной [he] agreed with a smile. “But we won’t be playing their game. We play things our way instead.”

“And what way is that?” Улия [she] asked doubtfully.

The look in Мокси [she]’s eyes told Ной [he] she knew what he was going to say a second before he said it, but that didn’t reduce the relish in his voice by even an ounce.

“If they never even get a chance to properly challenge Эмили [she] today, then they won’t be able to do shit.” Ной [he]’s grin grew even wider. “We’re going to be causing a little chaos. This meeting is going to be fun.”
==========
Chapter 415: We Do A Little Planning

There were still a few hours before the meeting. If they were going to cause chaos, Ной [he] couldn’t see that possibly happening without one particular person who seemed to be the literal embodiment of it.

They needed Ли [she].

It was tempting to ask Улия [she] to use her puppet to go get her, but the woman had been asked to be a messenger so many times that Ной [he] actually felt a little bad about it. He needed Улия [she] to actually like working with them if he wanted her properly on their side.

That’s fine. She’s not the only messenger I’ve worked with.

“Маскот [he], you here?” Ной [he] asked.

Улия [she] sent him a strange look. “Who?”

“Hold on,” Ной [he] said, holding a hand up to forestall any questions. He glanced around the relatively empty room. There wasn’t any sign of white fur or red horns. Not yet. “Come on, Маскот [he]. I know you’re somewhere around. You were lurking around this morning. You know something’s up.”

There was no response. Улия [she] looked at Мокси [she] with a concerned expression. Ной [he] ignored her. The cat was screwing with him. He rifled through his bag, but there wasn’t any jerky left in it. Ли [she] had picked him clean at some point.

“Hey, do you have any food?” Ной [he] asked.

“Here,” Мокси [she] said, pulling a strip of jerky out of her own bag. “Is Маскот [he] really going to go for a random piece of meat? He isn’t Ли [she].”

Ной [he] shrugged in response, taking the jerky from her and waving it around in the air above his head like a flag. “Only one way to find out. Come on, Маскот [he]. I need you to help mess some shit up.”

Улия [she]’s eyes widened. A ripple of energy tickled Ной [he]’s domain and he glanced over his shoulder as a purple disk yawned open – well within the reaches of his domain. Маскот [he] popped out, bounding off his shoulder and snagging the jerky from his hand.

The fluffy cat landed on the table across from him and turned in a circle to stare into his eyes, the strip of jerky slowly disappearing into his mouth.

“What in the Damned Plains?” Улия [she] asked. “That was the cat I was petting!”

He went right through my domain. Point taken, you little bugger. You’re still somehow stronger than I am. Where in the world did you come from? Are you really just a manifestation of the Fragment of Возрождение [she]?

Маскот [he] meowed and licked his paw. A flicker of annoyance passed through his red eyes and his tail thumped against the table impatiently.

“I think you should tell him what you want,” Мокси [she] suggested. “Preferably before he pisses over the tablecloth.”


“I was hoping you could get Ли [she] for me. The rest of the students as well, if possible,” Ной [he] told Маскот [he]. “We’re going to be causing some chaos in the meeting today. I figure you already knew that, though.”

“How would a cat know anything?” Улия [she] asked, squinting at Маскот [he]. “What kind of monster is that?”

Маскот [he] sank into a portal that formed in the table, vanishing without a trace. It was impossible to tell if he’d decided to comply with Ной [he]’s request or not. Something told Ной [he] that the cat would do as he asked – there was nothing Маскот [he] enjoyed more than chaos.

“An odd one,” Ной [he] replied. “Be grateful. Now you don’t have to go run and find her yourself. I figured you were fed up running errands for other people.”

“You summoned a monster with Space Runes purely so I wouldn’t have to run off and deliver the message myself?” A flicker of appreciation passed through Улия [she]’s features. “I can’t tell if you’re supremely lazy or just trying to make sure you stay on my good side.”

Ной [he] gave her an unabashed shrug. “I treat the people on my side well. Can’t say the same for everyone else. Now, we need to figure out our plan. First off – Улия [she], this part is easy. Pretend you don’t give a shit about us.”

“That should be easy.”

“I figured,” Ной [he] said with a wry grin. “Мокси [she], I think your best role is the one you normally play.”

“And that is?”

“Mediator. Between Ли [she] and I, there will be enough of a shitshow to make everyone think we’re all insane. We need something that keeps us grounded. That’ll be you.”

“Oh. That is my normal role.”

“Which is what I said. In the meantime, Ли [she] and I will keep literally everyone’s attention so occupied that there won’t even be a chance for Марли [he] to try to challenge Эмили [she] properly.” Ной [he] chewed his lower lip. There were a lot of ways he could cause chaos. He didn’t want to go so far as to completely go overboard, though. “Are there any things we should make sure not to do, Улия [she]?”

“That is a very broad and concerning question. What do you mean?”

“I can’t imagine people are going to like us much after this, but I want to make sure we don’t go so far that we get kicked out of the program,” Ной [he] said. “Are they going to lose their shit at the slightest indecency like most nobles?”

Улия [she] thought for a second before shaking her head. “No. Everyone in this program is a warrior. They’ll be more hardened and difficult to throw off than average mages. As long as you don’t kill anyone or make a complete mockery of yourselves, you’ll be fine. They respect ability above all else.”

“Perfect.” Ной [he] rubbed his hands together. “Then all we have to do is wait for the others to arrive.”

“Assuming Маскот [he] actually went to get them,” Мокси [she] put in.

“Yeah. Assuming that.”

***

Ли [she] and the students showed up just about twenty minutes later. There was no sign of Маскот [he] with them, but there was no doubt in Ной [he]’s mind that the cat was lurking nearby, waiting to throw his own wrench into the system.

“Маскот [he] led us over here,” Ли [she] said, glancing around the empty room. “Is something going on? I didn’t think the продвинутая группа meeting started for a while.”

“Yeah,” Ной [he] said with a nod. He gestured for them to all gather closer, then filled them in on everything that had gone down since the meeting with Верруд [he]. There was no need to hide information from any of them, and they all deserved to know what they were up against.

Эмили [she] didn’t look too surprised at their findings. Determination etched itself into her features and, once Ной [he] had finished with his debrief, she gave him a nod.

“I won’t lose to Марли [he]. I can hold my own.”

“This isn’t just about that.” Ной [he]’s eyes drifted over to Изабель [she], who met them with a knowing look. She’d known what was up the moment he’d mentioned that the Herron family was involved. “It’s about all of us. And, fortunately, I have a plan. I’ll just need everyone’s help to pull it off.”

Chapter 416: Getting Started

Ной [he] and the others waited on the street outside the продвинутая группа meeting point. The plan hadn’t taken too long to discuss, and they didn’t want to be caught sitting around in the room and start raising questions as to what they were doing.

They’d made a few changes to their appearance. Ной [he]’s uniform was now badly ruffled and his hair stuck out in every direction – and there was no sign of his gourd, bag, or grimoire.

Годрик [he] was the first of the продвинутая группа professors to show up, and his eyebrows arched as he spotted them.

“Улия [she] brought you two over early, I see.”

“Just a bit,” Ной [he] replied with a shrug. “What’s on the docket for today’s meeting? Anything interesting?”

Годрик [he]’s brow furrowed and he lowered his voice to make sure that nobody could overhear them. “If you’re referring to what happened earlier – no. That’s already being handled. I’ve already spent the better portion of the day working to make sure that everyone who was stranded by the cannon’s… failure was accounted for together with Тим [he]. We don’t need any more focus on that than there already is. The meeting today will be what the one last time should have been. A time to get to know each other. A little exchange of knowledge. Fun all around.”

Годрик [he] pulled back and gestured for them to follow him before starting down the stairs. Ной [he] suppressed a grin as they all piled in behind him. As soon as they made it into the room below, Улия [she] broke away and headed over to the corner of the room to avoid being too strongly associated with them.

Ли [she] made a beeline for the table and pulled a chair out, sitting down and drumming her fingers impatiently on the white tablecloth. There wasn’t any food laid out yet, but there would be soon enough.

That’s two of us in place.

The students broke off, moving to stand a short distance from Ли [she] while Ной [he] and Мокси [she] remained near the entrance of the room to keep line of sight on everyone. It didn’t take long for the other продвинутая группа professors to start piling in.

Ной [he] didn’t recognize most of them or their students, and he didn’t currently care to. There were quite a few members in the продвинутая группа, and his brain didn’t have enough room to store all of them until they did something of worth.

With every new professor and group of students that entered the room, Ной [he] glanced over at Улия [she]. She remained impassive in her corner, her features unreadable.

He locked eyes with Верруд [he] as the man entered the room alongside a young woman with pure white hair – probably his student. She was a little taller than Эмили [she] and had the kind of smile on her face that was reserved for people who were firmly convinced they were doing a world a favor by gracing it with their presence.

Верруд [he] inclined his head in greeting and Ной [he] returned the gesture, doing his best not to laugh.

I can’t say I’m going to enjoy this too much, but I think the look on his face should make this worth it.

Professors continued to enter over the course of the next few minutes. Ной [he] was starting to wonder if Улия [she] had completely forgotten her job when she finally pushed away from the wall and headed over to the table, which was currently being set by several waiters.

Ной [he]’s eyes locked onto the professor that had just entered the room. He was a younger man, probably only a year older than Ной [he]. The man sported a well-kept goatee and combed back hair that looked like it had taken more time than he’d care to admit.

So you’re Якоб [he].

Walking at his side were two students, one male and one female. The boy – Марли [he] –clearly had a lot more confidence than the girl did. He walked with his shoulders thrown back and the corner of his mouth curled up in a faint smirk, one not all that dissimilar from the one that Верруд [he]’s student sported. His silver hair was tied back into a short ponytail and his hand rested on the hilt of a rapier at his side.

The girl at Марли [he]’s side was a head shorter than him and had orangish-red hair similar to Мокси [she]’s. Her features were soft and her expression restrained, but she carried herself with the grace of someone who had seen more than their share of fights. The hilt of a sword hung at her side, but no blade emerged from it.

So that’s Юлина [she], then. She seems like she might be the better fighter – or at the very least, she’s more restrained with her emotions.

Марли [he]’s eyes swept over the room until they locked onto Эмили [she], who was currently studying the table with perhaps a little more interest than she should have been. He nudged Юлина [she] with his elbow and she inclined her head slightly.

The three of them walked past Ной [he] and he let his domain brush over them. Faint resistance met him, and Якоб [he] paused to glance over his shoulder at him. The professor was a Rank 4, but neither of his students reacted.

Rank 3 at max. And lucky us. Both Юлина [she] and Марли [he] use swords. That’ll make things easier for us.

“Can I help you?” Якоб [he] asked, disdain tinging his words as his gaze bore into Ной [he]’s skull. “Because your domain appears to be leaking, professor .”

“Oh, is it?” Ной [he] matched Якоб [he]’s look with the most wretched grin he could manage. It looked like he’d guessed at least some of the situation correctly. Якоб [he] hadn’t even bothered trying to hide his disgust.


In a way, he kind of reminds me of Мокси [she] when we first met. Just way less hot.

A shudder ran down Ной [he]’s spine at that thought, but he dismissed it. It was time to start the play. There had been a few different ways he’d considered handling this. One option had just been setting Ли [she] free and watching the chaos unfold, but that would have put too much focus on her.

They needed to spread the other professors thin. And, more importantly, everything had to look natural. If it was completely obvious they were trying to mess up the meeting then there was no point to the plan.

And, if there was one thing that Вермил [he] was known for…

“I have to apologize,” Ной [he] said, extending a hand. “It’s hard to keep everything under control when I’m excited. This is the first time I get to properly introduce myself to everyone in the продвинутая группа. I’m Вермил [he].”

As disgusted as Якоб [he] was – or was pretending to be – he’d been raised in a noble house. It didn’t matter who offered you a handshake. You accepted. His hand reached out to take it, his lips curling down.

Ной [he] pulled his hand back.

I’m going to need a long shower after this.

“Whoops. Sorry. Didn’t make myself clear enough,” Ной [he] said. His eyes drifted over to Юлина [she]. “I wasn’t speaking to you there, grandpa. I was talking to your student.”

Looks of disgust passed over both Марли [he] and Юлина [she]’s faces and they both turned to face him.

“You live up to your reputation, Professor Вермил [he],” Якоб [he] said flatly, moving to stand between Ной [he] and his students. He made a subtle gesture behind his back. It was impossible to tell what it had been, but it wasn’t hard to guess.

Oh, no. You aren’t going anywhere.

“Sorry, what was that?” Ной [he] asked, stepping around Якоб [he] to keep his gaze locked with Юлина [she]’s. “I was a bit distracted. What family are you lot with again?”

“It’s beyond me how they let someone like you into the program,” Марли [he] spat, bracing his hand against his sword. “Did Father just pump you full of runes and buy your way in so you could sully this place with your vile presence?”

“Sully. That’s an interesting word to use,” Ной [he] said, tilting his head to the side. “I did a fair bit of that when I was visiting the Торрин [he] estate. You don’t have a sister, do you?”

A few of the groups around them had started to take notice of the confrontation and were watching with undisguised interest. Before anything could develop further, Верруд [he] pushed through the sidelines and walked over to join them.

Aha. The good cop arrives.

“Professors, please,” Верруд [he] said, raising his hands. “Let’s leave family politics at the door. We’re all in here for one reason alone, and that’s to get stronger.”

“That’s hardly true,” Ной [he] said. “I’m also here because I want to learn about runes and new applications for them.”

Верруд [he] beamed and nodded. “See? Вермил [he] may be a little rough around the edges, but he’s got the same goal as we do. Now, why don’t we all go get some food and–”

“Oh, and watch the students fight. I was thinking we should introduce skimpier uniforms for them,” Ной [he] said. “Some of the teachers too, for that matter.”

Верруд [he]’s eye twitched.

Let’s see you mediate that, buddy. Not that you will – your goal is to break these idiots free of me.

“Have you possibly had a bit much to drink before this meeting?” Верруд [he] asked Ной [he], his voice terse.

“I did have a few bottles,” Ной [he] said with a sheepish grin. “It’s real nerve-wracking meeting all of you. Figured I’d think better if I didn’t have to think too much at all.”

“Pathetic,” Якоб [he] said. He shook his head and turned, gesturing for his students to follow him toward the table – and straight in the direction of where Эмили [she] and the others sat. “Come on. We have better things to do than waste time with this Линвик [they] buffoon.”

“Just like most Торрин [he]s I know,” Ной [he] said. “Running away. Not really a surprise. I heard that was what Эвергрин [she] did in her last moments. I reckon the new head isn’t any different.”

Якоб [he] ignored him, but the same couldn’t be said for Марли [he]. The boy’s lips pulled back in a snarl.

“You don’t know when to shut your mouth, cockroach. My professor was trying to be as polite as one can be to someone as worthless as you, but it looks like getting your path paved for you into the program has given you delusions of grandeur. If one more vile word comes out of your mouth, I’ll challenge you myself.”

“You?” Ной [he] asked incredulously. “I’m a Rank 4. You’re – what, Rank 2?”

“Марли [he], come on,” Юлина [she] said, pulling at his arm. “This is pointless. Forget this–”

“There are more ways to fight than magic.” Марли [he] drew his sword and pointed it at Ной [he], completely ignoring Юлина [she]’s words. “And if you’re serious about coming here to learn, then I’ll be more than glad to teach you.”

Should have listened to the girl, bud. Can’t say I blame you, though. If I were in your shoes, I’d want to run me through as well.

Ной [he] let out a burst of laughter. “What, you want to spar me without magic? You won’t leave so much as a cut on me.”

“Is that a challenge?” Марли [he] asked.

“Марли [he],” Якоб [he] barked. “We are wasting time. Юлина [she] is correct. Come.”

“This will only take a few seconds,” Марли [he] replied. “I’m not going to let this

Линвик [they] disparage our name like this.”

“If you so much as touch me with that rapier of yours, then I’ll get on my knees and formally apologise to your entire family,” Ной [he] said with a chuckle. “I’ll give you all the time you need to try and land a blow, and we’ll go until we both agree the fight is over or until you touch me. No magic usage allowed. Sound good?”

“Hold on,” Юлина [she] said, grabbing Марли [he] by the shoulder. “What about if you win?”

“He’s not going to–” Марли [he] started, but his fellow student cut him off with a glare before turning her gaze to Ной [he].

She’s sharp. Bummer.

“I’d settle for you admitting that you’re incompetent enough that you can’t even so much as scratch a cockroach Линвик [they],” Ной [he] said with a shrug. “I’m not a bitter man. I recognize jealousy when I see it.”

“I’m going to run you through,” Марли [he] snapped, yanking his arm out of Юлина [she]’s grasp and raising his rapier. “I agree to your terms. Are you prepared, Линвик [they]?”

“We’ll see if I need to be.” Ной [he] covered a yawn. “Come on, then. You wouldn’t be the first Торрин [he] to ask to sword fight me, even if you’re a little under-equipped for it. Couldn’t you have gone with a weapon that people actually use for battle?”

Марли [he] lunged. Ной [he] stepped to the side, letting the blade pass by him harmlessly, then let the grin on his features grow wider. “I hope you can do better than that. If you can’t, I’m going to need some more alcohol to make this fight more interesting.”

The boy didn’t bother with a response. He pressed the attack harder, but each cut passed harmlessly through the air without so much as grazing Ной [he]’s skin. Верруд [he] watched from the sidelines, his lips pressed thin in annoyance.

Let’s see just how much time and energy I can make you waste here before you’re forced to give up. And don’t look so cross, Верруд [he]. If you’re already this annoyed, you’re going to blow a gasket by the end of the night.

We’re only getting started.
==========
Chapter 417: Юлина [she]

Марли [he]’s rapier hissed as it flicked out and found nothing but air for what must have been the hundredth time. It wasn’t that he was particularly bad with the weapon – though Ной [he] was confident that both Изабель [she] and Александра [she] were better – it was just that he was nothing in comparison to the monsters he’d been training against.

The boy was fast, but he wasn’t as fast as a rock thrown by a Chucker monkey. His sword might have been sharp, but Slashers had five of them on each hand. There was no kind way to put it. Марли [he] just wasn’t a worthy opponent.

If Ной [he] drew his flying sword and used it for, ironically, the one purpose he was pretty sure flying swords weren’t meant to do, the fight would have been over. He made no such moves. His goal wasn’t to beat Марли [he].

It was to completely waste the boy’s time. Their fight had already been going on for almost five minutes, and he could see the anger in Марли [he]’s eyes fading. That was the thing with anger – it could only last so long.

And, once it wore off, the only thing that remained were the consequences of one’s actions. Ной [he] grinned at Марли [he].

“You seem to be slowing down a little. You can’t be giving up, can you?”

Марли [he] grit his teeth. He was starting to get winded and was smart enough not to waste words on Ной [he]. Марли [he] lunged once more, trying to catch Ной [he] off-guard mid-sentence. The rapier passed by Ной [he]’s chest as he twisted, then smacked the blade away with a flick of a finger.

“You know, this would be a lot more effective if there was more than a single sharp bit on this thing,” Ной [he] observed.

Or if you actually knew how to use it. I reckon a rapier would be pretty dangerous in the hands of a master. But, even still, everything I know about rapiers imply they’re dueling weapons, not killing weapons.

“Is this meant to be some kind of joke?” Марли [he] demanded, drawing in a sharp breath before thrusting his blade again.

Ной [he] leaned back and let the rapier pass over his nose, then twisted his body and swept Марли [he]’s legs out from under him. They boy rolled as he hit the ground, coming up and driving the sword for Ной [he]’s chest.

It certainly didn’t seem like he was just going for grazing blows. If he stood still, Ной [he] was pretty certain the rapier would have run him straight through the heart. He spun, letting the rapier pierce through his spinning jacket.

Ной [he] kicked Марли [he]’s hand, ripping the rapier from his grip and sending it spinning across the room. It clattered to the ground and skidded up to the foot of a professor and his students.

“You lost your sword,” Ной [he] observed.

“Enough of this,” Якоб [he] ordered. “Do you feel no shame, Вермил [he]? You are a professor.”

“And I am teaching

Good luck even leaving a scratch on Body Rune empowered skin, Юлина [she].

Chapter 418: Body Runes

“Do you need a sword?” Александра [she] asked as she and Юлина [she] moved to stand several paces away from each other. “Yours doesn’t appear to have a blade.”

“It is still a sword,” Юлина [she] replied, pulling the hilt of the weapon from her side and holding it out before her with both hands. A hum emitted from it as ribbons of golden energy swirled up. They solidified, forming into a humming golden saber.

“We said swords only,” Александра [she] pointed out.

“Yes. I am not using my own magic. It is imbued, and it is a sword. It falls within the terms of our agreement.”

That’s my trick. You can’t just steal my trick.

He didn’t say anything, likely because there was only so much pride he could show when he’d just been thoroughly trounced, but it grated on Ной [he]’s nerves all the same. Good. She’s wasting time. Does make me wonder what Юлина [she] was planning, though. She seemed relatively clever. That sword of hers is clearly more than just a shiny stick. Юлина [she] was planning on using it to do something, but Александра [she] hasn’t given her a chance to yet. Interesting dilemma. In a normal fight, I’d be yelling for Александра [she] to finish it already before Юлина [she] gets a moment to do whatever it is she wants to. That isn’t this fight. We’re trying to waste time… so taking the risk is the right move.

It’s not like anyone’s going to be able to tell what you’re doing as long as there’s no magic in it.

If you had any idea just how much Александра [she] was holding back, you’d be crying right now. She could have literally picked you up and thrown you through the wall if she’d wanted to.

“It was a good fight,” Александра [she] said. I wonder if Якоб [he] and Марли [he] are closely related. They both look like they’re going to pop the same vein.

Let’s see what else you’ve got. The more cards I force you to play now, the less you’ll be able to surprise us with later. I haven’t even gotten halfway through my own hand yet.

Chapter 419: Eat

Even though Ной [he] suspected Верруд [he] and Якоб [he] weren’t done with his group yet, they’d bought themselves at least a little time – time which Ной [he] took to take measure of the other fights that were playing out across the продвинутая группа meeting room.

It definitely wasn’t out of the norm for students to spar. There were four other groups just beside him, and many of them were using even fewer restrictions than he and Александра [she] had. The flash of magic striking Shields filled the air, joined in with muted conversation.

He had to admit that it was a little odd to watch. A pair of students were positively wailing on each other, releasing blast after blast of magic and barely even trying to dodge. Their Shields were clearly of better make than their own abilities, because neither of them could so much as dent the other’s defenses.

They were surrounded by a small ring of professors and other students who were watching with apt interest. Midway through the fight, a professor stepped forward. Both students stopped and he told them something that Ной [he] couldn’t quite make out over the din.

A moment later, the fight restarted. It looked more like they were testing out the limits of their abilities than actually trying to spar.

As far as actual power goes… from the pressure coming off their attacks, looks like most of the students here are somewhere around Rank 2. Not all that different from my own students, but I suppose that’s a big reason they got the invite after it became clear that they were Rank 2s.

Ной [he] made his way over to the table. Изабель [she] and Эмили [she] sat, surrounded by all the other students. Мокси [she] stood behind them and Ли [she] sat off to the side, visibly restraining herself from vacuuming up all the food on the table. Their formation made it functionally impossible to get anywhere near Изабель [she] and Эмили [she].

Ли [she] did a remarkable recreation of Мокси [she]’s nose scrunch. She pointedly reached out and grabbed an entire roast chicken from a plate in the center of the table, plopping it down on her plate. She sent Ной [he] a challenging stare, then ripped a piece of it off and pressed it into her mouth. “One piece.”

That’s probably the absolute best I can possibly expect from her.

Ной [he] glanced over at Мокси [she] just as something prickled and pushed against his domain. He’d restrained it to the immediate area around him, but it still seeped out a bit more than he would have liked.

More importantly, if his domain was facing obstruction, they were at least Rank 4 – and were standing right behind him. He plucked a piece of chicken from Ли [she]’s plate before she could scarf it down, then turned to see whose attention he had drawn.

A tall, well-built man stood behind them. As Ной [he] had guessed, his uniform identified him as a Rank 4. He had fair features with light blonde hair and a large grimoire hung at his side. Ной [he] was forced to crane his neck back to look at the man’s face.

“Professor Вермил [he], was it?” the man asked.

“You never know,” Ной [he] replied with a nod to Мокси [she]. “That could be her.”

A patronizing smile passed over the man’s features for a brief instant. “Amusing. I saw your fight with the Торрин [he] students. You have impressive body control.”

There’s a line to add to my list of things that are only acceptable to say in the bedroom and not in public.

“It’s made easier when you’re a professor going up against a student,” Ной [he] said with a dismissive wave. “And I’m afraid you’ve got the advantage over me. I have no idea who you are.”

“Magus Anthony,” the man replied.

“Yes. I would like to test my own hand against you. Your movements were interesting, and I believe my students would have much to learn from watching a match between us,” Antony said. “You are more than welcome to choose the field and weapons. They will not change the outcome.”

Ah. I knew I smelled cocky asshole somewhere. Some big noble family, then. He’s got blonde hair, so he’s not Торрин [he] main or support branches. He could be with the Herrons, or an entirely different noble family throwing their hat into the ring.

“So long as we don’t have to leave this room,” Anthony amended. “They are typical duel rules, Professor Вермил [he].”

Ной [he] caught the implication in his words.

Typical duel rules that any proper noble would know, huh? I wonder if this guy is just a prick, or if he’s working together with Верруд [he] and Якоб [he]. Considering he sought me out, I’m getting the feeling it’s the latter.

Interacting with the other students is one of the main benefits of the продвинутая группа, Professor Вермил [he]. Connections take you far in life.”

Right. So your students are nowhere to be seen and totally aren’t going to show up and try to bother anyone the moment I leave.

“Good luck,” Ной [he] said, and he genuinely meant it. “Ли [she]?”

“Yeah?” Ли [she] peered at him from beside Anthony, excitement flashing in her eyes as her tongue ran along her lips.

“

Now you can eat.”

Chapter 420: New Faces

“Are you going to eat that?” Ли [she] asked, daintily dabbing at her mouth with a napkin.

Anthony stared at the chicken drumstick in his hands like it was the vilest thing he’d ever been forced to bear witness to. He’d already opened his jacket and undone his belt to try and make space where there was none. A thin sheen of sweat covered his face and his lips trembled as he brought his hand up, forcing his lips to part in an attempt to take another bite.

He froze in place for several seconds. His knuckles turned white and his jaw clenched as the fierce mental battle he was locked within played out upon his face. Ли [she] slowly reached out, pulling the drumstick from his hands and sliding the entire thing into her mouth.

“Thanks.”

Anthony swallowed. Ной [he] was pretty sure the man would have gotten angry if he had quite literally any energy left that wasn’t already devoted to trying to keep all the food he’d stuffed down his gullet down.

All things considered, he’d done a pretty good job. He’d managed to eat five plates piled high with food. Against anyone normal, that probably would have managed to net him a victory. Against Ли [she], it was like screaming into a hurricane.

Anthony swallowed. He braced his hands against the table, his eyes shifting to the next plate – and then his face went green. Lunging to his feet, he staggered away and did his best impression of a penguin with bowel irritation as he desperately waddled off into the crowd.

“Oh. He left,” Ли [she] said, her face crumpling. She took a bite out of the napkin she’d been wiping her face with. “Damn. Does that mean it’s over? Or are we going to start again when he comes back?”
