Chapter 465: Mistake

Врит [he]’s eyes darted around the room in search for any sign of the demon’s arrival, but there were none. The door was closed and locked. There were no large cracks in the walls or holes in the ceiling.

There was no way that anyone should have been able to enter without, at the very least, making their presence known. The back of her scalp prickled.

“If Паук [he] wants to challenge me, then he should have come himself,” Фрот [he] snarled, pushing out of his chair. Claws sprouted from his fingers soundlessly and he bared his teeth. “He dares send a messenger to infiltrate my court?”

Court is a bit much, Фрот [he].

“You never said how you got in here,” Врит [he] said. “If you wish to bargain with us, then you should at least approach the proper way.”

“She is correct,” Фрот [he] growled. His fingers flexed and he took a step toward the intruder. “This Паук [he] lacks understanding of how business is done. He has no respect. You have not even introduced yourself, yet you dare make demands and break into our sanctum?”

“Oh, sorry. I forgot about that bit. I’m Ли [she],” the demon said, completely unperturbed. “And I think you missed something.”

“Oh?” Фрот [he]’s voice was like a deadly sharp razor as it ground out from between his clenched teeth. “And what would that be?”

“We aren’t bargaining.” Ли [she] stretched her arms over her head and yawned. “And you aren’t worthy of respect. Can you just let me know what your decision is? Паук [he] is going to be pissed at me if I start doing stuff without an answer, but I’m hungry and you’re making me waste time.”

A deep sense of unease built in Врит [he]’s gut. Ли [she] was entirely too unconcerned with everything. This went too far for it to just be a bluff, and they still had no explanation as to how she’d managed to break into their room completely unannounced.

“She’s got to have some form of artifact,” Врит [he] muttered. “Something that lets her conceal herself. That’s why she’s so bold.”

Фрот [he] glanced to Врит [he], then his lips pulled back in a smirk. “Is that so? Evading my awareness before I know of your presence is one thing, but don’t think you’re going to leave without my permission.”

Ли [she] just stared at them. “That’s not an answer. I can’t leave until you give me one anyway, so could you just get on with it?”

“My answer to Паук [he] will be your head delivered on a plate.” Фрот [he] spat on the ground. “Try to run, messenger. See how far it gets you.”

“That’s a no, then?” Ли [she] asked, tilting her head to the side. “Wait. Is that a no from you, or a no from your whole gang? Do you mind if I come back in a second? I need to ask Паук [he] something. I can’t remember if I’m supposed to just kill you or if it’s meant to be everyone here.”

Фрот [he] blurred, the only sound of his motion a single thud as he launched himself toward the arrogant demon. His claws flashed through the air like streaks of silver light, moving so quickly that Врит [he] could barely even follow him.

Despite her position, she couldn’t help but feel a flicker of admiration. This was the reason that Фрот [he] was the streetlord. Врит [he] didn’t think of herself as a particularly slow demon, but Фрот [he] was easily twice as fast as she was.

Fighting him was impossible. Every single match they’d had always ended in the exact same way. The same way it had already inevitably gone for Паук [he]’s messenger. Complete and utter defeat.

There was a faint snik of claw carving through flesh. Врит [he] started to blow out a relieved breath, already trying to determine what their next step would be in dealing with Паук [he]. Then she spotted Ли [she] standing — not before Фрот [he], but beside him.

Blood dripped from her fingers, which had more than doubled in length and turned to razor-sharp claws. Врит [he]’s lips parted in disbelief as Фрот [he] peeled apart like a rotted fruit behind Ли [she], split into six strips.

The remains of his body collapsed to the floor in a pool of bloody noodles that once been her brother. Ли [she] shook her hand off as the fingers returned to normal. Her eyes flicked to Врит [he]. A very un-demonlike whimper escaped Врит [he]’s lips and she took a step back.

Фрот [he] — how? I — no. This isn’t possible!

Фрот [he] couldn’t lose. Not like that. He was the strongest demon she’d met, and this wasn’t even Паук [he]. It was just his messenger. Врит [he]’s back hit the stone wall with a thud and she realized that she’d been backing up. Blood pounded in her ears and her palms prickled with sweat.


Ли [she] hadn’t budged from her spot. Involuntary shivers gripped Врит [he]’s body. The small demon was so fast that Врит [he] couldn’t so much as see her move. Фрот [he] hadn’t even stood a chance against Ли [she]. Врит [he]’s survival instincts took over as she analyzed the situation, searching for a way out, and it took a remarkably short time for her to find it.

The only way out was death.

I’m going to die here? Like this?

“Oh, crud,” Ли [she] said, grabbing the back of her head and letting out a groan. “Oh, I screwed up.”

Врит [he] stared at her, not even daring to say a word. Perhaps the demon was just completely insane. If Ли [she] didn’t pay her any attention and she crept around the side of the room, there was a chance she could slip —

“You,” Ли [she] said, thrusting a finger in Врит [he]’s direction and killing any hopes the demon had left.

“Y-yes?” Врит [he] asked weakly.

Ли [she] grabbed a handful of the bloody strips that had once been Врит [he]’s brother and held them up with a distraught look. “Can you find where his head is?”

Врит [he] swallowed. Ли [she] wasn’t just the fastest demon she’d ever seen. The short demon was a damned sadist. Even if Врит [he] hadn’t loved Фрот [he], he’d still been family in the loosest sense of the word.

“It’s shredded,” Врит [he] forced out. “And soaked in blood. There isn’t much of it left.”

“Oh, no,” Ли [she] tugged at her hair. “How am I supposed to mount his head on anything? Do you know how to stick it back together?”

What kind of twisted creature do you think I am?

“No,” Врит [he] managed, mustering what little self-respect she still had left. If she was going to die, then she wasn’t going to do it scrounging around for a way to paste her dead brother’s head back together so someone could mount it from their wall. A proper demon would have charged Ли [she] to die a proper death, but the only other thing Врит [he] could muster was a weak, “I don’t.”

“We’re in so much trouble,” Ли [she] muttered, chewing on the ends of her fingers. “Паук [he] said I had to mount the streetlord’s head from a stick if he refused the offer to surrender, then kill the whole camp. But how am I supposed to do that if he’s shredded?”

She can’t be serious. Is she genuinely asking for advice after shredding my streetlord in front of me?

“I — how would I know?” Врит [he] stammered. “And you’re the one that did it! How am I in trouble? You’re just going to kill me anyway!”

“You saw it,” Ли [she] said. “You should have told me that I had to leave his head intact, so it’s partially your fault.”

“How does that make any sense?” Врит [he] demanded, incredulity somehow managing to overwhelm her mounting terror. “You’re the one that killed him! I didn’t know you were going to do that!”

“Yes you did. I told you I would if you didn’t surrender.”

“Who would actually believe that?” Врит [he] asked. “Everyone threatens to kill people all the time! Nobody actually manages to do it that quickly!”

“Your fault,” Ли [she] insisted. She chewed her lower lip, then cursed. “Паук [he] is going to be so pissed. I screwed up.”

Врит [he]’s fear continued to mount. If a monster like this was so terrified of Паук [he], then the demon had to be leagues even more powerful than she was. That was a scale that Врит [he] couldn’t begin to even comprehend.

“He might not let me eat jerky for a week if he finds out about this,” Ли [she] muttered, but the blood pounding in Врит [he]’s ears was so loud that she completely missed it.

“I — if you let me live, I won’t tell him?” Врит [he] offered, more than aware of how pathetic her request was. There was no reason to leave someone alive with a secret when killing them would be far more effective.

Ли [she]’s eyes lit up. “Oh! That’s it!”

Врит [he] blinked. “It is?”

“Yeah! I’ve got it!” Ли [she] exclaimed. Before Врит [he] could ask what she meant, Ли [she] scooped up the remains of her brother and started shoveling them into her mouth. The words froze in Врит [he]’s mouth and she watched with horror as every last scrap of Фрот [he] vanished into Ли [she]’s gullet in the span of seconds.

What the fuck?

“Okay,” Ли [she] said, wiping the blood from her mouth once she’d finished. She glanced around. “You don’t see any left, do you?”

Врит [he] nearly threw up on the spot. “I — no. I don’t.”

“Nobody else is here either,” Ли [she] said. “Good. This is perfect.”

“It is?” Врит [he] asked weakly.

“Yeah. Here’s what happened. You killed Фрот [he].”

A spike of panic shot through Врит [he]. Ли [she] was planning to pin the entire thing on her. Living a bit longer wasn’t worth it if it meant being punished by someone so awful that the cannibalistic monster before her was terrified of them.

“What? No! I’m not just going to take the fall for you! Just kill me already”

“No! Then he’ll know something went wrong and I won’t be able to stick anyone’s head up on a post. I already ate the other guy, so he’s gone. We’ve got to do it the other way.”

“I’m not going to let Паук [he] torture me!”

“Torture?” Ли [she] gave Врит [he] a baffled look. “Why would he do that? All we have to do is say that you killed Фрот [he] before he got to answer my question! That would make you streetlord, right?”

Врит [he] opened her mouth, then paused. She blinked. “I… suppose? But how would that help? Are you going to kill me and stick my head on a spike?”

“So you agree that you killed Фрот [he]?” There was a dangerous glint in Ли [she]’s eyes. “Which would make you streetlord?”

Something told Врит [he] that Ли [she] wasn’t going to accept any answer other than yes. At the very least, it looked like Фрот [he] hadn’t suffered long. She squeezed her eyes together and nodded. “Yes.”

“Great! So do you surrender to Паук [he]?”

Врит [he] cracked an eye open. The same question Ли [she] had asked Фрот [he]. Ли [she] watched her expectantly. The other eye cracked open.

A tiny flicker of hope caught in her chest as she realized the game Ли [she] was playing at. If Фрот [he] was dead before he answered Ли [she]’s question, then Ли [she] could re-direct the question to the new streetlord.

If she said no, she’d end up just like Фрот [he], but with a head left intact to mount on a spike. But if she threw her pride as a demon to the side… there was a chance.

Врит [he] dropped to the ground and prostrated herself before Ли [she]. “We surrender. Please don’t stick my head on a spike.”
==========
Chapter 466: Streetlord

Liquid magma pumped through Айлин [she]’s veins. His entire body felt like it had grown ten degrees hotter. He could feel every single one of his nerves — and not in a good way.

“So?” Вайолет [she] asked, eagerness and trepidation mixing in her voice. “Do you feel different?”

Her heartbeat thudded in her ears, a constant rhythm that cut his words off every time he tried to form them. Айлин [she]’s brow furrowed in concentration as he blocked it out.

“Yeah. It’s… strange. I don’t know how I’m supposed to describe it.” Айлин [she] rubbed his fingers together. The beds of his fingers warmed and a crackle of energy ran between them. He flinched, freezing in place. “I’m so much more aware. It’s like I was walking around with my ears sewn shut before. Now there’s so much information that I can barely handle it.” He caught the concern in Вайолет [she]’s expression and quickly amended, “but I can tell that I’ll adapt to it. My body is just different. Not worse.”

Вайолет [she] glanced over her shoulder. “He’s not here, is he?”

Айлин [she] hesitated for a second before shaking his head. He was pretty sure nobody was in the tent other than them right now, but after what he’d seen Паук [he] and his companions do, he had absolutely no plans of betting against any of them. “I don’t think so, but I don’t know.”

“I can’t believe he just… made you a Rank 3,” Вайолет [she] said. She stared down at her hands. “Just like that.”

“It wasn’t for free,” Айлин [she] muttered. “I’m supposed to be a streetlord. How am I meant to do that when the only people here only know me as the rat that lived in the gutters at the edge of their territory?”

“Most of them probably won’t recognize you at all,” Вайолет [she] pointed out. “And nobody is going to challenge Паук [he].”

“Not Паук [he]. Not anytime soon, at least,” Айлин [she] agreed with a small nod. “But me? I’m a different story. The moment he isn’t paying attention, someone will try their hand. Why wouldn’t they? One subordinate is just as good as another. If someone can take me out quickly, nobody would assume Паук [he] gives a shit.”

Вайолет [she] gritted her teeth. She knew he was right, but they really didn’t have much option. Fleeing was impossible. Any chance of escaping Паук [he]’s clutches had evaporated the instant he’d taken food from the demon — and taking runes from him had only solidified Айлин [she]’s position even further.

“Maybe he won’t be so bad,” Вайолет [she] said. “He ordered the gang to bring Торик [he] and Эдда [she] here. Maybe we’re just useful to him as we are right now.”

“More likely he’s bringing them here to remind me what he’s doing for us,” Айлин [she] said with a shake of his head. “But you’re right. For a demon as powerful as Паук [he] is, he’s treating us way better than I would have expected. Tools or not, I’m strong enough to actually get food now. We can eat.”

A small laugh slipped from Вайолет [she]’s lips. “I guess that means taking the food from him was actually the right call. Your instincts aren’t completely broken after all.”

“More like I got lucky. Everything you said back in the hideout was right.” Айлин [she]’s breath felt hot as he let out a sigh. His entire body brimmed with energy that he’d never felt before, to the point where he held Вайолет [she]’s hand as limply as he could just to make sure he didn’t actually break anything.

She’d always been stronger than him — not by all that much, since they both had only had a single Demon Rune, but hers had been better. But now… Айлин [she] had seen what a Rank 3 could do. Even sneezing while touching Вайолет [she] could hurt her.

I wonder if Паук [he] would be willing to make Вайолет [she] and the others Rank 3s as well — no. I can’t go down that line of thought. If I start relying on him for everything, then we’ll all become so indebted to Паук [he] that we completely lose ourselves. I owe him too much, but the others don’t. Not yet.

Айлин [she]’s ears twitched as conversation from outside the tent reached them. He still wasn’t used to their new sensitivity and the new flavors flooding the air like invisible broth, but he picked up something familiar.

Торик [he] and Эдда [she] were nearby — and they weren’t alone. Айлин [she]’s eyes narrowed and he released Вайолет [she]’s hand, sliding down from the throne and dropping to his feet. Rank 3 or not, his body hadn’t grown very much in size, so Голон [he]’s chair was far too large for him.

“What is it?” Вайолет [she] asked.

“Торик [he] and Эдда [she] are here, but something’s holding them up,” Айлин [she] said. He paused for a moment, his ears twitching. “I think. I can’t really tell.”

Паук [he] might have put him under protection, but that didn’t necessarily extend to Вайолет [she] and the others. Айлин [she]’s eyes narrowed and he strode toward the exit. Вайолет [she] hopped down from the chair and hurried after Айлин [she] as he stepped out of the tent. Паук [he] hadn’t told them to stay put, after all.

A small group of demons had gathered near the edge of the old market square, and Айлин [she] recognized Робон [he] near their center. Айлин [she] and Вайолет [she] pushed through the demons, weaving through the crowd until they broke through it.


“Вайолет [she]! Айлин [she]!” Торик [he] exclaimed, spotting them almost instantly. He was doing a good job of hiding the terror in his expression, but his scrunched shoulders and the darting path of his gaze told Айлин [she] that Торик [he] was just as scared as he had been a few hours ago.

Actually, I’m still terrified. Just of Паук [he] instead of the rest of these demons.

“Come on,” Айлин [she] said, all too aware of the gazes boring into his and Вайолет [she]s’ backs. The sooner they got out of the public, the better. They didn’t need attention. Especially not when Паук [he] wasn’t immediately around. “Let’s head back to the tent.”

“Throwing commands around already?” a demon that Айлин [she] didn’t recognize asked with a cold laugh. “Didn’t take you long to get used to leeching off Паук [he]’s power, did it?”

Айлин [she] didn’t respond. The rules to survival were staying out of sight and attention. Every instinct he had screamed at him to hide, but he couldn’t. Паук [he] had made that impossible.

Торик [he] and Эдда [she] both stepped away from Робон [he], who did nothing but watch as they hurried over to join him and Вайолет [she]. But, before they could reunite, the demon that had spoken stepped into their path.

Айлин [she]’s stomach clenched.

“You know, Паук [he] didn’t say anything about what we had to do after they got to camp. He doesn’t care about the other runts,” the demon said. “Who’s to say what happens to them after they get here?”

“Are you an idiot?” Робон [he] asked before Айлин [she] could even get a chance to open his mouth. “Why would Паук [he] call them here if he didn’t care? Are you trying to get yourself killed? Or did you want him to kill all of us?”

“He wants us for a reason,” the other demon countered. “He isn’t going to kill everyone. He’s just someone making a power move. As long as we follow his orders, he won’t care what we do between ourselves.”

“You’re going to get all of us killed with your arrogance,” Робон [he] growled. “We both saw what he was capable of. What makes you think we’re worth an insect’s fart in his eyes? We’re just convenient. He made that clear when he chose a worthless street rat to be our leader. What kind of message do you think he was trying to pound into your thick skull?”

“You know what? I think you’re scared,” the other demon said, his pale gray lips pulling back in a cold smile. “You’re down a hand, Робон [he]. I haven’t seen the new streetlord select a second yet. Maybe you’re worried about what happens when you get replaced.”

The tension in the crowd started to rise as murmurs rolled through it. Айлин [she] sent a panicked look back at Паук [he]’s tent, but the impossibly powerful demon was nowhere to be seen. Either he didn’t know about what was happening or, more likely, he just didn’t care.

Паук [he] wasn’t going to step into every single minor conflict the gang had. And, worse, Айлин [she] got the feeling that the antagonizing demon was right. Робон [he] was scared. Not so long ago, Робон [he] had been an indomitable existence that Айлин [she] couldn’t even dream of so much as even speaking beside.

But now, compared to the other demons in the camp, he wasn’t nearly as powerful as he once had been — and Паук [he] hadn’t said a single thing about leaving the second in command alone.

The crowd pressed tighter, sensing blood. Робон [he]’s jaw clenched and he bared his teeth. “You want to try me? I could kill you with no hands. One is more than enough, Dreek.”

Айлин [she]’s ears prickled as he picked up on a faint movement and a taste brushed across his tongue. His gaze flicked back to Паук [he]’s tent. The masked demon stood before it, watching them silently.

Shit. I have to do something. Паук [he] made it pretty clear that he can turn anyone into a Rank 3 just at a whim. If I can’t prove my worth as a streetlord, then he’ll just replace me.

“Enough,” Айлин [she] said, his voice coming out more as a squeak than a command. It was, unfortunately, just loud enough for everyone in the crowd to turn toward him. Hundreds of eyes bore into Айлин [she]’s skull like sharp nails.

“What’s this?” Dreek asked, his lips pulling back in a smirk. “Does the new streetlord wish something of me?”

“Yeah,” Айлин [she] said. He forced the words out from his mouth before he could falter. “Go do whatever it is you normally do.”

Anger twisted Dreek’s features. “Паук [he] only said you were the streetlord, not that we had to treat you any differently than a normal streetlord. Do you really think he’d have that much problem with a more capable person in your position? You’d best start watching your step more carefully.”

Dreek moved in Торик [he]’s direction. Айлин [she] had absolutely no idea if the demon was planning to try anything. He didn’t get a chance to find out. His body shifted faster than he’d thought it capable of.

He was still halfway through barking out, “Stop!” When he realized that his hand was lodged in Dreek’s back. A shocked silence gripped the crowd of demons like a constricting noose.

Айлин [she] staggered back, ripping his hand free in a spray of viscera. He stared at his bloodied fingers, at the hole in Dreek’s chest just beyond them. Dreek let out a gasping wheeze. His hands clutched at the huge wound and blood bubbled from his lips, muting any final words as the demon collapsed, dead before he hit the ground.

“Rank 3,” Робон [he] whispered. “I know that strength. Impossible. How are you Rank 3?”

Words refused to form at Айлин [she]’s tongue. A rush of violent freezing energy slammed into him, swirling through his soul like the caress of a freezing river.

“Паук [he] willed it,” Вайолет [she] said, striding forward and throwing her arms around Торик [he] and Эдда [she]. “Айлин [she] is the streetlord. There’s a reason for that. Does anyone else want to try him?”

Вайолет [she]’s demands carved through the crowd like a blade. The demons backed away. Айлин [she]’s ears twitched as he heard Паук [he] step back into his tent, satisfied. Even though the demons’ awed gazes were on Айлин [she] rather than the masked demon, a chill ran down his back.

Was he planning on this when he ordered for Торик [he] and Эдда [she] to be brought here?

Айлин [she] didn’t get a chance to think his fears through for long. Айлин [she]’s ears twitched and he turned as a female demon leapt from one of the rooftops, landing on the ground beside him with wide, panicked eyes. The demon tasted like fear.

“Streetlord, we’ve got a problem,” she said nervously. “Фрот [he]’s executioner is heading right for our camp.”

Executioner? I don’t like the sound of that.

“Idiot,” Робон [he] spat. “He must think we’re weak because Голон [he] died. But Врит [he] isn’t stupid. We haven’t seen her in a while. Is it possible she’s grown stronger? She was already a powerful Rank 3.”

Every single eye in the crowd turned back to Айлин [she]. His heart sank.

Oh, damn it all.

“Do you desire a weapon, streetlord?” Робон [he] asked, his eyes flicking to Айлин [she]’s bloodied hand. “It seems Врит [he] has come to challenge you.”
==========
Chapter 467: Врит [he]

It took every scrap of self-control that Айлин [she] had to keep his eye from twitching. Today was just one thing going wrong after the other without so much as a breather in between them.

Is Паук [he] the Archdemon of Bad Luck or something? How can so many problems even exist? The most important thing I’ve ever had to deal with was getting enough food.

It wasn’t like he could run, though. Retreating from a challenge was the same as admitting he had been defeated — and that would mean he was no longer the streetlord. There was no way Паук [he] would let him or any of the others live if they didn’t have any worth.

Streetlords could always have their second fight in their place if a fight wasn’t worth their effort, but the closest thing he had to a second right now was Робон [he]. At Rank 2 and down a hand, Айлин [she] was pretty sure the large demon somehow had even less of a chance against Врит [he] than he did.

“Did you want a weapon?” Робон [he] repeated, the stress in his voice evident. “We don’t have much time before Врит [he] arrives.”

I don’t know how to use a damn weapon. What good would one do me?

“No need,” Айлин [she] forced out with a shake of his head. “I’m fine as is.”

Робон [he] inclined his head. The crowd around them murmured.

“He thinks he can beat Врит [he] without a weapon? How strong did Паук [he] make him?” one demon muttered.

“The boy is a street rat,” another demon said. “He just has no idea what he’s up against. Врит [he] is just going to take care of this for us and Паук [he] will put someone more competent in charge.”

Айлин [she] tuned them out. Nothing they had to say would be of any use. Вайолет [she] leaned close and lowered her voice to whisper into his ear.

“Can you fight someone like that?”

No. Паук [he] didn’t make me that strong. And even if he did, I’m not immortal. I’ve barely ever been in a proper fight. Experience is going to count for more than anything else.

“I don’t know,” Айлин [she] muttered back. His mind raced and blood thumped in the back of his head, threatening to drown out the whisper of the streets. He could do nothing but shake his head.

Паук [he] definitely wasn’t going to interfere. Really, he couldn’t. If Паук [he] wanted Айлин [she] to have any semblance of proper respect as a streetlord, he couldn’t step in to kill every single threat that cropped up.

Айлин [she] swallowed. Then he set his jaw. At the very least, he didn’t want to fight Врит [he] here. Not where Торик [he] and Эдда [she] could see. There was the very small chance that he could come out on top if he managed to catch Врит [he] off guard.

He had no choice but to try and take it.

“Take Торик [he] and Эдда [she] back to the tent,” Айлин [she] said to Вайолет [she], speaking with as much confidence as he could muster. “I’m going to go deal with Врит [he]. I’ll be back soon.”

It would be really embarrassing if I get killed after saying something like that, but it’s not like I can be embarrassed after I’m dead.

Вайолет [she]’s lips pressed thin. She definitely didn’t want to agree to his request, but one look at the crowd and the panic on the other two demons’ faces was enough to force a nod from her.

“Be careful,” Вайолет [she] said.

Айлин [she] just nodded. The crowd parted before him and he set off in the direction that Врит [he] was coming from, his back as stiff as a rod. He was pretty sure that his performance wasn’t fooling anyone. It didn’t matter.


If he fought Врит [he] away from the others, there was always the miniscule chance that Паук [he] would pull one more string to protect his investment. Айлин [she] was pretty sure that was the only actual chance he had to win the fight against another Rank 3, even with the element of surprise on his side.

He strode away from the square and soon broke line of sight with the market square. A part of him was almost thankful for it. At least he wouldn’t have a huge audience. There would doubtlessly still be spotters watching the fight, but there was nothing he could do about that.

I need to find a way to survive this. I don’t want to leave Вайолет [she] and Торик [he] and Эдда [she] behind. They’re counting on me. If Врит [he] kills me, then who knows what Паук [he] or the other demons will do to them.

But what can I do?

Айлин [she] nearly missed a step as he heard footsteps coming toward him. He drew to a stop as he spotted a woman approaching from the far end of the street. She wore black leathers plated with metal around her vitals and bore two wicked looking short swords at her sides.

He wet his lips, picking up on her taste. It was difficult to read the demon. There was bitterness and strength, mixed with iron determination and… fear? Айлин [she]’s brow furrowed. That couldn’t have been right. He didn’t have time to wonder further.

That’s definitely Врит [he].

Айлин [she] remained locked in place as she approached. Despite his desperation to succeed, his legs wouldn’t let him walk any farther toward her. The Rank 3 demon moved with the deadly grace of a sandsnake slithering across the Wastes. Врит [he] was beautiful in the manner which only a predator could be — the last thing that countless demons had likely seen before they’d been sent into the great beyond. Айлин [she]’s heart sank even further.

A large part of him had expected her to be a hulking beast like Голон [he]. He’d been hoping to rely on being faster than Врит [he]. Even if she’d been strong, it wouldn’t have mattered if she couldn’t hit him. That didn’t look like it would be the case. Врит [he]’s figure was lean and her movements were practiced. She was probably faster than him.

Should I try to attack before she’s ready? Can I even catch someone like that off guard?

Before Айлин [she] knew it, Врит [he] stood across from him. His ears twitched as he picked up on movement on the rooftops above them. Unfortunately, they weren’t there to help. They were spotters. Maybe from his own gang, maybe from another one coming to see what was going on.

“You are from Паук [he]’s gang,” Врит [he] said, the words dripping venom as they rolled from her lips. She wasn’t asking a question. “Take me to your streetlord.”

“I —” Айлин [she]’s voice broke and he coughed. It was a small mercy that Вайолет [she] wasn’t there. She never would have let him live that down, even as she accompanied him straight into the afterlife when Врит [he] killed them both. “I am the streetlord.”

Врит [he] stared down at Айлин [she]. He’d grown slightly since reaching Rank 3, but she was still a full head taller than him. Her dark eyes sparkled with incredulity. “

You?

”

“Yes,” Айлин [she] said, setting his jaw. This was it. At the very least, he refused to die like a sniveling cub. He shifted his stance and drew on his Rune, letting the heat pumping through his body intensify.

The temptation to strike before Врит [he] could built, but he crushed it. That was the move of a weakling. A vision of Паук [he] killing Голон [he] flashed through Айлин [she]’s mind.

If I manage to live long enough, that’s what I want to be like. And if I don’t… then the only thing I can do is choose to die like that. Not a coward, but a real Rank 3 demon. I won’t die while failing to get a cheap shot off.

“I’m the streetlord. Паук [he] selected me to lead Голон [he]’s gang.” Айлин [she] locked eyes with Врит [he] and crushed the fear swirling in his chest with even more power. He drank from his rune and prepared to burst into motion.

His ears twitched as a footstep caught his attention in an alley beside them. He didn’t dare take his eyes from Врит [he], but he tasted the sea of blood that was Ли [she] as she emerged from the darkness.

“That’s him,” Ли [she] said cheerfully. “You found him even faster than I did! That may have been because I stopped for a snack break, though. Whoops. Sorry, Айлин [she].”

The apology makes it pretty clear that she and Паук [he] aren’t about to help me out. I’m on my own.

“It’s fine,” Айлин [she] said through gritted teeth. The longer this dragged on, the more the anticipation ate away at his stomach. “If you’re here to challenge me, then I’m prepared to take your challenge.”

Will Врит [he] even give me the respect of a proper challenge? How is she going to attack? Her swords are sheathed. A kick? Her claws?

Врит [he] shifted. Айлин [she] flinched, raising his hands — only to find that Врит [he] hadn’t drawn her weapons or gone to strike him. She’d dropped to her knees before him. As Айлин [she] watched in abject disbelief, the terrifying demoness pressed her forehead to the ground.

“My deepest apologies. My name is Врит [he]. Фрот [he], the former streetlord of the Ravager gang, is dead at my hand. I have taken his place.” Врит [he] lifted her gaze to meet Айлин [she]’s once more. “And I have come to pledge fealty to you, as per Паук [he]’s command.”

Chapter 468: Surrender

Айлин [she] couldn’t help it. His eye twitched. The emotion gripping his chest had been twisted and warped so many times that he couldn’t tell what it was anymore. There wasn’t even any relief. There was just a heavy weariness that should have come with hundreds of years of age — a weariness he’d managed to completely develop in the span of a day.

Kneeling at his feet was someone who should have been one of the strongest demons he ever met in his life. Just a few short hours ago, he would have sprinted in the opposite direction as hard as his legs could have carried him if he’d gotten wind that someone like this was so much as looking in his direction.

Now, he just wanted to ask Ли [she] if she’d saved any extra food for him. His emotions were numb and completely shot through. He just didn’t have anything left to give.

“I politely request that you respond,” Врит [he] said, still prostrated before him. There was a line of taut anger in her voice that spurred him back into motion.

“I — uh, sure,” Айлин [she] said in what was likely the lamest possible way to accept a surrender in the history of the Damned Plains. “Sorry. I don’t really do this much. Am I supposed to say something else?”

Врит [he] ground her teeth in frustration. She definitely hadn’t meant for him to hear that, but Айлин [she] didn’t blame her. He couldn’t even imagine how it had to feel to be in her situation. Judging by Ли [she]’s presence beside them, he got the feeling that her surrender hadn’t been entirely voluntary.

“It is typically customary to offer terms of surrender.” Врит [he] chose each word carefully, speaking with humility so false that he could quite literally taste it. “The alternative would imply that you mean to take my entire gang as servants rather than members. I do not believe they will take kindly to it.”

Does that imply she would? What did Ли [she] do to the Ravager gang? Паук [he]’s entire group is just something else. I’m just glad they aren’t pissed at me, but I’m going to have to make sure it stays that way.

“Right,” Айлин [she] said hurriedly. “Maybe we should do that somewhere more private, rather than in the middle of the street?”

“That sounds like a splendid idea.” Врит [he]’s words were still clipped, telling Айлин [she] he’d evidently missed something.

“Oh. Uh… you can stand now,” Айлин [she] said through a wince. He probably should have started with that.

Врит [he] rose to her feet in a fluid motion. She brushed her knees off and sent him a pointed look. “Thank you, streetlord. Please feel free to lead the way to where we will continue our conversation. I will follow.”

“Uh, just Айлин [she] is fine. You’re a streetlord too, aren’t you? It seems weird to keep using titles.”

Врит [he] arched an eyebrow but inclined her head. “Very well. Айлин [she], then.”

Ли [she] gave him a thumbs up. Айлин [she] turned stiffly and started back toward the market square. Leaving his back open to Врит [he] made every single one of his senses scream at him in warning, but Ли [she] was right beside them. She probably wouldn’t let Врит [he] just kill him for no reason.

Also, no self-respecting demon would prostrate themselves all for the sake of a sneak attack on someone that should be way weaker than them. Especially not a streetlord.

His ears twitched as the spotters on the roofs shot off, doubtlessly running to report the news of what had happened to the camp — or other camps. It wouldn’t surprise him in the slightest if some of the other gangs had sent spotters to figure out what was going on in Голон [he]’s territory.

That was a problem to deal with later. He was a bit too concerned with the one walking behind him at the moment.

They soon made it back to the market square. Almost every demon that had been milling about had vanished, but Айлин [she] tasted them behind the cover of their tents and heard them shifting nervously as they watched him and Врит [he] walk through the camp.

After all that talk, nobody was bold enough to stick around and see what would happen when Врит [he] actually shows up. Just how scary is she? I don’t know anything about her or Фрот [he]’s gang other than the fact that she’s a Rank 3. I should really try to learn more if I don’t want to get blindsided every single time Паук [he] tosses me into something.

Айлин [she] automatically made a path back to Голон [he]’s tent before he properly thought about who would be waiting inside it. He pushed the flap open and held it for Врит [he]. She sent him a slightly surprised look as she stepped inside, but her gaze quickly flicked over his shoulder.

“We are not alone,” Врит [he] observed. “There are others in your throne. Should I be rid of them?”

Oh, shit. I sent Вайолет [she] back here with Торик [he] and Эдда [she].

The three of them were huddled on the throne, staring at Врит [he] with wide eyes. Вайолет [she] managed to plaster a confident expression over her face, and a flicker of relief mixed with the fear in her expression when it became clear that Айлин [she] hadn’t managed to get himself killed yet.


“No!” Айлин [she] barked, terrified that Врит [he] would move before he could stop her. “They’re allowed to be here. These are my siblings.”

“Your… siblings?” Врит [he] asked, her brow furrowing as she looked from him over to the others. The confusion was evident in her tone. As to what she was confused about, Айлин [she] was uncertain. “I see. Will they remain for the discussion of the terms of surrender?”

“You surrendered?” Вайолет [she] exclaimed.

“No,” Айлин [she] said. “She did.”

Врит [he]’s eye twitched. She clearly didn’t love being reminded of that, especially in the presence of a bunch of Rank 1 demons. Somehow, Айлин [she] found himself sympathizing with her.

“Whoa. You beat her up?” Эдда [she] asked. “That’s so co—”

Торик [he] clapped a hand over Эдда [she]’s mouth, silencing the rest of her sentence before it could escape. Judging by the look on Врит [he]’s face, that was probably the right move. Айлин [she] swallowed.

“Вайолет [she], could you take Торик [he] and Эдда [she] to another tent? If anyone bothers you, tell them that I’ll… uh, rip their heart out and feed it to them, I guess.”

The threat sounded lame as soon as it left his mouth. Врит [he] lifted a hand and coughed into her fist, but not nearly fast enough to hide the corner of her mouth twitching upward. She thought he was an idiot.

Great. Well, I suppose it doesn’t matter what she thinks of me so long as she remains terrified of Ли [she].

“Are you sure?” Вайолет [she] asked as she sent a look at Врит [he].

“Yeah. I’ll be fine. Don’t worry.”

Вайолет [she] nodded and hopped down from the throne, bringing Торик [he] and Эдда [she] with her. “We’ll be close. If you need anything, just call. I’ll bring Паук [he].”

She herded the two younger demons out of the room, sending one last glance over her shoulder at him before letting the tent flap fall shut, leaving Айлин [she] and Врит [he] alone in the room.

“Do they hide their power?” Врит [he] asked as she lowered her hand.

“No,” Айлин [she] said. His chest clenched and his eyes narrowed. “Please don’t pay them any attention. Any insult they may have given definitely wasn’t intended. If you do anything to them, I’m taking it as a declaration of war.”

Врит [he] tilted her head to the side, studying his features intensely. “You actually care about them? Not siblings, then. No matter. What are the terms—”

“Hold on,” Айлин [she] said. “What do you mean, not siblings?”

“You care,” Врит [he] said flatly. “You will need a more convincing lie as to their identity if you wish to protect them. Siblings are a threat. A tool to be leveraged, but not something to be cared for. Calling them family will not stop them from being leveraged against you.”

“They are my siblings,” Айлин [she] insisted. He wasn’t sure what gave him the sudden burst of confidence, but Врит [he]’s insinuation that he shouldn’t be allowed to care for the only family he had ground on him in the wrong way. “We don’t have the same parents, but they’re my brother and sisters.”

Врит [he]’s expression was unreadable for a second before she responded.

“You show more steel now than you did when you came to meet me on the street.” A flicker of amusement, so restricted that it may as well have not even been there, flashed across her lips. Her expression then grew weary. “The terms of surrender, then.”

What do I even ask for? I don’t know the faintest bit about how this is supposed to go. How much am I meant to get? Am I supposed to offer something back in exchange for avoiding a fight?

“Right. The terms of surrender.” Айлин [she] cleared his throat and nodded. “Er… no attacking my gang, I guess?”

“That would generally be the definition of surrender.” Врит [he] squinted at Айлин [she]. “Are you making fun of me?”

“What? No,” Айлин [she] said hurriedly as he tried to think of what else terms of surrender would involve. “How big is your camp? Do we need to consolidate our groups?”

“It is large, but perhaps we could handle logistics after we determine the actual terms,” Врит [he] ground out. She was definitely stressed, there was no doubt about it. Something told Айлин [she] he was completely missing something. Unfortunately, had no idea what it was.

“Just follow any orders Паук [he] gives you, I guess. Keep running your gang normally aside from that. He hasn’t really given me any orders beyond that.”

“That’s it?” Врит [he] asked, blinking.

Did I miss something?

“I think so? I’ll be honest, I’m more lost than you are. Just do what Паук [he] says to if you want to live. That’s it. As long as you don’t cause trouble or anything like that it should be fine.”

“Those are the terms?” Врит [he]’s eyes narrowed, poring over Айлин [she]’s features with such intensity that he nearly flinched back.

“Yes,” Айлин [she] said. “Just don’t try to find some weird loophole to hurt us and we’ll be fine.”

Врит [he] extended her hand, still watching him with suspicion. Айлин [she] lifted his own. She clasped the top of his arm and he did the same to hers.

“I agree to your terms,” Врит [he] said. She released his hand, then shook her head. “Now that I have agreed — tell me. What is Паук [he] going to do? Why would you offer such a deal?”

“I have no damned idea.” Айлин [she] threw his hands up. “Паук [he] does whatever he wants to, but I haven’t seen him hurt anyone that did what he told them to do. What is it that I missed in the terms? You’re acting like I completely passed over something really important.”

“I watched Фрот [he] accept several surrenders during his time as streetlord. The defeated streetlords that got away in the best shape had Фрот [he]’s symbol branded across his face and chest. The others were lucky to leave with both of their arms.”

Айлин [she]’s face twisted in distaste. “That’s vile. You thought I’d require something like that?”

“I will not seek to change your mind now. The terms have already been agreed upon,” Врит [he] said quickly.

“I have no plans of trying to do that to anyone.” Айлин [she] shook his head, somehow feeling even more tired than he had before.

Врит [he]’s features twitched for a second as she fought an internal battle. He wasn’t sure if she won or lost, but she eventually managed to force a pair of words from her mouth.

“Thank you.”

“Yeah,” Айлин [she] muttered. He massaged his forehead.

Can I please just sleep? I’m so tired. I can’t deal with anything else today. There shouldn’t be —

“We should discuss logistics now,” Врит [he] said. “The new chain of command and my place in your gang must be determined.”

Gods save me.

Chapter 469: Pact

It didn’t take Айлин [she] long to reveal just how little he knew about logistics — or anything streetlord related. Врит [he]’s stare bored into him, making it quite clear how evident his lack of understanding was.

“You don’t know the ranks and roles of your own people?”

“Forget ranks,” Айлин [she] said, throwing his hands up. “I don’t even know their names.”

That only made her confusion grow even stronger. “Why would you need to know their names?”

“…so I know who I’m talking to?”

“It shouldn’t matter. As long as you know what purpose they serve, a name is irrelevant. Names get you attached.”

“They’re part of my gang. Aren’t I supposed to care about them or something like that?”

Врит [he] squinted at him. “Why are you asking me?

You’re the streetlord.”

“So are you,” Айлин [she] pointed out.

“A streetlord that surrendered. You just didn’t take my title from me for some reason.” Врит [he] shook her head. “Worst streetlord I’ve ever met.”

Айлин [she] couldn’t keep an exasperated sigh from escaping his mouth. He was beyond the point of worrying about pissing Врит [he] off. She was just as screwed as he was and he just didn’t have the energy to walk on eggshells anymore.

“I’m going to come clean with you. I don’t know what I’m doing.”

“Coming clean should imply that you’ve got something to reveal. You’re as transparent as a pane of glass,” Врит [he] said through a laugh, but Айлин [she] didn’t miss the unease that settled around Врит [he]’s shoulders and bore down on her neck. “That’s an interesting way to break me. I didn’t see it coming. Where’s the real streetlord, then?”

“Still me,” Айлин [she] said.

“What?” Врит [he] blinked and frowned. “I’m not following where this is going anymore. Are you the streetlord or not?”

“I just said. I am. I just have no idea what I’m doing. Голон [he] is dead, but I didn’t kill him. Паук [he] did. He just put me in charge.”

“I’d gathered that much. The part I don’t get is why you know nothing. Your reaction speed should put you somewhere around low Rank 3. I’ve seen how fast you’ve moved when you get startled. You can’t get to that rank and be as clueless as you’re acting, so what gives?”

Айлин [she] let out a short burst of laughter. It hardly mattered if he revealed how he’d become a Rank 3 to Врит [he] now. She’d find out at some point soon enough anyway. Паук [he] had only told him not to share specifics, after all.

“I was Rank 1 about a day ago. Паук [he] made me a Rank 3.”

“He made you a Rank 3?”

“Just like that.” Айлин [she] nodded. “Don’t ask for more. I won’t say. But I was starving together with my siblings before he showed up. He killed Голон [he], took over the gang, then brought me to Rank 3 and said I was in charge so he wouldn’t have to deal with it.”

“What the fuck? How powerful is Паук [he]? What kind of demon can just… make a Rank 3 at will?” Врит [he] muttered. She swallowed heavily and realization set in on her features. “That’s why you were close to a bunch of weak demons. You were the same as them just a short while ago.”

“Yeah. And now I’m this.” Айлин [she] gestured vaguely around himself. “So you’ll have to forgive me if I have no damned idea what I’m doing. Until recently, the only thing I knew about streetlords is that they were terrifying and to be avoided at all costs.”

Врит [he] tilted her head to the side and studied Айлин [she]’s features for a few seconds. “And you haven’t passed out from terror yet?”

“I’m working on it,” Айлин [she] replied dryly. “Give me a little while for everything to catch up with me and I probably will. It’s not like passing out will help anything.”

“I knelt at the feet of a street rat. How far I have fallen,” Врит [he] grumbled. Then she hesitated, an inscrutable expression replacing the annoyance. “Wait. You came prepared to fight me? Did you truly believe that you had the slightest chance to defeat a trained warrior if you’ve never been in a proper fight in your life?”

“I’ve been in a proper fight! But no, I didn’t think I’d win. I was hoping you’d be a big hulking demon that I had a chance of outrunning, not… well, you.”

Very eloquent, Айлин [she]. Well done.

“You knew you were likely to die and you came anyway? You could have sent a second — or did you not know?”

“I knew, but I heard enough of your reputation to know that you’d just kill my second and kill me next. There was no reason to just waste someone like that, and I didn’t want to force my siblings to watch me get killed. Besides, I always could have gotten lucky. You never know.”

The corner of Врит [he]’s lip curled up. “Yes, I do. You would have died had we fought. You knew it too. I saw it in your eyes the moment we drew close. And yet you remained. Brave, for a street rat.”

“A streetlord,” Айлин [she] corrected, a flicker of heat coursing through his chest as he held Врит [he]’s gaze. “I’m a street rat no more. I may not have deserved the gift, but I got it nonetheless.”


To his surprise, Врит [he] inclined her head in acknowledgement. “A street lord indeed. Well spoken. How old are you? You seem more… apt than I would have expected.”

“Nineteen. Вайолет [she] and I used to be in a caravan and we’d read everything we could find. It helped. We had hopes of becoming merchants.”

“Merchants? Quite the change of path.” Врит [he]’s expression flickered. “You do not look nineteen.”

“The caravan got destroyed. We’ve been living on scraps for years, even before we got to Трэдон [he]. It’s not really that much of a surprise that I’m small when I haven’t been able to get any energy. And you aren’t that much taller than me.”

Врит [he] arched an eyebrow and took a step forward so they were chest-to-chest. She looked down at him, standing literally a full head taller. “Reality begs to disagree.”

She had a point. Айлин [she] cleared his throat and stepped back, catching a smirk as it flickered across Врит [he]’s features.

“You’re like ten years older than me. I’ll catch up.”

“

Ten?

I’m twenty-one. I’ve worked quite hard to reach Rank 3 by this age, not to mention my position as Second of the Ravager gang, so I’ll thank you not to—” Врит [he] caught herself as she caught a small grin cross Айлин [she]’s lips. She blinked and her eyes narrowed. “It seems your fear of me has evaporated.”

“You weren’t as scary as I thought you were. Don’t get me wrong, you’re still terrifying… but Паук [he] and his group are scarier.” He paused for a moment as the rest of Врит [he]’s sentence processed and he tilted his head to the side. “Wait. Second? You said you were streetlord.”

Врит [he] froze for an instant, but she recovered quickly. “I took over shortly before Ли [she]’s arrival.”

Alin tasted falsehood in the air. It was so faint that he barely even picked up on it. He took a step closer to Врит [he] and sampled the air again. There was no doubt about it. Врит [he] was lying.

“That… isn’t true,” Айлин [she] said slowly.

“Yes it is. I am the streetlord of the Ravager gang.”

“No, it isn’t.” The taste was stronger now. “You still think of yourself as the Second, don’t you? Why? If you’d actually killed Фрот [he], you’d definitely imagine yourself to be the streetlord. Does that mean someone else—”

Айлин [she] didn’t even see Врит [he] move. One moment, she was in front of him. The next, her hand was pressed against his mouth and her side pressed to his back.

“Not another word,” Врит [he] hissed — but it wasn’t a threat. It was a plea. “Please. You can’t. I don’t know how you know, but you can’t say anything. Ли [she] will kill both of us if you do.”

She pulled her hand away from his mouth and Айлин [she] twisted to keep eye contact with her. Pushing farther probably wasn’t the wisest move, but something tugged at his chest. A desire — a hunger — he couldn’t quite place, but it was insatiable.

“Tell me. I won’t tell anyone else,” Айлин [she] promised. “You have to follow my orders, don’t you?”

Врит [he]’s jaw clenched. She glanced around the room.

“Nobody is here. I’d taste them. Or hear them. One of the two. We’re alone.”

“Fine,” Врит [he] said, speaking in little more than a nervous whisper. “You’re right. Фрот [he] challenged Ли [she] when she showed up. Ли [she] killed him. She was meant to kill the whole camp because he refused Паук [he]’s offer, then put his head up on a stake to show what happens to those that disobey Паук [he].”

“Gods,” Айлин [she] said. His stomach twisted with something new. He couldn’t tell what it was, but it almost felt good. Satisfied. “What happened? How did you survive? A deal?”

“Because Ли [she] made a mistake. She accidentally shredded Фрот [he]’s head, so she couldn’t stake it anymore.” Врит [he] glanced around the room once more, then managed to lower her voice even further. “We agreed to pretend that I’d killed him instead of her. I then obviously accepted the offer. It was that or death. But if Паук [he] finds out…”

The knotting sensation in Айлин [she]’s stomach released, replaced by satisfaction. It almost felt like he’d just had a full meal. Врит [he]’s features twisted and she sent him a shocked look, taking a step back.

“Did you just steal my energy?”

“I — what? No. I was just curious. I didn’t steal anything.”

“Yes you did.” Врит [he] stared at Айлин [she], looking simultaneously offended and impressed as she let out a whistle. “Shit. You’re a knowledge demon.”

That feeling was me consuming Врит [he]’s energy?

Паук [he]’s forced advancement must have caused his Rune to advance to the point where he could start consuming energy naturally. He’d always been inquisitive, but he hadn’t imagined that he’d actually be able to consume knowledge.

I’m also pretty sure it’s a huge taboo to steal energy unless you’re strong enough to justify it.

Айлин [she]’s cheeks heated in embarrassment, but the more he thought about it, the more Врит [he]’s words made sense — and the more he wanted to consume more. He swallowed the feeling down and shook his head. “Uh… sorry. You might be right. It was my first time.”

“I’m delighted to hear I was your first,” Врит [he] said dryly. She blew out a breath and shrugged. “Well, given the circumstances, I suppose losing a little power isn’t too much to complain about. You really do need to work out how you’re going to put on a better front with any other Streetlords. I doubt Паук [he] is going to have all of them on as many strings as I am. They’re going to figure you out in seconds. I’ll go back to my camp and handle all the shit that you should—”

“No,” Айлин [she] said. Two simultaneous thoughts struck him. The first was annoyance that he wouldn’t learn whatever it was that Врит [he] was going to be doing. The second was an idea. “I’ve got a better way to do this.”

Врит [he] tilted her head to the side. “Oh?”

“Stay here. We’re in the same boat. We can help each other. Become my second.”

“You mean you want to snack on my knowledge.”

“Streetlords get to choose how resources get distributed, don’t they?” Айлин [she] asked. “I could make up for that.”

Врит [he] held his gaze for a second. Then she crossed her arms. “I’ve been a second for all my life. Who would choose to be a second over a streetlord? Even if it’s under you, I’d still have an entire gang.”

“What’s better? Being one streetlord out of dozens, or being the second of the demon in charge of all of them?”

She let out a burst of laughter. “You think Паук [he]’s going to put you in charge of every single gang? What happened to all that fear?”

“This is the fear talking,” Айлин [she] said. “Do you think I want this? I don’t — but look at the facts. Ли [she] sent you to me. Not to Паук [he]. What does that mean for the other streetlords? They definitely had spotters watching us.”

Врит [he] hesitated for a second. Then she paled. “Oh, shit. You might actually be right. But why would Паук [he] put someone like you in charge of so much?”

Because it’s so far beneath him I literally don’t think he cares. We’re just one moving piece in whatever plan he’s got going.

“I don’t know,” Айлин [she] said, and a hunger gnawed at his stomach. “And, as much as I’d love to find out, it changes nothing. Do you accept my offer or not?”

Врит [he]’s lips curled up and extended her hand. “You make a very convincing offer, streetlord. One I find myself unable to refuse. I just hope you’re better than my late brother.”

Brother? Фрот [he] was her brother? How is she even holding it together right now? I’d be breaking down if Вайолет [she] or one of the others had gotten murdered in front of me. Although it doesn’t sound like she was very close with him.

Now I want to know why… but this isn’t the time.

“My name is still Айлин [she], not streetlord. I don’t need an overinflated sense of ego,” Айлин [she] said as he clasped Врит [he]’s arm. “And I can’t make any promises, but I look forward to learning from you.”

Chapter 470: Deals

Ной [he] was glad he’d kept his face wrappings on. He’d been sitting around and fiddling with energy from Crumbling Space when the flap to his tent had flipped open. He and Мокси [she] both looked up to find Вайолет [she] standing on the other side, her face pale. Two smaller demons huddled behind her, one male and one female.

Вайолет [she]’s eyes widened and she froze in place like a deer in the headlights. “I — sorry! I didn’t realize this was your tent.”

“It’s fine,” Мокси [she] said. “It’s not like we’ve got it marked. Do you need something?”

The demon shook her head hurriedly. “No! No, I’m fine. Айлин [she] just told me to take Эдда [she] and Торик [he] to another tent so he could speak privately with Врит [he]. We’re completely fine. He has things handled.”

She didn’t sound completely convinced. The way she was rambling made it clear how worried she was for Айлин [she], but the news she brought made Ной [he] tilt his head to the side.

He sent them off to deal with her alone? He’s starting to get bold. I hope the runes aren’t changing him too much. I didn’t really give him much more in the way of Demon Runes, most of them were normal. I’ll have to keep an eye on the kid. As badly as I need to research how Demon Runes actually work, I don’t fancy making him my test subject.

“Well, you’ve found a tent.” Ной [he] nodded to the ground across from him. “Come in. It’s safe here, and I haven’t had much chance to speak with you properly.”

Мокси [she] sent him a warning look and she nudged him with her foot. He would have been mildly offended if he hadn’t already established a bit of a poor track record. That was just the way things had to be done in the Damned Plains, though.

Giving the kids something specific to fear was a great way to make sure they didn’t fear literally everything else. Until he knew them better, there wasn’t much else he could offer without piquing their suspicion.

Вайолет [she] hesitated for a second. Her eyes flicked from Ной [he] to Мокси [she], then to the smaller demons behind her. She brought her expression under control and stepped into the tent, holding the flap open for the others.

Ной [he] didn’t bother hiding his curiosity as the demons sat down across from him and Мокси [she]. He really didn’t have much frame of reference for how demons aged beyond Ли [she]. Айлин [she]’s group were all clearly young, but he and Вайолет [she] were the closest to normal humans amongst them.

Торик [he] was a little less than a head shorter than Вайолет [she] and had interlocking plates running just beneath his flesh. They didn’t look anywhere near strong enough to block much damage, but Ной [he] suspected they’d grow as he grew more powerful.

He was pretty sure Эдда [she] was the youngest of the group, both by her appearance and by the fact that she was the least scared of the lot. Her gaze swept over the room in search of something that Ной [he] and Мокси [she] didn’t seem to qualify for.

If anything, she reminded him of Ли [she]. Her horns were too large for her head — as were her eyes, which burned like two little embers.

Which is an interesting thought. I swear Ли [she] told me that her parents produced asexually and she was just a blob before she took on a human form relatively recently. I suppose that was her talking about Skinwalkers and not Demons — that or Азель [he] was into some really weird shit.

“Is there something we can do for you?” Вайолет [she] asked as she shifted, trying to make herself comfortable.

Мокси [she] lifted a hand and vines curled out of the ground, twisting beneath the demons to form into seats. The casual display of external magic caused their eyes to widen in shock. Ной [he] arched an eyebrow in Мокси [she]’s direction.

It doesn’t matter how soft the plants are when the only thing they’re going to be thinking about is if they’re going to be fertilizer. Actually, do they know what fertilizer is? I haven’t seen any farms in the Damned Plains.

“Not really,” Ной [he] admitted. “But we aren’t going to hurt any of you. I already had this discussion with Айлин [she], but it genuinely just isn’t worth the energy. Мокси [she] — that’s my companion, by the way — and I just have a set of standards. There are proper ways to treat people that we abide by whenever possible, and that includes making visitors comfortable.”

Вайолет [she] nodded stiffly. Торик [he] opened his mouth and she shot him a sharp look. His mouth snapped back shut. Эдда [she] remained silent as well. It wasn’t hard to tell who spoke for their group.


“You can speak freely. I really don’t have any need for terrified subordinates,” Ной [he] said. He braced his chin against a palm and studied the demons as they tried to figure out what they could say without offending him. The longer the silence dragged, the more uncomfortable they became.

“Why did you choose Айлин [she] for all of this?” Вайолет [she] finally asked out of desperation to break the oppressive quiet. “Is it really just because he was there?”

“Yes,” Ной [he] said. “Though he took to it well. A lot of demons wouldn’t have been able to do what I needed. A stronger one might have been too immalleable. He had a mixture of strong will and weak runes that suited my purposes.”

“Did you really just make him a Rank 3?” Торик [he] asked. Вайолет [she] winced, but Ной [he] just nodded.

“I did. It was simple enough. I needed someone loyal to me and strong enough to protect my investment.”

“Could you do it again?” Эдда [she] asked. “I wanna be strong too.”

Вайолет [she] clapped a hand down on Эдда [she]’s shoulder and sent the demon a sharp look. “I think it’s quite fine, Эдда [she]. We don’t need to trouble Паук [he] any further than we already have, and you don’t have any way to repay that kind of gift.”

It would be a good idea to get all of these kids relatively powerful to protect them… but I’m already experimenting on Айлин [she]. I can frame it however I want, but the truth of the matter is that I’m giving a demon more runes and rapidly accelerating their growth. That can do a lot of damage. Until I actually understand how much damage that can do, I can’t afford to just go around handing them out to random children.

Айлин [she] will just have to be supervised closely to make sure he doesn’t change too much, too fast. He won’t be hitting Rank 4 anytime too soon anyway. It should be fine.

“How old are you?” Ной [he] asked, cutting Вайолет [she] off before she could scold the others any longer.

“Me?” Эдда [she] asked. She blinked at him with her wide eyes. “Fourteen.”

I would have guessed around ten. That must be because of how little food they’ve managed to until recently.

“You’re a bit too small to handle more runes right now. You need more meat on your bones,” Ной [he] said with a shake of his head. “Having power also means needing the power to control it. You aren’t there yet.”

“Does that mean you would give it to us?” Торик [he] asked hesitantly. “If we got stronger, would you help us too?”

“If you wanted me to. You’re all close to Айлин [she]. That makes you targets for the other gangs.” Ной [he] didn’t bother mincing his words. These kids had grown up in the Damned Plains. They were no strangers to the way life worked. “The stronger you are, the more you can help you can be to both me and Айлин [she]. I just have no need to rush anything.”

“What about me?” Вайолет [she] asked, finally giving up on her own reluctance. “I’m no weaker than Айлин [she] was when you changed him.”

“I could do some for you. I don’t have the potion I’d like to use to do more,” Ной [he] said slowly. “But before I did something like that — why do you want me to help? You were reluctant to accept anything before.”

“Because I’m worried about Айлин [she]. He’s my brother,” Вайолет [she] said. She swallowed but held Ной [he]’s gaze. “And I can’t do anything for him the way I am now. When word spreads to the other gangs that Врит [he] joined us, they’re going to start testing us in true. There are going to be fights. People will try to assassinate him. The really dumb ones might go for you. And I’m sure you’ll be fine — but he might not be. He needs help.”

The more she spoke, the more determined Вайолет [she]’s words grew. Her worry and concern for Айлин [she] were stronger than her fear of Ной [he].

I can’t tell if I should be impressed at the level of passion someone this young can have to protect their friend or be depressed that they’ve gone through so much shit that they feel the presence of death lurking so intently.

She kind of reminds me of Изабель [she] and Тодд [he]. Just… more intense.

Ной [he] rose to his feet and Мокси [she] sent him a surprised look. She knew just as well as he did the drawbacks of a demon advancing through the ranks.

“You’re going to do it?”

“Something tells me she’ll get herself hurt trying something else if I don’t,” Ной [he] said dryly before looking back to Вайолет [she]. “I take it you know the city to some degree?”

“Some of it,” Вайолет [she] said hesitantly, some of her confidence evaporating when she realized Паук [he] might be about to grant her request. Asking for power was one thing, but actually getting it was a bit more real.

“Your guess was absolutely right about other gangs coming for Айлин [she]. I imagine it won’t be long at all. A few hours. Maybe days for the more patient ones. He could have one extra card in his back pocket — especially if he doesn’t even know he has it. I can make you into that card, Вайолет [she]. I’m not promising it’ll be safe, but I can do it.”

Вайолет [she] hesitated for a second. Then she swallowed. “Nothing in the Damned Plains is safe. I’ll do it. What do I have to do in return?”

“Not much at all,” Ной [he] replied with a smile that she couldn’t make out behind his face wrappings. Вайолет [she] would do absolutely everything he needed her to do entirely out of her own volition. She wanted the same thing he did, after all — she’d just never believe him if he told her that. “All you’ll have to do is show me to an apothecary.”

“And you’ll make me a Rank 3 in return?”

“Yes. That’s it.”

Вайолет [she]’s jaw set. “I don’t think I — or anyone else — could ever refuse one of your deals, Паук [he]. That scares me. A lot. Needless to say, I accept.”

“Then you’d best start marching,” Ной [he] said, nodding to the exit of the tent. “Мокси [she] will watch over your siblings. We have an apothecary to find.”

Chapter 471: An Old Man

While Ной [he] traipsed through the Damned Plains, Тодд [he] was doing his absolute best to kill an old man.

His foot slammed into the ground and he twisted his body, detonating the air behind his right heel and sending it hurtling in a spinning kick toward Джален [he]’s head. The old mage cackled as he leaned back and brought his own leg up into Тодд [he]’s chest.

Stone armor cracked and Тодд [he] stumbled back. He thrust a hand behind himself and stone cracked, flame curling free of his palm as he threw himself back into Джален [he] shoulder-first. The air around Джален [he] rippled and he vanished, reforming five feet to his side.

As soon as he reformed, a loud crack split the air. A streak of ice carved across the sky in a flash. Джален [he]’s hand shot up to grab a transparent blue arrow an inch away from his face. His lips parted in a grin as he spun, gathering momentum before hurtling the arrow back in the direction it had come.

A flash of panic shot through Тодд [he] and he spun to watch the arrow. He needn’t have worried. Александра [she] was already in front of Эмили [she], her sword whistling as she cut the magic from the air before it could reach its target.

A hand fell on Тодд [he]’s shoulder. “Don’t get distracted, kid. You’re—”

The ground beneath them cracked as Изабель [she] erupted from beneath it, driving a glowing blue spear straight for Джален [he]’s chest. He flickered and vanished an instant before the blow could connect.

Джален [he] reformed behind them, purple energy gathering around his hands. He reached for their backs — and another icy arrow screamed through the air, this time from the exact opposite direction.

His eyes widened slightly in surprise and he spun, grabbing the arrow. At the same time, Изабель [she] rose fully from the dirt and it swirled up to form heavy armor around her. She and Тодд [he] both lunged for Джален [he]’s back.

A wave of purple magic swirled out from his palms. Тодд [he]’s stomach clenched and the world lurched abruptly around him. His foot hit the ground a dozen feet away from where it should have and he stumbled as a wave of dizziness washed over him.

Изабель [she] thumped down beside him. Джален [he] turned to look at them, Эмили [she]’s second arrow held aloft. He let his hand fall and the icy magic dissipated.

“Damn it,” Тодд [he] said with a groan. “I could have sworn we had you. Teleporting us away is a cheap trick.”

Эмили [she] let her weapon lower and Александра [she] sheathed her sword. The two of them headed across the grass to join the others.

“There is no such thing as a cheap trick in a battle,” Джален [he] said once they’d all regrouped. “And besides, cheating makes things more fun.”

“Wait, wouldn’t the second thing negate the first one?” Изабель [she] asked with a frown.

“Of course not.” Джален [he] shook his head in disappointment. “Cheap tricks sound so debasing. Like I need to rely on some form of crutch to handle a battle. Cheating is far different. It’s a battle of wits. A truly interesting battle is one where everyone cheats.”

Тодд [he] rubbed at the side of his neck. It was a habit he hadn’t quite managed to shrug off yet. He was tempted to ask Джален [he] what the point of even adding rules to a fight was if they were just going to cheat, but he’d gotten to know the odd Rank 6 well enough to realize that the question would be completely pointless.

“Don’t you feel a bit bad about having to cheat against Rank 2s?” Александра [she] asked.

“There is no ‘have to’ about it,” Джален [he] said with a snort. “I cheat because it amuses me. You should try it more often. Maybe you’d win more if you did — though I see my lessons haven’t been completely wasted on you. Do you plan on remaining invisible forever, Джеймс [he]?”

The air to Тодд [he]’s right shimmered and Джеймс [he] appeared mid-yawn. Эмили [she] faded away, and another version of her appeared near the edge of the group. Her lips pursed in annoyance and she jogged over to join them.

“I can’t believe I didn’t even manage to hit you,” Эмили [she] muttered. “It was such a good idea.”

“It was,” Джален [he] said with an approving nod. “Having the light mage form a fake version of you beside Александра [she] while you ran to position… very clever. It actually caught me off guard. You also said that Джеймс [he] wouldn’t be participating in this fight. That counts as cheating. I’m proud of you.”

“Technically, we just said the only people fighting you would be the ones here,” Тодд [he] corrected, a small grin tugging at his lips. “Джеймс [he] just happened to be invisible at the time. Invisible and at the top of the hill. My definition of here was a bit stretched.”

Джален [he] cackled in approval. “Very good. You kept him out of the range of my domain to make sure I didn’t pick up on his presence by accident. But Джеймс [he]… how is it that you managed to have your magic running in two entirely different locations at once? You aren’t nearly strong enough to pull something like that off. The range alone should be impossible for a Rank 3, much less a Rank 2.”

Эмили [she] worked a thin metal bracelet off her wrist. Twisting black lines ran across it, rippling with faint energy. “Тодд [he] imbued this with Джеймс [he]’ light magic. It drains a lot of his power, but it let me use him like a battery to temporarily turn invisible.”

Тодд [he] took the bracelet from her, a frown pulling across his lips as he studied the наполнение [he]s. They were badly strained. Maintaining a connection between the original owner of the runes and the bracelet’s wielder had proven to be too optimistic for such a rudimentary item.

It did let me get much more power out of it than if I’d closed the circuit and separated it from Джеймс [he]. Definitely has potential to continue working on. This bracelet is fried, though.

“I love being a battery,” Джеймс [he] said without a single trace of sarcasm. “It lets me feel like I’m being useful because I’m completely out of energy at the end of the fight and I’ve barely even had to do anything.”

That’s hardly true. The bracelet relied heavily on Джеймс [he] actually funneling it power. Эмили [she] just activated it. That was the only way I could get it to do the complexity of proper invisibility. Джеймс [he] should have been under really significant mental strain.


Тодд [he] jumped as he felt someone poke him in the side. He glanced over at Изабель [she] and blinked. “Sorry, did you say something? I was zoned out.”

“I know.” Изабель [she] rolled her eyes and snaked her arm through his. “You had the look on your face. Stop working on наполнение [he]s for long enough to get the rest of the feedback, would you?”

“Oh, that was it,” Джален [he] said with a wave of his hand. “What do you think I am? A teacher? I’m just bored. Figure the other problems out yourselves. You clearly aren’t doing something right because you didn’t manage to beat me.”

“Yeah. We aren’t cheating enough,” Джеймс [he] grumbled.

“Very good. You should cheat more next time.” Джален [he] nodded sagely. “Until then, I don’t suppose any of you want to play darts? I’m still trying to track down the rest of the sorry bastards I’m going to put to work. I reckon I’ll have them by tomorrow.”

“They’ve managed to avoid you?” Тодд [he] blinked in surprise. That was odd, to say the least. Джален [he] didn’t seem to be the type of person that anyone could hid from. Not for long. What kind of people was he —

“Actually, I just haven’t had the motivation to find them yet. It sounded really boring so I just haven’t gone looking.”

Ah. Of course.

“Вермил [he] and Мокси [she] would have found them already,” Эмили [she] muttered.

“You don’t even know who I’m getting or why I need them,” Джален [he] protested. “Don’t compare me to them. The only thing Вермил [he] was good at was darts, and that’s because he cheated.”

“How do you cheat at darts?” Изабель [she] asked.

“I’m not sure, but I’ll figure out how he did it at some point when we play again.”

Тодд [he] tilted his head slightly to the side. Джален [he] had outwardly said he thought Вермил [he] would be able to escape the Damned Plains, but there was a difference between what people said and what they meant.

Джален [he] has complete confidence that Вермил [he] will get out. I mean, I do too… but how much does he know?

“If class is done for today, I’m going to go sleep,” Джеймс [he] said. “There’s an продвинутая группа meeting tonight that I want to get ready for.”

“I should prepare as well. The наполнение [he]s on Эмили [she]’s bracelet are all screwed now, but I should be able to get them patched up before tonight,” Тодд [he] said. “Thanks for the training, Джален [he].”

“I was just killing some time,” Джален [he] said with a shrug. “I hope you’ll all endeavor to make tomorrow more interesting. It’s not a real fight unless I’ve lost a few limbs.”

I don’t think we’re going to be in a position where we’re cutting off a Rank 6 mage’s limbs anytime soon.

“I will strive to meet your expectations,” Александра [she] said without a hint of sarcasm. She drummed her fingers on the hilt of her sword, and a flicker of embarrassment passed through Тодд [he].

She’d asked him to imbue a new weapon for her after Юлина [she] had cut through her old blade. He hadn’t quite managed to get everything right on it yet, but he was close. There were just so many different things competing for his attention.

I’ll get the sword before the meeting tonight. It’s probably a bit more important than fixing the bracelet.

“Good. I hate being disappointed,” Джален [he] said. “Good luck with your meeting tonight. I might show up, but only if it looks like I can break something.”

With that, he snapped his fingers and vanished, leaving the students to their planning for that night.
