Chapter 476: Nightfall

Айлин [she] waited until the sound of Рекеба [she]’s panicked footsteps faded down the street before turning and walking back to his tent. Врит [he] followed at his side. Neither of them said anything. There were scouts from other gangs watching from the rooftops, and any conversation would have done nothing but give away information.

Shoe scuffed on stone as they departed as quietly as they could — but not nearly quietly enough to escape Айлин [she]’s ears. They all had to hurry back to their gangs and report on what had happened.

Something told Айлин [she] he probably wasn’t going to get challenged again. Not in the same way, at least. He highly doubted the other streetlords would be willing to let a single victory give him and Паук [he] rule over them. That would be a problem for later. For today, his work was done.

He woodenly pushed the tent flap out of the way and held it open for Врит [he]. Once she’d entered, he trudged over to the center of the empty tent. It struck him that they’d forgotten the chair outside, but he couldn’t be bothered to get it.

Айлин [she] flopped down onto his back and stared up at the ceiling of the tent. Врит [he] squatted beside him. “Ready?”

“Yeah.”

Врит [he] placed her hands on the sides of his neck, just above his collarbone. A tremor ran down his body as Врит [he] released him from the connection they’d formed just before heading out to meet Рекеба [she]. The breath caught in Айлин [she]’s chest and his heart bucked in his chest.

He ground his teeth as fear slammed into him in a wave. Айлин [she] jerked upright, nearly slamming his forehead into Врит [he]’s nose, but she yanked back just in time. A chill raced down his back and the beds of his fingers prickled as his heart thumped furiously.

Айлин [she] inhaled deeply through his nose, pressing his palms to his lap as blood coursed through his ears. The sensation was sudden and violent, but it passed in just seconds. He blew his caught breath out with his mouth and shook his head.

“That was more intense than I was expecting.”

“Do you have any idea how difficult it is to consume on the emotions of another demon, much less one of your own rank?” Врит [he] asked irritably. “I ate all the fear I could from you. I wouldn’t have been able to take much more than the dredges if we hadn’t had such a strong connection. If I could have eaten more, I would.”

“I’m not complaining,” Айлин [she] said, raising his hands with a small laugh. “It worked. It’s a bit odd not knowing how scared I was when I was facing her, though. Was there a lot of fear?”

Врит [he] shook her head. “Surprisingly, no. I was expecting you to wet your pants, but the amount of fear was barely enough to give me a good meal — especially as time went on. The only reason it hit you so hard at the end was because a connection like that leaves some pent-up emotion rolling around when it snaps. You basically got a few minutes of concentrated fear in a second or two.”

“Weird,” Айлин [she] said with a grimace. “And you like that?”

“I don’t like being scared. I like when people are scared of me. You have to know what I’m talking about. The only emotion of yours I was eating was fear. Didn’t you feel a thrill when Рекеба [she] looked at you in the end?” Врит [he] shuddered and a grin snaked crossed her lips. “Gods, what I would have done to have that directed at me instead. I hate her. Her fear would be the most delicious thing I’ve ever tasted, I just know it.”

She’s really into this. In a way, it’s a little endearing, but I can’t help but feel a splash creeped out. I’m glad I didn’t get her emotion. Still, if we’re going to be working together a lot in the future, it’s good to know more about Врит [he].

His mind subconsciously brushed across hers at the new understanding. Energy trickled into Айлин [she]. Врит [he] flinched. She glared at him and his cheeks heated. “Sorry. You got so into it that I couldn’t help it.”

“Stop taking bites out of me, you little shit,” Врит [he] said. She crossed her arms. “And especially by accident. I could almost tolerate it if you were just flaunting your power, but do you have any idea how embarrassing it is when someone accidentally steals your hard-earned power? It’s like you’re cheating.”

“I’ll do my best to stop,” Айлин [she] promised. He hesitated for a second before giving her a sheepish grin. “But I like learning about you.”

“Egh. Look at you. Just one meeting with Рекеба [she] and you’ve turned into a flirt. I’d probably take that as more of a compliment if learning about me didn’t involve sucking down my hard-earned energy. Keep your grubby mitts off unless you’ve got a whole lot of extra food to pay me off with.”

“I mean… I do. I probably shouldn’t, though. I don’t want to get too greedy. A lot of people need that food to survive. I can’t just use all of it for myself.”

Врит [he] squinted at him. “You realize it isn’t your responsibility to distribute all that food, right? As long as there’s enough for the people in your gang, your job is done. All the other gangs we’re bringing in will have enough food of their own.”

“That’s true, but what about the people living on the streets near us that aren’t part of the gang?” Айлин [she] asked. “There are a lot of them and even a single small meal is enough to make a huge difference.”


“You are an awful streetlord. Your job is to amass power, not give it away.”

Айлин [she]’s thoughts drifted to Паук [he]. The powerful demon hadn’t even so much as blinked at the thought of giving food away. Паук [he] hadn’t bothered hoarding anything. It was beneath him. Real power wasn’t found in hoarding supplies.

“I think that’s the wrong kind of power,” Айлин [she] said. “And I don’t think Паук [he] wants me to be just some normal streetlord. We’re bringing a lot of attention to ourselves. I don’t know if anyone has tried to bring together all the streetlords before, but it won’t be long before stronger demons start to take notice. We can’t be content with the power of a normal streetlord when that happens. It won’t be enough. We need more, and that means changing how things work.”

Врит [he] sent him a surprised look but didn’t speak immediately as she mulled over his words. Then, slowly, she nodded. “That’s a take I didn’t expect to hear from someone that only became a streetlord a day ago.”

“Different perspectives,” Айлин [she] said with a chagrined grin and a shrug. “And it helps that doing things differently means there’s so much more to learn. I don’t want to get stuck as what I am now forever.”

“Unsatisifed already?” Врит [he] arched an eyebrow. “Do you even realize how many demons would give up everything they had and then more just to get a fraction of what you’ve been gifted?”

“That’s the problem,” Айлин [she] said. “I’m thankful to Паук [he] for everything he’s done… but he’s given me more than just power. He gave me potential. I can be so much more than I am now. There’s so much in this world to learn about. I refuse to just sit around and be content with what I have when I could become more. Anything other than my full efforts at improving would just be a waste of the gift I got.”

“I can’t argue with that. You’ve got the mindset of a powerful demon. I see why Паук [he] chose you… but it’s odd,” Врит [he] said with a small frown. “I expected to taste a lot more fear from you when you speak of him than I actually can. You were more scared of Рекеба [she] than Паук [he]. Why?”

“Паук [he] is so powerful that being scared of him is almost pointless.” Айлин [she] shrugged. “He does what he wants and he’s made it clear that he’s fair. Паук [he] hasn’t treated me wrong a single time. He’s only given to me. There might be a day when all that gets cashed in and I die, but I can’t do anything about it. All I can do is focus on what I can control. I’ll learn everything I can and make the best life possible for myself and my siblings.”

“Blegh. You’re so… sappy.” Врит [he] scrunched her nose in distaste. “It makes me feel a little sick.”

“Too sick to eat? I did just take more of your energy, so I think I owe you something, but I could always hold off. I guess you did just eat some energy from my fear, so maybe you don’t need anything else right now.”

Врит [he] sucked on her lower lip, then cleared her throat. “No, no. It was a passing spell. I don’t feel sick anymore. I’m not wasting any energy you promised me. Hand it over.”

***

Талил [he] stood in a sea of shadows. Shapes twisted at the edge of his vision, begging for his attention, but he didn’t dare let his gaze stray. He’d seen what had happened to the demons that had let their concentration falter, how their eyes had turned a dull blue, how they’d never been quite the same afterward.

The shadows held death, but the solitary beam of moonlight in the center of the room didn’t promise much better. A lone demon sat in the light with his knees pulled up to her chest. She barely sat taller than Талил [he]’s waist and had flowing, silver hair that pooled beneath her like a glistening lake.

While she was no taller than a child, there was no mistaking the demon for one. Her features were hauntingly striking in the way of a corpse prepared for a funeral. A cold air sat about her with such intensity that Талил [he] struggled to properly draw breath.

He kept his eyes firmly fixed on the demon’s forehead. It was the closest he could get to respectfully meeting her gaze without letting himself peer directly into her flat, empty eyes. She chewed on the end of a thumb and watched Талил [he] approach without a word.

“Mistress Йоку [she],” Талил [he] said. “Do I have permission to speak?”

Her head inclined so slightly that he nearly missed it. Талил [he] swallowed, then continued.

“The rumors of a demon attempting to wrest control of all the streetlords in the city are correct. I haven’t verified the information personally, but there are too many accounts of it to ignore any longer. The streets are more alive than they have been in years. There is a growing belief that he may succeed. A belief that I can assure you is false. No such thing will—”

“Паук [he],” Йоку [she] said, the words slipping from her lips like a single drop of summer rain. “The Silent Silvertooth will fall to him. Many other gangs will follow should nothing be done.”

Талил [he] stiffened. “Then, should you will it, I will act. Simply give me the command and I will deal with Паук [he] myself.”

“The balance of power in Трэдон [he] is already unstable,” Йоку [she] murmured. “Such a shift will destabilize it even further.”

“Forgive my impudence, but how could Паук [he] succeed?” Талил [he] asked, choosing his words carefully. “Taking over a few gangs is possible, but all of them? Белкус [he] would not allow such a thing to happen. As unimportant as they are, he has measures in place to make sure he maintains control of every part of the city.”

“Which is why losing the underground will smart. The lowest creatures in Трэдон [he] remain part of its populace despite their weakness,” Йоку [she] said. She took her thumb out of her mouth and tilted her head to the side. A flicker of darkness passed behind her monochrome eyes. “If Белкус [he] loses the underground, he will be weakened.”

“What of his enforcers watching the situation? They will doubtlessly act when they realize that Паук [he] is succeeding in his goals. He will die before he gets a chance to do anything, and he may destabilize our own plans in the process.”

“Nothing is set in stone.”

“Then what are your orders, Mistress? What should I do?”

“Nothing. Белкус [he]’ time sets like the sun below the horizon. His end is inevitable, but he will not go gently. I will watch, as I have always have. And he will kill, just as he always has. Let Паук [he] do as he wills. We will witness his true measure soon enough. You will be my firsthand witness.”

Талил [he] swallowed. “Белкус [he] will act, then?”

“It is a matter of time. He will send enforcers, but I do not believe they will be enough. The future is mutable, but after Белкус [he] suffers his first defeat, he will find that everywhere he turns only holds more. It does not matter how he suffers it. Be it Паук [he]’s hand or mine, the day is starting to dim.” Йоку [she] lifted her gaze to the light bearing down upon her and raised a hand toward the ceiling. Streamers of pale energy twisted around her fingers like coiling snakes. “The moon rises over Трэдон [he], and it cannot coexist with the sun. Nightfall is near.”
==========
Chapter 477: Choice

Вайолет [she]’s eyes fluttered open. The world buzzed and twisted around her, dancing to a tune that only it could hear. Her lips felt gummy and her head throbbed. Паук [he], on the other hand, didn’t even seem slightly bothered.

Вайолет [she] swallowed. That was the only action she could manage to muster. Pain and new strength swirled into a churning mix in her soul. She’d managed to keep her misgivings wrapped when Паук [he] had bought the Mind Meld potion.

If that had been the price for power, she’d been more than willing to pay it — but it quickly became abundantly clear that Паук [he] didn’t have any plans of using the potion for its intended purpose.

He’d asked her a few dozen questions about her goals and what she wanted to accomplish. Вайолет [she] could barely even remember what her answers had been. All she’d wanted was to be strong. To be able to protect Айлин [she] and Эдда [she] and Rorick. Nothing else mattered.

Whatever Паук [he] had wanted in return, she’d been prepared to give it. The demon had handed her Rune after Rune, ordering her to draw them into her soul.

Shame wrapped around Вайолет [she] like a metal cloak at the memory. As it turned out, having absolutely no experience drawing in Runes had made her horrid at it. Even though the power had been right in front of her, it had taken minutes to draw in every single one.

The impatience in Паук [he]’s posture made it apparent that Айлин [she] had taken to drawing in the new runes considerably faster than she had. Everything Вайолет [she] had wanted had been right in front of her, and she couldn’t grasp it.

By the end of the thirty-minute window Паук [he] had warned her of, Вайолет [she] managed to bring in Six new Runes and draw in energy from a rune the stronger demon shattered to fill her current Demon Rune.

Then it had come time to combine them. Even now, Вайолет [she]’s stomach twisted. Паук [he] had handed her everything — and she’d failed.

Even with Паук [he]’s instructions, the combination had been horrible. She’d known it from first glance. The rune had been nearly sixty-five percent full. A complete failure. Then the potion’s effects had ended and Вайолет [she] found herself sitting back on the ground of the tent.

It had been humiliating.

But, as her stomach twisted itself into knots so tight that they could have cut through metal, her defeated gaze had been met only by Паук [he]’s hand holding a second potion.

A second chance. One that put her so impossibly deep into debt that she couldn’t even begin to comprehend the extent of it. Вайолет [she] had taken it without hesitation. Shame did nothing. Even if she had a crippled rune, she couldn’t afford to do anything but take every advantage that Паук [he] was willing to offer her.

She had no clue why he was willing to spend so much effort on a demon with no potential and no skill, but she didn’t care. Anything Паук [he] wanted from her would be his if he could let her keep up with Айлин [she].

But when they had returned to her mind, Паук [he] didn’t procure new runes. Instead, he simply ordered her to close her eyes and brace herself. Вайолет [she] almost let out a scornful laugh at the memory.

She’d been so confident she was prepared for anything Паук [he] would demand.

She’d been wrong.

Her memories of what happened next were a haze. There was a wall of pain, so immense that it threatened to swallow her completely. She’d screamed until her throat went raw, but not once did she open her eyes.

And then there was nothing. The pain had faded as if it had never been there. Паук [he] gave her the order to open her eyes once more, and Вайолет [she] had found herself in her soul, surrounded by the runes she’d failed to combine.

It was in that moment that Вайолет [she] realized the difference between herself and Паук [he]. He had undone her mistake as if it had never happened. She was a demon — but he was a god. That was the only explanation for it that her mind could manifest.

Вайолет [she] didn’t mess up the second time around. She combined the runes into a Rank 2, and Паук [he]’s only response was to manifest a new Rank 2 in her soul. And thus, they had continued. She was still far from fast at her work, and it took the entire thirty minutes to gather the rest of the Rank 2 runes in her soul. This time it didn’t faze her.

Паук [he] didn’t care about how long it took her. Тим [he]e was meaningless to a god. And, for some reason, that was a comfort. Вайолет [she] focused, pushing away the fear and worry to completely train her mind on what mattered.


Success. She was aided by a god. Nothing else was possible.

Her newfound confidence was proven right. When she combined her runes for the second time under Паук [he]’s guidance, she made no more mistakes. The potion had worn off just moments later.

“Well?” Паук [he] asked, his words shattering Вайолет [she]’s thoughts like a fist through glass.

She looked down at her hands, flexing her fingers and swallowing heavily. Her body, similar to Айлин [she]’s, hadn’t had any significant changes from the advancement to Rank 3.

That wasn’t to say she hadn’t changed at all. Muscle had filled in her thin form and, as Вайолет [she] ran a hand a long her face, she found that her features had sharpened. Her body felt steady. Firm. Like the earth itself had risen up to fill her from within.

She felt unstoppable — and she knew that couldn’t have been farther from the truth. Вайолет [she] stared up into Паук [he]’s cloaked face.

Why is someone like this here? A god made flesh… just gifting power to street urchins? Is this just a game to him? Or is there something more that we don’t understand?

“I — I’m fine. I feel strong,” Вайолет [she] said, not wanting to keep Паук [he] waiting any longer.

“That would be all the Earth Runes,” Паук [he] mused. “What about range of mobility? Stiff? Are your thoughts sluggish?”

Вайолет [she] blinked. She lifted a hand and waved it around, then shook her head. “No. I don’t think so. I don’t know if I’d say I feel any faster, but I don’t feel dumber or slower.”

“I see. So the change is more related to your demon rune than the normal ones,” Паук [he] mused under his breath. He looked to her again. “And what of your emotion? Do you know what you feed on? It’s fast, but—”

Вайолет [she] knew. Before Паук [he] had even finished, her heart had already set itself on the one thing in life that mattered to her. “I want to protect my family.”

That gave Паук [he] pause. He tilted his head to the side in apparent curiosity. “That’s an interesting emotion for a demon. Kinder than I would have expected. It isn’t really an emotion either. Explain.”

What kind of question is that? Is he trying to see how much I understand of myself? Actually, it doesn’t matter. Anything he wants from me is his if it lets me become strong.

“It’s not just emotion. It’s feeling. The feeling of protecting what belongs to me,” Вайолет [she] replied. “I’m not strong or lucky enough to eat pure emotion. Most of us have something more specific. A feeling that’s usually made up of a bunch of smaller emotions in combination.”

“But your feeling is protecting others. Do you consume your own energy?”

I don’t know if I can explain something that just feels completely instinctive… that must be why he’s asking. To make me look deeper.

Вайолет [she]’s brow furrowed as she thought and searched for words. “It’s not the feeling I get. I want to feel their appreciation. Their understanding that I’m protecting them,” Вайолет [she] said. “And it’s not just others. It’s my family. I want to protect the ones that belong to me.”

Паук [he]’s head inclined. “I see. A powerful desire. A dangerous one, if you let it get away from you. Does any living being truly belong to another?”

“I… don’t know,” Вайолет [she] admitted with a frown. Her emotion pressed against her logic as she struggled to find a way to balance them. “I don’t know how to say it. I want them to be mine. My siblings. They don’t belong to me, but they’re mine.”

“Interesting. Not too dissimilar from Ли [she], but… no. Never mind. I won’t tell you how your emotions work, but I encourage seeing how far you can push them. How strong you can become, not just in the ways you know, but in the ones you don’t,” Паук [he] said. “I’ll be watching with interest. You have potential.”

Me? I failed to combine my runes. How do I have any potential? Is Паук [he] just trying to be nice? But… why even bother? I don’t understand him at all.

They were silent for a few seconds. Then Паук [he] blew out a small breath. He put a hand on Вайолет [she]’s shoulder.

“Keep that family of yours safe. I haven’t given Айлин [she] an easy task. He’s got a lot on his shoulders. He needs all the help he can get — and remember that you’re part of your family as well. I know the look in your eyes. You can only protect them as long as you protect yourself. I know you and Айлин [she] are wondering why I’d do something like this. You’re probably trying to figure out what would cause me to choose you.”

Вайолет [she] nodded mutely.

“The answer is simple. You were there,” Паук [he] said. “Айлин [she] had the curiosity and need to seek me out. I didn’t come with ulterior motives beyond the ones you have already seen. I need someone to fill Голон [he]’s spot, and I need someone to control the gangs I bring in under my control. I will give you and Айлин [she] everything I can to accomplish that. Your only job is to keep yourself and Айлин [she] alive until then. And, when you do, you’ll have a choice.”

“A choice?” Вайолет [she]’s brow furrowed. “About what?”

“You’ll figure it out when the time comes,” Паук [he] replied with a chuckle. “Until then, just focus on the present. You’re stronger now, but we’ll be up against more powerful enemies soon enough. These next few days are just training. Bring the gangs under Айлин [she]’s control. Learn how to use your abilities and protect him — and prepare for what comes next.”

Вайолет [she]’s jaw set. Паук [he] hadn’t had to say anything. His orders were the exact ones she’d already resolved herself to. It was strange. Despite the inconceivable gap between them, for some inexplicable reason, Вайолет [she] felt safe with Паук [he].

It almost felt like he cared.

“I will,” Вайолет [she] promised.

“Good,” Паук [he] said with a smile. He held out a hand and helped Вайолет [she] to her feet. Then he nodded to the tent flap. “Now, shall we go check on Айлин [she]? I believe his fight is over, and I’m not above looking forward to watching his reaction when he sees you.”

Chapter 478: Хранитель [she]

“Someone’s heading in this direction, but we’ve got a little before they arrive,” Айлин [she] said, his ears twitching as he picked up on noise outside the tent. He licked his lips as he tried to place the taste, but there were just too many in the camp to make out any details now that everyone had come back out of their tents.

He and Врит [he] rose from where they sat and Айлин [she] brushed the dust off the backside of his pants. Looking like a bumpkin when some new arrogant demon showed up was not high on his list of things to accomplish.

“You still owe me more food. Don’t think an interruption is going to get you out of the rest of it,” Врит [he] said. She paused for a second. “Given in the way we agreed on, mind you.”

Айлин [she] suppressed a laugh. “I know. You can have the rest of it once I make sure everyone that wants food can get it. I still need to give the other street kids time to hear the word. I doubt the demons I sent out to announce that people can have some food have gotten to everyone yet.”

“Do you really think they’re all going to take you up on it?”

“No. Just the truly desperate ones. It’s fine. It’s not about if they take me up or not. It’s about keeping my promise.”

“Some streetlord you are.”

“Are you really strong if you have to lie to protect what’s yours?” Айлин [she] asked. “Act like what you want to be, not what you are. That’s how you achieve your goals.”

Врит [he] pursed her lips and crossed her arms in front of her chest. “Don’t start spouting off fancy quotes to me. I was around literally less than a day ago when you were shaking so much that you probably raised the temperature of the air around you by a bit.”

“It did sound kind of knowledgeable and wise though, didn’t it?”

“Anything sounds knowledgeable and wise if you’re cryptic enough. The words you speak manifest the reality you experience. See? I can do it too.”

“That’s a pretty good line, actually.” Айлин [she] scratched his chin. “I’m taking it.”

Врит [he] let out a long-suffering sigh. “All yours, boss.”

Айлин [she]’s ears twitched again. He nudged her shoulder and nodded to the entrance of the tent as his features turned serious. “They’re here.”

Врит [he] adjusted her stance and stepped back to let the shadows at the corner of the tent wash over her. She didn’t quite completely disappear, but even though Айлин [she] knew where she was, he could barely see her.

Айлин [she] tasted the air again. There were two demons headed toward the tent. He recognized one of them instantly. Goosebumps raced across his skin as his chest tightened.

Паук [he].

The demon was likely coming to check on how his investment had gone. Айлин [she] quickly ran through everything he’d done. He was pretty sure he’d handled things exactly how Паук [he] would have wanted him to.

That didn’t stop the fear from setting in. There were some things in life that were wise to fear. Fear didn’t exist for no reason. It was the most primal of warning systems. It kept people alive.

But the fear Айлин [she] felt was tinged with something else — curiosity, and not just toward Паук [he]. The other demon with him felt strange. Familiar, but at the same time, different. It was a mixture of flavors that he didn’t have nearly enough experience to place before the tent flap was pushed aside.

Паук [he] stepped inside and held the flap open for a female demon following after him. She was on the shorter side, with beautiful ivory horns that curled up around her head to end in razor-sharp points. Lean muscle covered her body and she seemed to walk in the same manner as a rock sliding down the side of a mountain.

There was a moment of silence as the two groups stared at each other. Something tickled the back of Айлин [she]’s head. The taste of familiarity grew stronger. His eyes widened as he finally realized who the second demon was.

“Вайолет [she]?” Айлин [she] exclaimed in disbelief. If he’d been sitting in a chair, he would have leapt straight out of it. His eyes shot over to Паук [he] and he hurriedly gathered himself before he could cause any offense. Greeting her before the unbelievably powerful demon was definitely disrespectful. “Forgive me. I was surprised. Master Паук [he]. I hope you have approved of the work I’ve done in your name.”

Паук [he] let out a laugh and waved his hand. “I’m pretty sure I’ve already mentioned I don’t care about honorifics or any of that shit. As long as you listen to my orders, I don’t care if you say my name first or second. And I’m just a fly on the wall. Ignore me. You’ve done a great job, but I’m only here to escort Вайолет [she].”

Айлин [she] found it doubtful that Вайолет [she] had done anything to earn an escort from Паук [he] himself, but he wasn’t about to question the other demon. He stared at Вайолет [she], taking in every detail as his mind fought to overlay her new form with the one in his mind.

Her facial features were all similar. Her horns had definitely gotten nicer, but the more Айлин [she] looked at her, the more he realized that Вайолет [she] hadn’t truly changed. She’d just become the demon she was always meant to be.

“What happened?” Айлин [she] asked. “You look so… well, you. It’s like someone added you to yourself.”

“Eloquent,” Вайолет [she] said with a huge grin. She strode up to stand before him and grabbed him by his sides. Айлин [she] let out a yelp as Вайолет [she] effortlessly lifted him into the air and spun him in a circle before setting him down again. “And I’ll give you three guesses as to what happened.”

“Паук [he]?”

“Maybe I should have given you less guesses.”


“It’s kind of a freebie,” Айлин [she] agreed. He glanced over to Паук [he] before returning his gaze to Вайолет [she]. A flicker of trepidation twisted through his stomach. “What did you have to pay for this? You’re okay, right?”

“I’m fine,” Вайолет [she] said, clasping Айлин [she]’s shoulders and giving him a reassuring smile. “We’re all wrapped up in this anyway. Паук [he] just gave me the power to defend us. Your job is definitely a lot harder than mine.”

“If you think keeping this little crazed thing alive is easy, then you’ve got another thing coming,” Врит [he] said, but the sarcasm in her voice was overshadowed by shock. “Are you really the girl that was here earlier?”

“I’m her and more, courtesy of Паук [he],” Вайолет [she] replied. Her eyes narrowed and she set her jaw. “Why are you still hanging around? Don’t you have a gang to be managing?”

“I do not. Айлин [she] invited me to be his second and I accepted. A new second will have to be chosen for the Ravagers.”

“What?” Вайолет [she] exclaimed. She spun back to look at Айлин [she]. “You chose her? Why?”

“Why wouldn’t I?” Айлин [she] asked. “She’s been really helpful. If it wasn’t for Врит [he], Рекеба [she] would have completely crushed me. Врит [he] isn’t as intimidating as she looks. She’s actually nice.”

“She’s an assassin,” Вайолет [she] said, the suspicion in her tone evident. “It’s good that she helped, but I’ve got your back now. You don’t have to keep a monster like her lurking at our backs.”

Врит [he]’s eyes narrowed. She took a step forward, her lips pressing thin. “Keep your words to—”

Айлин [she] lifted a hand. Врит [he]’s mouth snapped shut.

Huh. I didn’t think that would actually work.

“I love you Вайолет [she], but you don’t know Врит [he] yet,” Айлин [she] said, picking his words carefully. “Jumping to conclusions like this isn’t going to help anybody. Врит [he] and I have a pretty good deal going, and we need all the help we can get.”

“But can you actually trust her?” Вайолет [she] asked, thrusting a finger in the furred demon’s direction. “A deal is only good as long as both parties get something out of it. How do you know she won’t just turn and stab you in the back at the first opportunity?”

“Because I’m not trying to get eviscerated by Паук [he],” Врит [he] said. She stepped out of the shadows and walked to stand directly before Вайолет [she].

The two demons stared each other down. Айлин [she] went to open his mouth but caught Паук [he]’s eye. The masked demon shook his head and, wisely, Айлин [she] let his mouth close.

“So the only reason you’re here is because you’re scared,” Вайолет [she] said. She crossed her arms and matched Врит [he]’s stance. “That’s exactly what I was saying. You’re obviously competent, but I don’t see any reason to keep someone around that’s only looking out for their own skin. You don’t have anything in the game other than not wanting to die.”

Врит [he]’s eyes narrowed. “Yes, I do.”

“Yeah? What is it?” Вайолет [she] pressed.

“I’m not saying,” Врит [he] said flatly. “It’s none of your concern.”

“Then how do we know you’re actually on our side?”

“Because I said I am. Айлин [she] and I have a deal that I can’t replace elsewhere. That’s the only explanation you’re getting.”

“You can’t expect me to believe that any deal is irreplicable. That’s not a convincing argument in the slightest,” Вайолет [she] said. She looked at Айлин [she] expectantly. “You can’t tell me I’m wrong here, can you? I don’t know what this deal is but making her your second is a huge commitment. You need to be able to trust your second more than anyone else. A bad second can completely destroy you and everything you’ve built.”

When did Вайолет [she] learn so much about gangs and how they operate?

Айлин [she] fought to keep his powers repressed. The last thing he wanted to do was accidentally take a bite out of Вайолет [she]’s energy.

“This deal is irreplicable,” Врит [he] said before Айлин [she] could say anything. “It’s not something I can get anywhere else. I won’t claim anything to the rest of the guild, but I have Айлин [she]’s back and he knows it.”

Айлин [she] was slightly surprised to taste the truth on Врит [he]’s words. He’d believed they had a working agreement, but her claim went beyond just that.

“She’s telling the truth,” Айлин [she] said.

Вайолет [she] blinked in surprise. “How do you know?”

“I can taste the truth,” Айлин [she] replied. “I’m a knowledge demon. There’s a lot I haven’t had a chance to completely catch you up on yet, Вайолет [she]. We need to fix that as soon as we can, but you can trust me — and you can trust Врит [he] as well.”

Паук [he]’s head tilted to the side at his words. Something had caught his attention, but he didn’t say anything and Айлин [she] didn’t ask.

Вайолет [she] studied him and Врит [he] quietly for a few seconds. Then she uncrossed her hands and let them fall to her sides. “Okay. If you trust her, then I’ll trust your judgement. I can’t say I like it.

I’m the one that’s going to protect all of us.”

There was more in her voice than just sisterly care. It was the drive that only a demon could understand. Айлин [she] clamped down on his powers, but it was too late. His mind brushed across Вайолет [she]’s and her eyes widened.

“What was that?”

“Did you just take a bite out of her?” Врит [he] demanded.

“No,” Айлин [she] said, letting out a relieved breath. “But I may have subconsciously tried to. Sorry, Вайолет [she]. I learned something big about you and almost stole energy on accident. I’m still figuring out how to keep my strength under control.”

“She’s immune? You’re kidding me,” Врит [he] muttered as she looked down at her hands. “Does that mean her Runic energy is stronger than mine? Паук [he] is unfair.”

“I think we should sit down and really discuss what we’re capable of,” Вайолет [she] said slowly.

“That might be a good idea,” Айлин [she] said.

Врит [he] glared at him. “Of course you and your sister think it is. You aren’t the ones that are going to get chunks bitten out of them from sharing. I’ll pass.”

“Oh?” Вайолет [she] raised an eyebrow. “So much for that loyalty. Паук [he] ordered me to keep Айлин [she] safe. That includes knowing the abilities of his subordinates.”

“Then I’ll tell you in private,” Врит [he] said. She shot a glance at Айлин [she]. “When he isn’t there.”

“You could lie. Айлин [she] is the one that can tell if you’re speaking the truth or not,” Вайолет [she] countered. She crossed her arms again. “I believe Айлин [she], but I also won’t let myself get blindsided because you decided to hide something from me. I’m taking this seriously. Are you?”

“Вайолет [she], it’s fine,” Айлин [she] said. “We don’t have to—”

“No,” Врит [he] said. She let out a weary sigh. “Вайолет [she] is right, and I’ve seen demons like her before. She’s a Хранитель [she].”

“A Хранитель [she]?” Айлин [she] asked. “You mean her feeling? How do you know? And what does that have to do with our conversation?”

“Because Хранитель [she]s are some of the best damn guards there are. I’ve done jobs on noble houses that use them, and they’ve never gone well,” Врит [he] said as she rubbed the bridge of her nose. “Хранитель [she]s are great at protecting things. They don’t like giving their hoard away, after all. And given how Вайолет [she] is speaking, I’m pretty sure her hoard is us.”

“It’s the people I care about,” Вайолет [she] corrected. “Don’t include yourself in that.”

Врит [he] opened her mouth to respond, then let out a pained hiss. She glared at Айлин [she] and he winced.

“Sorry.”

Врит [he] just sighed. “I figured it was going to happen. Either way, Вайолет [she] was right. I haven’t gone up against a Хранитель [she] that gathers other demons, but I’d imagine she’ll be a damn effective guard if you let her do what she wants. If this is part of it, then I’ll do it — but sitting down rather than standing. I get the feeling it isn’t going to be very fun for me.”

Вайолет [she] gave Врит [he] an approving nod and sat down across from her. Айлин [she] hesitated for a second before joining them on the ground.

I might need to start allocating more food for Врит [he]. And time. I’m going to have to feed her a while to make up for this.

Chapter 479: Smiles & Letters

Ной [he] was pretty sure he’d been forgotten. It wasn’t that he particularly minded that — he had told Айлин [she] and the others to pretend as if he wasn’t there. He just hadn’t actually expected them to do it.

That said, he had never been happier to have been forgotten. He’d learned so much about demons in the last few minutes that he was worried he might actually forget some of it. The corner of his mouth quirked up.

Who would have thought. Demons that live in the Damned Plains actually know a little bit more about themselves than I do. What’s interesting is that Ли [she] knew so little. She understands the basics, but even Айлин [she] knows more about being a demon than she does.

Is that because she spent all her time alone in the Wastes instead of in a city? I get that the cities were dangerous, but Айлин [she] is weaker than Ли [she]. His whole group is. So how is it they were managing to survive even at Rank 1 when Ли [she] was scared of the cities at Rank 3?

Ной [he]’s brow furrowed as he thought. Азель [he] had been Ли [she]’s father. He’d known she’d followed him into the mortal plane. Hell, he’d encouraged it. There was no doubt he’d been lurking around Ли [she] for quite some time, probably since she’d been born.

Could he have intentionally kept Ли [she] away from the other demons? He was a Rank 5. That’s no joke. Азель [he] knew a lot more than he let on. Damn it. I wish I could have been there when he died. Actually, and I can’t believe I’m thinking this, but I wish he hadn’t died. If he could seal Ли [she] and stop her from losing herself, then he knew a lot more than I do.

But the past was the past. No matter what they knew now, there was no way to turn back time and ask Азель [he] the questions that Ной [he] needed answered. All he could do is move ahead with what he’d learned — and that wasn’t an insignificant amount.

Ли [she] and Вайолет [she] have a lot of similarities. That’s incredibly useful. If I can figure out how Вайолет [she]’s runes work, I can make progress toward Ли [she]’s as well. For that matter, Айлин [she] also has some similarities with her with his ability to taste things that shouldn’t be tangible like truth. Honestly, that’s an incredible ability.

That wasn’t Айлин [she]’s only incredible ability. Ной [he] wasn’t sure if he should laugh or rub the bridge of his nose as he looked at the trio of demons sitting in the center of the room. Врит [he] was laid out flat on the ground, having gotten the energy drained out of her about a dozen times over the course of their conversation.

Айлин [she] had sent for someone to get food and was absently feeding her as they spoke. He’d propped her head up against his crossed legs. Врит [he] had objected to it at first due to Вайолет [she]’s presence, but it had only taken about two more questions before she’d changed her mind.

I was a bit worried about Вайолет [she]’s change in personality at first. She was obviously a driven girl before, but the Rank 3 Rune really strengthened her resolve. For a moment it looked like she was going to turn into an obsessed guard that didn’t let Айлин [she] do anything on his own.

Fortunately, that didn’t seem to be the case. Вайолет [she]’s expression had been steadily softening throughout the conversation. The more Айлин [she] and Врит [he] discussed their abilities and the clearer it became exactly what their deal was, the less Вайолет [she] seemed to dislike her. Ной [he] could almost pin the point where Вайолет [she]’s opinion of Врит [he] switched from distaste to curiosity and then to amusement.

“So you don’t want anything from us other than to continue doing… this?” Вайолет [she] asked, waving vaguely in Айлин [she] and Врит [he]’s direction.

“Yes,” Врит [he] said once she’d finished chewing a large grape. “Could you stop asking that? And feel free to ask Айлин [she] to verify this, but I will kill you if you go around telling anyone about this.”

“She’s lying,” Айлин [she] said.

Вайолет [she] snickered as Врит [he]’s glare bored into Айлин [she]’s skull.

“I’ll keep it to myself,” Вайолет [she] promised as she placed a hand over her heart. “But I’m curious. Was the deal that someone has to feed you? Or does it have to be Айлин [she]?”

“This has absolutely nothing to do with the original line of questioning. I will not be answering that.”

“She’s telling the truth.”

Вайолет [she] shrugged and stretched her arms over her head with a yawn. “That’s fine with me. I think I’m satisfied. It doesn’t look like you’re going to stab us in the back, so I really don’t care what you think of Айлин [she].”

“That was a lie,” Айлин [she] said automatically. He paused, but it was too late to take back his words. He cleared his throat. “The latter half, that is.”

It was Вайолет [she]’s turn to glare at Айлин [she]. Врит [he] joined her, united against a common enemy. “I no longer like this ability. Turn it off.”


“I can’t,” Айлин [she] said sheepishly. “Not yet. I’m working on learning how to control it, but I’m not very good at that yet.”

“Maybe focus on not ripping energy out of everybody you speak to first,” Врит [he] suggested with a sigh. Then she opened her mouth and gave him a pointed look.

Айлин [she] fed her another fruit. Ной [he] was starting to get hungry watching them. He wasn’t about to go ask Мокси [she] to feed him, though. That felt like a bit much.

At least they’ve figured out something that works for all of them. It’s interesting to see how effective the flawless runes are in comparison to the normal Rank 3s here. Врит [he] is getting snacked on constantly, but Айлин [she] and Вайолет [she] are equally matched so he can’t accidentally eat her energy. I wonder if he could do it on purpose.

Ной [he] tapped a finger against his leg. This was good information, but he needed more to decode how to help Ли [she]. There was always the option of testing different qualities and types of runes on a bunch of different demons. That thought made Ной [he]’s lips curl in distaste.

He was entirely fine with killing anyone that posed a threat to his group or him. Using a ton of demons as nothing more than test subjects… that felt a little far, especially given the things he needed to test.

I’m not a saint. Never claimed to be. I’m not going to be a monster either. If I’m going to test something, then it’s going to be something that should help someone, not hurt them. There’s no point randomly stuffing runes into demons unless I actually have a proper game plan.

Therein lied the problem. It didn’t make sense for Ли [she] to try to progress with anything less than flawless runes.

Азель [he] definitely didn’t have flawless runes, but his personality still got warped and controlled by the feeling he consumed. The worst part is it makes sense. Demons and their runes are strongly connected. You can’t split them apart without killing them, so a hatred demon is going to become hateful.

If I could find a way to somehow separate that or limit the effect of the rune without significantly weakening Ли [she], I could solve the first of her two problems.

The other problem… Ной [he] wasn’t even sure where he could start on that. He still had absolutely no idea how Ли [she] had managed to mash a Master Rune into her combination. It should have been impossible according to everything he knew about runes.

But, on the other hand, the more he learned about runes, the more he realized that people barely knew anything at all about them.

Our soul may only be able to actively use seven runes at once… but is that truly the limit as to what you can combine? Master Runes break other rules. Maybe there’s a way to break the rule of seven as well.

That was something he could test. He didn’t want to waste any of his current Master Runes, though.

Eh. I’m sure the Damned Plains has Master Runes in it. I’m going to need a whole lot more runes anyway at the rate I’m going through them. I was able to bring Айлин [she] and Вайолет [she] up to Rank 3 without too much difficulty, but I can’t keep at that forever.

I’ll be in position to do that pretty soon. Once Айлин [she] collects a bunch of gangs under my banner, it won’t be long before I draw the attention of someone a little more important. I should be able to bargain with them. I just need to get into their equivalent of an auction or learn where a good hunting ground is.

And if they don’t give me that information… well, if they’re stronger, then they’ll have some decent Runes for me. I get what I want either way. I was kind of betting on taking a few runes from the other streetlords, but nobody else has shown up to challenge Айлин [she]. He might be a bit too good at his job. Maybe I’ll pay a visit to the ones that don’t send word they’ve surrendered by tomorrow.

Ной [he] shook his head. There were too many ‘ifs’ to consider that line of thought any further. For the time being, everything was going exactly how he wanted it to. It wouldn’t be long before he had control of the local gangs and enough strength to push his way into a higher level of society, where he could continue gathering strength and runes.

After I do that, I’ll find a way to get some stronger demons in my favor and keep climbing my way up the ladder until I have a whole damn army — no pun intended. I’ll upgrade my own runes in the process, fix Ли [she] up, and then beat Визен [he]’s ass and go back to the mortal plane. Preferably in that order.

He was more than aware that his plan may have been just a slight tad optimistic, but nothing ever went like he wanted it to anyway. If shit was going to go south, it might as well go south while he was already aiming for more than he had any right to get.

While he’d been lost in thought, Айлин [she]’s group had wrapped up their conversation and were just sitting around on the ground awkwardly, likely waiting for him to give them an order. He’d just been standing there and staring at them absentmindedly.

Ah, damn it.

Ной [he] took a step forward — and tripped. Something soft and furry had lodged itself in front of his shin. He swore and stumbled, catching himself before he could fall and spinning.

Then he froze in place. Peering up at him with disdain, nose scrunched in apparent annoyance and eyes twinkling with amusement, was a white-furred cat with glistening red horns. A heartbeat passed as Ной [he] locked eyes with Маскот [he].

“You little shit,” Ной [he] said, a disbelieving laugh slipping from his mouth as he picked Маскот [he] up. The cat yowled in displeasure but did nothing as Ной [he] scooped him into his arms. “How did you get over here?”

Маскот [he] twisted his head to look up at Ной [he]. The cat gave him a dry look, as if to ask if he was stupid.

“Can you make a portal back?” Ной [he] asked, his chest tightening. “You came here on your own, right?”

Маскот [he] squirmed out of Ной [he]’s grip and dropped to the ground. Then he started licking his nether regions clean. Ной [he]’s lips pressed thin and he blew out a huff. That was a ‘no’ if he’d ever seen one.

Wait. I don’t need to go back. Not yet. Even if I could return home, there’s stuff I have to accomplish here first. But Маскот [he] can somehow fucking travel between dimensions. Does that mean…

He crouched next to Маскот [he] and the cat paused, tongue still sticking out of his mouth, to meet his gaze. They stared at each other for a second.

“A letter,” Ной [he] said, his voice taut. “Can you take a letter back to the others?”

And, in response, he could have sworn Маскот [he] smiled.

Chapter 480: Failed Experiments

Возрождение [she] was gaining weight. She was certain of it. After all the food she’d eaten sitting and watching Ной [he]’s group, it would have been hard not to. Not even gods were immune to the laws of nature. Not at her level, at least.

“I can honestly say that I’m surprised,” Декрас [he] said from beside her. He leaned back in his chair and crossed his arms in front of his chest. “If I didn’t know better, I would have thought that Ной [he] actually planned every single part of this. He’s remarkably good at bullshit.”

“Makes me wonder if he stole a rune from another god,” Возрождение [she] agreed with a nod. She could barely bring herself to pull her eyes away from the screen. Her eye twitched slightly at the cat at Ной [he]’s side. “He’s certainly good at stealing things.”

“It’s not so funny when you’re the one getting robbed, is it?” Декрас [he] asked primly. “I could have handled him if you hadn’t gotten so twisted up about it.”

“I’m getting my payment back in entertainment. I don’t need you interfering,” Возрождение [she] said with a glare. “And, as I recall it, your attempt was foiled by yet another mortal that managed to steal from you.”

“Bah,” Декрас [he] said. He turned away and focused his attention fully on the screen. It was rather embarrassing. He’d gotten robbed not twice, but three times. Three different mortals had each managed to steal power from him. One of them had even been his own man.

That has to sting. Oh well. He’ll get over it… and maybe he’ll learn to stop letting people take bites out of him. Seriously. There’s a time and a place. Then again, I don’t know how smug I can be. Ной [he] managed to steal from me twice. At least Декрас [he]’ little thieves only got the best of him a single time.

Возрождение [she] puffed her cheeks out and blew out an annoyed breath. She distracted herself by studying the glowing screen before them. The small demon boy that Ной [he] had recruited — Айлин [she] — was staring at Ной [he] with a mixture of abject awe, fear, and disbelief. Ной [he] had somehow managed to forget his audience during the conversation with his stolen companion, and Возрождение [she] could practically hear Айлин [she]’s thoughts just from his expression.

“He’s wondering just how strong the cat is if it can take Ной [he] by surprise,” Декрас [he] said with a low chuckle. “I wonder if they’ll start worshipping the cat as well.”

Worshipping was the right word. The way Айлин [she] and Вайолет [she] looked at Ной [he] wasn’t the way soldiers treated a general. It was the way followers looked to a god. The back of Возрождение [she]’s neck prickled.

It wasn’t completely uncommon for someone to manage to form a cult on a mortal plane. Mortals were motivated and stupid, a combination that worked incredibly well to generate energy. There was a reason Возрождение [she] and Декрас [he] even bothered with tending to their respective followings on the mortal realms.

But Ной [he] wasn’t trying to become a god. At least, Возрождение [she] was fairly certain he wasn’t. She didn’t watch every second of his life — more like something around ninety percent of it.

“You don’t think—” Возрождение [she] started.

“Of course not,” Декрас [he] said with a shake of his head. “He’s barely even registered it, Возрождение [she]. He wants to try to fix the demon girl’s runes and stop the other thief. That’s it. He’s not trying to harness divinity yet.”

“Yet?” Возрождение [she] arched an eyebrow. “I’d say he’s got quite a way before he can even consider trying to form a Divine Rune — and if he relies on the faith of others to form it, he won’t get very far. I’m not concerned about him reaching godhood anytime too soon. I’m more wondering if he’ll succeed with the demon runes.”

Декрас [he] shook his head. “They’re failed experiments. No matter how hard he tries, that’s what they are. There’s no fixing them. Demons can never form a Divine Rune. They’re little more than animals, controlled more and more by their desires the stronger they grow.”

Возрождение [she] tossed a piece of chocolate at Декрас [he]’ head. He caught it before it could land, only for a second piece to nail him between the eyes.

“You’re talking with a lot of confidence for someone who gave up on the experiment after playing with it for what amounts to a flicker of time. You barely even tried.”

“Perhaps. They were useless to me. When it became clear they could not rule over their own powers, it became pointless to lend them further attention. They are a flawed species without potential to leave the mortal plane.” Декрас [he] hesitated for a moment longer than normal. Возрождение [she] pulled her gaze away from the screen to look at him and raised an eyebrow. The other god noticed her interest and pursed his lips. “I must admit that Ли [she] has caught my attention. She is… interesting.”

“So you admit you were wrong?” Возрождение [she] prodded. “The demons are more than a failed experiment if one of them has your attention. That also means there’s a chance Ли [she]’s runes can be repaired.”

“Don’t try to force a confession from me,” Декрас [he] said with an irritable frown. “A single demon does not a species save. She is… unique. Perhaps there is a way to repair her. Perhaps there is a way to repair the demons as a whole. I do not know. I do not care.”

“You say that, but you’ve asked me to swap our view to Ли [she] quite frequently. I think you’re rather invested in her success.”

Декрас [he]’ eyes narrowed. “Enough of this. I grow tired of your questioning — and I have seen enough of the demon children goggling in awe. It reminds me too much of my own idiot supporters. Let us see something else.”

“Like what?” Возрождение [she] asked. “I was rather enjoying it. Ной [he] should be due to meet up with Мокси [she] again quite soon. They haven’t had any time together recently. I’m looking forward to that.”


“You are a pervert.”

Возрождение [she] jerked upright in her chair and choked on her own saliva, coughing into a fist. Once she gathered herself, she glared at Декрас [he]. “That was not what I was implying. I just enjoy watching mortals interact. They’re so full of passion and — oh, nevermind.”

Декрас [he] smirked at her. “No, please. Continue. You enjoy watching passion? Do the other gods know of your side hobbies?”

“Don’t act as if you even talk to any gods other than me,” Возрождение [she] muttered as she sank back into her chair. “You’ve alienated every single god and goddess in the area with your vile nature. Just tell me what you wanted to see.”

“The other thief,” Декрас [he] said. His brow tightened and his knuckles lightened as his hand gripped the armrest on his chair. “He did not strike me as a fool, but he has plans in the Damned Plains. I want to know what he seeks… and how likely it is that he succeeds.”

“Why do you care?” Возрождение [she] asked, tilting her head to the side.

“Because I want to know if he’ll come into conflict with Ной [he] again,” Декрас [he] said.

“Aha! Now you can’t even deny that you care,” Возрождение [she] said triumphantly. To her surprise, Декрас [he] didn’t deny the accusation. He just looked at her out of the corners of his eyes.

“I do. What do you think will happen if Ной [he] gets his hand on the Master Rune the other thief has — or worse, if the opposite happens?”

Возрождение [she] grimaced. She didn’t say another word. She just turned to the screen and waved her hand. Ной [he] and his growing group of followers vanished, replaced by a glistening wave of gold.

***

Визен [he] leaned heavily against his staff and blew out a slow sigh. “I suppose this will have to do.”

“It’s certainly a fixer-upper,” Барба [she] agreed from beside him. She checked the necklace around her neck with her good hand, then nodded. “It doesn’t look like any of the others had any difficulty.”

“I would hope they didn’t,” Визен [he] said with a dry laugh. “We haven’t even started. If any of us were having problems after preparing for this long, I would be poorly prepared indeed. These first steps are just laying the ground. It will be some time before our influence extends to the City of Gold.”

Барба [she] nodded. The ground squelched beneath her feet and she grimaced. She wiped her hand off on her apron, leaving a streak of blood across its already-stained surface. “Can we clean this place up a bit? If we’re going to be living out of it for the next few months, I’d prefer to make it a bit more homely. Maybe a nice little welcome mat at the door. A hand-carved sign.”

“Do what you want,” Визен [he] said with a wave. “You have your toys. I have mine.”

He turned. The blood splattered across the floor in the cave at their feet squelched again as he walked across the room, passing by the heaps of dead demons strewn across it. A single one remained alive.

His once glistening silver armor was cracked and shattered. A large, weeping gash ran across the center of his chest and one of his eyes had been put out. The demon was at the cusp of death.

Визен [he]’s lips curled up. He’d already forgotten the threats the demon had given him when he and Барба [she] had walked into his “throne” room. Having a throne in a mansion hardly felt like a throne. It was just a fancy chair.

“Are you prepared to answer my question now?” Визен [he] asked.

“Just kill me,” the demon wheezed. “Skolas will kill you when you come for him.”

“Skolas. That’s the king of this walking city?” Визен [he] asked, tilting his head to the side. “A Rank 6? 7?”

“Rank 7.” A flicker of smug anger, the final victory of a dying man knowing that his killer would not be long in following him, crossed the demon’s broken features. “You will die an agonizing death for attempting to usurp him.”

A dry laugh slipped from Визен [he]’s lips. He knelt down and pressed his hand to the demon’s skull, digging his fingers into the top of his red-skinned head. “A Rank 7 demon will not end me, wretch.”

The demon groaned in pain as Визен [he] rose, lifting him into the air. His one eye met Визен [he]’s gaze.

“Your race is weak,” Визен [he] whispered, bringing their faces so close together that he could taste the fear on the dying man’s breath. “You believe you rule emotion. That you can grow stronger through them. You are wrong.”

“Stop rambling and kill me.”

Визен [he]’s lips pulled apart in a mixture of a snarl and a smile. “You do not rule your emotions. Your emotions rule you. Demons are a race of slaves, shackled by their own minds. I can see that you do not believe me, but I am honest man. Allow me to prove it to you by taking those shackles from you.”

The demon didn’t get a chance to answer. Визен [he] unleashed his Mind Runes, sending their energy worming out from his fingers and into the demon’s skull. The demon’s back arched as he screamed in pain, his will desperately rising up to fight against the Mind Magic.

Визен [he] blew his meager resistance to the side like a wildfire tearing through a dry field of wheat. Spikes of energy ripped into the demon’s psyche. They dug into his mind and carved apart mental walls.

Anger rose to meet the mental assault— the last remnants of the demon’s pride. It slammed into his magic. For an instant, their willpower locked each other in place. Both stood still, unable to move.

“Is that all?” Визен [he] whispered. “The extent of the anger you are so proud of? Are you not a demon of wrath? Of pride? And this is all you can muster?”

For a moment, the fury intensified. The final push of a dying man. It pressed Визен [he]’s magic back by the faintest amount. The demon’s lips curled in smug amusement as Визен [he] gave way and his eye refocused to stare down the old man.

The demon froze.

Визен [he] met the demon’s gaze and smiled.

“Forgive me. I was having a little fun at your expense,” Визен [he] said.

Then he released the full strength of his runes. The demon’s final defense evaporated in less than a flicker of an instant, buried completely under an immense wave of force. All the anger that he was so proud of disappeared in a flash, and all that remained in his mind was Визен [he]’s immense presence.

The demon screamed, thrashing in an attempt to free himself from the old mage’s hand, but it was impossible. No matter how hard he struggled, Визен [he]’s grasp didn’t so much as budge.

“Do you see now?” Визен [he] asked. “All those emotions you’re so proud of are nothing in the face of absolute fear.

You are nothing.”

Визен [he] let go. The demon fell to the ground, landing on his knees and slumping back. The whites of his eyes were exposed as he looked up in abject terror. He no longer held his own chains. He couldn’t so much as mutter a word without Визен [he]’s permission.

Demons. Bah. When you give yourself so utterly to one emotion, you expose yourself to all the others. So powerful — and yet, so weak. So easy to control.

“Answer my question,” Визен [he] said. “Do you understand now?”

“Yes,” the demon whispered.

“I am pleased to have been your teacher.” Визен [he] smiled and leaned closer, his eyes going dark. “Now — tell me of Сиван [he]. Tell me of the demon that is rumored to have passed through the afterlife and returned.”

Chapter 481: Smile

Ной [he] shot out of the tent, Маскот [he] clutched in his hands and held before him with locked arms like a petulant child. He didn’t bother waiting around to see what the demons thought of the cat’s arrival. It would take too long to explain everything, so it was easier to just let them come to their own conclusions.

He pulled aside a random demon in the camp and ordered them to bring a writing tool and some paper. They hurried off and came back just a minute later holding what he needed, their face pale with fear. Ной [he] took it from them, gave them a curt nod, and then strode off to find Мокси [she] and Ли [she] with the supplies stuffed into his travel bag.

He arrived at his tent and poked his head inside. Fortunately, both women were already there, sitting in a pair of plant chairs that Мокси [she] had formed to fill out the rather barren room.

Ли [she] had a bag of food tucked under an arm and was happily crunching away on it. Ной [he] couldn’t see what was in the bag but it smelled vaguely citrusy. The loud cracks coming from whatever she was grinding down between her jaws really didn’t align with anything citrus-associated, but there were bigger problems at hand.

“How’d it go?” Мокси [she] asked, turning to him and freezing as she spotted the cat in his hands. She leapt to her feet in surprise. “You’ve got Маскот [he]? How?”

“He somehow portaled into the Damned Plains,” Ной [he] replied. Маскот [he] sent him an irate look as he walked over to the chairs. The cat didn’t seem too pleased with his method of transportation. Then again, he hadn’t teleported away or attacked Ной [he] yet, so he couldn’t have been too annoyed.

“Can he—”

Ной [he] shook his head. “Unfotunately not. At least, I’m pretty sure he can’t. Maybe he just doesn’t want to. Getting a way out of here was my first thought as well, but I think we’ll need to look for a different angle for that.”

Disappointment washed over Мокси [she]’s features. Ли [she] took a handful of something from her bag and tossed it into her mouth, continuing to crunch away.

“Damn,” Мокси [she] said, her shoulders slumping. She reached out and scratched the top of Маскот [he]’s head, just behind his horns. The cat purred. “What’s he doing over here? He didn’t bring a bunch of monsters with him to mess with us, did he?”

Ной [he] hesitated. That was definitely a possibility. He hadn’t seen anything, but Маскот [he] did have a penchant for showing up with something big and ugly on his tail. The cat definitely liked watching them fight — or perhaps he just liked watching them kill things. Both were probably equally likely.

“That probably remains to be seen. I haven’t noticed anything yet,” Ной [he] said. He walked over to Мокси [she]’s chair and stole it, flopping down. The soft vines gave in more than he’d expected and he sank into them as the chair molded to his back. “Whoa. This is really comfortable.”

Маскот [he] yowled in warning and Ной [he] glanced back just in time to see Мокси [she] sitting down even in spite of his attempted theft. He held Маскот [he] up as Мокси [she] lowered herself into his lap and leaned back against his chest. She twisted her head to send him a smug look. “Thanks. You’re a bit less comfortable, but I suppose I’ll have to settle.”

“I thought you were trying to conserve your seeds,” Ной [he] said as he shifted Маскот [he] over Мокси [she]’s head and dropped him onto her lap. The cat padded in a small circle before curling up and lowering his head with a contented purr.

“I was.” Мокси [she] wiggled around to get more comfortable and got her hair caught in Ной [he]’s mouth in the process. “These aren’t made from my normal seeds. I was testing my rune on a slab of meat. A bit of a waste, but it worked.”

Ной [he] craned his neck back and tried to get the hair out of his mouth. The attempt failed and, after a few seconds, he gave up and accepted his fate. “There’s something a little weird about sitting on plants made out of meat.”

“They aren’t made out of meat. They’re just using the energy from it,” Мокси [she] corrected. “Normal plants aren’t made out of dirt and sunlight, you know. Also, why are you eating my hair? Don’t give Ли [she] any ideas, please.”

Ной [he] glared at Мокси [she] and she smirked in response. Letting out a huff, Ной [he] decided the only winning move was to not even respond.

“I wouldn’t eat any part of you,” Ли [she] said defensively. She paused for a second, watching them with more than just a little curiosity in her eyes. “But… just for the sake of expanding my knowledge, does Мокси [she]’s hair taste good?”

Ной [he] stared at Ли [she]. That wasn’t a question someone who wasn’t planning on eating someone asked. Of course, Ли [she] would never try to actually eat Мокси [she], but he didn’t put it past her to not take a nibble of some hair to test it out.


Мокси [she] arched an eyebrow and gave him a playful grin. “Does my hair not taste good? Now I’m offended.”

“Are you trying to get chomped?” He untangled a hand from Мокси [she] and reached into his travel bag, pulling out the writing supplies he’d just gotten. Мокси [she] stiffened, the smile vanishing from her face as she realized what he was holding.

“Oh, shit,” Мокси [she] breathed. “We can write a letter back!”

“There we go.” It was Ной [he]’s turn to look smug, though the effect was somewhat lost because Мокси [she]’s hair was still covering half of his face. “Маскот [he] can’t or won’t bring us back, but he can definitely take a letter back. At the very least we can let everyone know that we’re okay.”

“Are you sure Маскот [he] will do it?” Ли [she] asked. “That seems like a lot of work.”

Ной [he] reached around Мокси [she]’s waist to scratch the cat’s back. “Sure he will. I don’t know where Джален [he] is, but after Маскот [he] delivers the letter, he can go get any form of payment he wants from him.”

“Do you have a deal with Джален [he] about that or something?”

“Nah, but he’ll be fine. He’s rich — and he isn’t here to say no, is he?”

“No, I guess he isn’t.” Мокси [she] burst into laughter, but it quickly petered off. She leaned her head back against Ной [he]’s shoulder and a small frown crossed her features. “What can we even say, though? I didn’t think we’d be lucky enough to even have a conversation with the others until we got out of here. I’ve been thinking over what I wish I told Эмили [she] before we left… but now I don’t even know what to say.”

“I think saying we’re alive and planning to return once all this shit is dealt with is probably the most important thing we can do. If possible, hopefully Маскот [he] can also bring us back a letter from them. I want to make sure they’re keeping up with their studies and practice.”

“Seriously? That’s what you’re concerned about?”

“They need to be stretching as well. And eating,” Ли [she] advised. “Both are important for growing bodies.”

“So they are,” Ной [he] said with a nod. “And training doesn’t stop just because we’re gone. I don’t know what Арбитраж [he] has done or plans to do with them since we aren’t there anymore. I’d like an update, even if it’s a boring one.”

Мокси [she]’s back stiffened against him. “Shit. You’re right. Эмили [she] should be fine due to her heritage, but nothing has stopped Якоб [he] or Верруд [he] from keeping up with their bullshit. I hope they’re all safe.”

“They are,” Ной [he] said. He rustled the paper in his hand. “The kids are resourceful, and they’ve got enough connections to pull now. Let’s just figure out what to say to them and get it sent out before some more shit happens here. I don’t think the demons are going to be silent for much longer.”

Мокси [she] nodded and Ли [she] leaned forward in her chair as the three of them started to draft out their letter.

***

“What do you think of The Сеть [organization]?” Айлин [she] asked.

“It’s a little plain,” Torrick said hesitantly, watching Врит [he] with wary eyes as he spoke. Even though Айлин [she] had introduced everyone to her again properly, he didn’t blame the boy for being intimidated. Врит [he] was not a very kind looking demon.

“Plain can be good,” Врит [he] said. “It’s also bold. The more generic your name is, the more chance it ends up treading on the territory of another gang and angering some hot-headed fool.”

“Wouldn’t it be wise to keep our name something a little more inconspicuous? People would be less likely to attack us if we sounded boring,” Вайолет [she] said.

“I think it’s far too late for inconspicuous,” Айлин [she] said with a shake of his head. “And we’ve got me, you, and Врит [he]. That isn’t even counting Паук [he] and his companions. I’d say we’re strong enough to start taking some liberties. That’ll also show the other gangs that we aren’t afraid to throw our weight around, right?”

Врит [he] nodded. “You’re learning quickly. I guess that’s to be expected. I think the name fits, especially given that Паук [he] is the one at the top. I think it works, and we need a name sooner rather than later. If we’re bringing the other gangs under us, we can’t let them keep their names.”

“Why not?” Эдда [she] asked. She’d found something to chew on, but Айлин [she] wasn’t sure what it was. He decided not to ask. She’d never gotten sick from eating anything, so she’d probably be okay.

“It lets them keep too much of their former identities,” Врит [he] said, sending a glance at Айлин [she] to make sure the new information hadn’t accidentally triggered his abilities. “They need to view it as joining a new gang, and they need to recognize Айлин [she] as their streetlord. Even if we keep their organization just to avoid a huge mess, the chain of command needs to be evident.”

“I agree. I guess we’ll go with The Сеть [organization], then,” Вайолет [she] said. She stretched her arms over her head and yawned. Айлин [she] was tempted to do the same. It had been a very, very long day. He wasn’t quite ready to kill for some sleep, but he wasn’t far from it.

“How long do you think it’ll be before the Silent Silverfang responds to what happened?” Айлин [she] asked. “And what about the other gangs, for that matter?”

“Tomorrow,” Врит [he] said confidently. Her features darkened. “Word has spread by now. Anyone planning to make a move is going to be smart enough not to try it on their own. We should be prepared for a difficult day.”

“Yeah. I kind of figured.” Айлин [she] sighed. He drew in a deep breath and let it out as he shook his head. “Right. Let’s go back over the plan one last time before we get some sleep. We need to be ready for everything that’s coming our way, even if we don’t know all of what it’ll be yet.”

“How do you prepare for something that you don’t know?” Торик [he] asked.

“By having lots of plans — and by filling in Паук [he], Мокси [she], and Ли [she] on them.”

Torrick swallowed. “How… how many plans, exactly? There are a lot of things that can go wrong.”

Айлин [she]’s response was a smile that sent shivers down the spines of every single demon sitting in the room.
