Chapter 532: Enjoyable

“You know, that’s a real tempting offer, but I’m afraid I’m going to have to pass on it,” Ной [he] said, watching the deadly demon warily. “I’m unfortunately otherwise engaged. No need for a rain check.”

“I insist,” the woman said. She ran a hand down the flat side of her axe, leaving a clean streak in the blood coating its surface. “I will not accept your answer.”

“Ah. We can’t be having that.” Ной [he]’s eyes narrowed. He extended his senses to brush across the demon, trying to get a feel for how far her strength truly went. “When somebody says no, it means no. You might need some lessons in consent.”

If the demon noticed his domain, she did nothing to address it. Cold, hungry energy emanated from her body like wisps of icy fog rolling across Ной [he]’s mind. She was strong. Much stronger than the four that she’d cut down moments ago — though that really shouldn’t have been much of a surprise.

Rank 5. Maybe Rank 6? I don’t know. She’s by far the most powerful demon we’ve met in the Damned Plains other than Йору [he], though. I can’t take any risks with her. She has to die.

The demon spun her axe around and drove it into the ground with enough force to crack the stone at her feet. Her gaze flicked down. They locked on the corpses splattered across the ground. Her eyes widened and a hand shot to her mouth.

“Oh, no. Oh, no, no. I did it again.” The demon’s voice raised in pitch and she took a step back, her gray features losing a shade of color.

Ной [he] and Мокси [she] exchanged a glance. It didn’t take a genius to tell that the woman’s head might have had more marbles than brain matter.

“Yes, you did,” Ной [he] said slowly, not entirely sure what it was that she’d done. He didn’t get the feeling her distress was because she’d just slaughtered four demons in cold blood — not unless she had two entirely different personalities trapped in her head.

“I took your prey,” the woman said, pulling at her hair and letting out a groan. “Oh, no. I got to excited. I interfered with the brush.”

Yup. She’s batshit insane. Of course she is.

Мокси [she]’s fingers twitched at her sides. Ной [he] could practically see the gears turning in her head. He was pretty sure she was a few seconds away from sending her plants out in hopes of getting a surprise attack on the madwoman. Ной [he] caught her gaze and shook his head slightly.

The demon might have been insane, but she was blindingly fast and powerful. He needed her attention focused entirely on him. If she went after Мокси [she], Ной [he] wasn’t confident he’d be able to interfere in time to stop her.

“You also left a mess,” Ли [she] said. “Wasting food is bad.”

The blood-splattered demon glanced back to the corpses. Her features screwed up and she started to pace back and forth, wringing her hands together. “This vile filth isn’t worth eating. I would not sully my lips with their flesh.”

“You… already did,” Ной [he] said.

The woman ground to a halt. She let out another groan and pulled at her hair again. Then she grabbed her axe and ripped it from the ground, pointing it straight at Ной [he]. He stepped to the side. The weapon followed him. He stepped back to where he’d been standing again.

“Would you stop that?” the demon exclaimed, adjusting her aim once more.

Maybe I can just… out-crazy her.

“No,” Ной [he] said, stepping to the side again. He drank energy from his runes, gathering it into his palms. “I’ve got a whole lot more where this came from, too. If you know what’s good for you, leave. I can side-step all day.”

The demon ground her teeth and slammed her axe into the ground. Rocks shattered beneath its blade and peppered down all around her. “Do not make a mockery of me!”

“Alright, alright,” Ной [he] said. He came to a stop and lifted his hands into the air, palms facing the demon. “Sorry.”

He released the magic. The air shattered as a thick bolt of lightning screamed through it, slamming straight into the demons’ face with a deafening crack. It snapped her neck back and sent her tumbling across the ground. The axe flew from her grip and skidded across the stone beside her.

They both came to a stop at the edge of the square. Thick black smoke rose up from the demon’s face. Her body twitched as arcs of electricity danced out from her and sank into the ground.


Ной [he] let his hands lower. Мокси [she] stared at him. He shrugged.

“What?”

“That was cheap.”

“Really? You’re on her side now? There were no rules.” Ной [he] gathered magic again and sent a second blast of lightning into the demoness’ body. He wasn’t optimistic enough to believe that a single bolt would be enough to kill a Rank 5, and he had no plans of sitting around while the demon—

She sat up.

“Excruciating,” the demoness breathed, wiping soot from her face. Aside from a small scorch mark on her cheek, she was completely uninjured. She rose to her feet and rolled her neck. “Do it again.”

Ной [he]’s eye twitched. “If you stand right there, I’d be more than willing to oblige you.”

“I’d prefer to make things more… exciting. I am known as Аксиль [she]. If you will not give me the honor of witnessing your canvas, then I will take the choice from you,” the demoness said. She lifted her hand. The axe leapt from its spot on the ground and slammed into her grip.

Her eyes flicked to Мокси [she].

And, in that moment, Ной [he]’s willingness to play games with the demon evaporated.

He slammed power into the Rune of Self embedded in his soul. His foot slammed into the ground, cracking the stone beneath it as he blurred into motion. The distance between him and Аксиль [she] evaporated.

His fist slammed into her cheek with enough force to snap her head to the side. The demon spun with the blow. Her foot whipped up between his legs. Ной [he]’s free hand shot down, driving into her ankle. A shudder raced down his arm from the impact, but he stopped the strike.

Аксиль [she]’s elbow streaked for his face in a blur. Ной [he] leaned back, controlling every muscle in his back perfectly to let the strike slip just past his nose. He drove his knee up into Аксиль [she]’s stomach.

She doubled over. Brilliant white power crackled between Ной [he]’s fingertips and he clapped his hands down on the demon’s shoulders. She twisted from his grip, but not fast enough to avoid his magic.

Ной [he] unleashed Crumbling Space. White cracks bore into her skin like twisting worms and the air collapsed upon itself. Bone shattered and blood sprayed as both of the demon’s arms crunched like pressurized soda cans.

The axe slipped from her grip and Ной [he] caught it with a hand, flinging it across the square. His knee shot up and drove into Аксиль [she]’s face. Her nose crunched beneath it and snapped back. She stumbled backward — and Ной [he] froze. There was only one emotion on Аксиль [she]’s face.

Ecstasy.

“More,” Аксиль [she] rasped. Her bones popped and her warped arms twisted. They snapped back into place and she rolled her shoulders as a shudder ran down her back. Her nose unbroke itself and she wiped the blood from her features with the back of a hand, licking it clean.

She extended a hand to the fallen axe and it leapt like a well-trained dog, flying back to her hands. Blood soaked into Аксиль [she]’s white robes. The wounds on her body hadn’t sealed, but the majority of the damage had been undone.

Ной [he] obliged her. He didn’t exactly like the idea of obliging the insane demoness, but when the alternative was putting Мокси [she] or Ли [she] in her sights, he wasn’t about to let up.

Bones crunched beneath his fists. Blood sprayed across the ground and Crumbling Space carved through Аксиль [she]’s flesh. The demoness took every single blow, stumbling back until Ной [he] had her pinned against the wall with his flurry of attacks.

No matter how hard Ной [he] struck her, her body fixed itself just moments later. The delight in Аксиль [she]’s features started to fade. Her nose crunched again beneath his fists, and when he pulled back again, her expression was flat and cold.

“This is not—”

Ной [he]’s fist slammed into her mouth, crushing several teeth.

“What I—”

His elbow struck the side of Аксиль [she]’s temple and caved the bone in, snapping her head to the side.

“Witnessed.”

Аксиль [she]’s head twisted back to look at Ной [he]. Her skull fixed itself, her jaw clenched. They locked eyes.

“You are disappointing,” Аксиль [she] said. She spat blood onto his face.

The bow of Ной [he]’s violin materialized in his hands. He flicked it across Аксиль [she]’s throat. Its razor-sharp thread passed through her neck like there was nothing in its way. Аксиль [she]’s lips parted, a flicker of surprise passing through her eyes.

Then her head pitched forward, rolling from her shoulders and splattering to the ground at Ной [he]’s feet. He wiped her spit from his cheek and took a step back. His fists and chest were stained red, and his face-wrappings were soaked.

Ной [he]’s chest rose and fell with heavy, ragged breaths. For several seconds he stood still and watched Аксиль [she]’s corpse.

It didn’t move.

He pulled the ruined wrappings off his face and threw them to the ground where they landed with a wet, disgusting squelch. They looked like he’d dipped them in a bucket of red paint. Ной [he] shook his head.

He turned back to Мокси [she] and Ли [she].

The axe on the ground rattled.

It blurred toward him. Ной [he]’s eyes widened and he dismissed the violin bow. He slammed his hands together, stopping the weapon an inch before it could bury itself in his skull. His muscles burned as it fought against him.

With a roar, Ной [he] thrust the weapon to the side. It streaked through the air and slammed into a building at the side of the market, shattering the stone and disappearing within it. Ной [he] spun back to Аксиль [she].

Her headless corpse rose. She grabbed her head and set it back in place. Muscle rippled in her neck and blood trickled down the sides of the seam as it knit itself closed. Аксиль [she]’s eyes fluttered and she cracked her neck, letting out a shuddering breath.

“That,” Аксиль [she] said, her tongue running along her lips. “Was better. But it was not enough, Паук [he]. You have still disappointed me. Is that all you have to offer? Have you deceived my sight?”

“You know what? Now I know why I pissed all those people off,” Ной [he] said. “Stay dead, you creepy fucker.”

“Your true canvas must be concealed. Hidden,” Аксиль [she] mused, rolling the words in her mouth like she were tasting them. Her eyes narrowed, locking in on Ной [he] like a homing missile. “I will expose it. I am going to kill you now, Паук [he]. Please endeavor to make your death enjoyable.”

Chapter 533: Stop That!

Ной [he] spotted Ли [she] tensing and Мокси [she] preparing to take a step forward out of the corner of his eye. He threw his hand up behind himself.

“Don’t!” Ной [he] snapped, his eyes not leaving Аксиль [she]’s face. He couldn’t let them get involved. Аксиль [she]’s attention had to remain on him. The moment she went after someone else, they all lost. “Both of you, go back to the tent. I’ll handle this.”

“There is no need for impatience.” Аксиль [she]’s head tilted to the side until her neck cracked. She repeated the motion in the other direction, then ran her hand across the seam where she’d reattached her skull to the rest of her body. “I will complete their canvases in due time.”

“No, I don’t think you will,” Ной [he] replied. He flexed his fingers. Warped Matter thrummed to life in his palm. Gray tendrils of magic coiled off his palm in their eagerness to escape the confines of his body.

Мокси [she] and Ли [she] hesitated for a second, then slipped into the tent. Ной [he] doubted they would actually stay there. Neither of them were one to sit around while someone else was fighting but getting them out of Аксиль [she]’s line of sight would go a long way in making sure she remained focused on him.

A streak of black carved down toward Ной [he]. His eyes widened and he jerked his body to the side, twisting as hard as he could. Аксиль [she]’s axe slammed down into the ground, sending stones pelting into his shins. It passed so close to his face that several strands of hair fluttered past his eyes.

Аксиль [she] had appeared before him so fast that he’d barely even consciously registered his movement. The only thing that had kept him from getting cut in half was his instinctive reaction to the attack.

The demoness pulled the axe free of the stone like it weighed no more than a feather. It swung up for Ной [he]’s stomach. He drove his palm down onto the flat of the blade and used it to vault into the air over Аксиль [she]’s head.

He landed on the ground behind her, but the axe was already whistling for his head. Ной [he] ducked down and drove his palms forward into her stomach. Worms of purple energy dug through her robes and into her skin. It darkened and rotted away as they carved through her body, but his magic only made it a few inches before its effects faded.

Huh. Demons and humans have magic in them, so it’ll be harder for Warped Matter to consume their bodies than a random inanimate object. I wonder if demons are more resistant to magic than humans are because of —

Ной [he] dove to the side. Аксиль [she]’s axe crunched into the ground behind him, just barely having missed once again. His Fragment of Self was more than pulling its weight in the fight, and he’d still yet to leave an injury on the demoness that did more than marginally annoy her.

“I have never been more disappointed in my life,” Аксиль [she] said. The porcelain portions of her face crumpled like she was a child who had just watched her birthday cake get pelted into the ground. Her grip on the axe tightened and the large weapon hummed in her grasp. “I was so excited . But this — this is disappointing.”

“I’d say you should see what I can do in bed, but I’m happily taken.” Ной [he] sent a wave of magic down through his feet and into the earth. The ground shuddered as he ripped a jagged spike of stone up from it with Natural Disaster.

The spike drove straight into Аксиль [she]’s stomach and burst out of her back with a spray of blood. She didn’t even seem to notice it. Аксиль [she] took a step forward. The bones of her ribcage ground against the spike and her flesh squelched as it pierced deeper.

Then she ripped herself straight in two.

Аксиль [she] stepped right past the spike, wet strands of blood and muscle reaching out to each other to re-connect her body once she’d passed by the stone. For an instant, Ной [he] could do nothing but stare in abject disbelief.

“I am uninterested in finding out,” Аксиль [she] said.

Then she swung her axe.

It slammed into Ной [he]’s right shoulder. Carved through flesh and bone like butter. Bit into the stone below — and then, only then, did his body finish the movement that he had started. It took him a moment to realize that he’d been cut.


Pain erupted at Ной [he]’s side. His arm dropped to the ground at his side, landing beside the Axe with a thud. He snarled in pain and slammed his left hand into the weeping wound, calling on Natural Disaster.

Shit! How goddamn fast is she?

Frost spread across the stump of his missing limb. A burning chill drove into his arm, briefly intensifying the pain before quickly going numb. Аксиль [she] lifted the axe free from the stone and ran a finger along the blood staining its edge. She ran her tongue down her finger and tasted it, sucking on the insides of her cheeks like it was a fine wine.

“You taste wrong

,” Аксиль [she] said, the features on her face that could actually move contorting in confusion. “Why do you—”

Ной [he]’s fist slammed into her face. He drove Аксиль [she] down into the ground. Her skull crunched as it struck the market floor. Ной [he]’s fingers tightened around Аксиль [she]’s head and the temperature of the air around them dropped like a boulder from a cliffside. Gray turned to white as a slow moving storm of frost dug into her skin and worked its way through her features.

Аксиль [she] didn’t even seem to notice. Her hands twitched and her axe blurred. Ной [he] flung her to the side at the same time as he ducked into a roll. Pain carved into his missing limb and he skidded before managing to stagger back upright.

The demoness rose as well. She reached up to her face and dug her fingers into the frostbitten skin, ripping it free. Аксиль [she] discarded the ruined flesh at her side, even as new gray rippled across the exposed muscles of her face. In seconds, her body had reformed once again.

“Better… but still wrong . You are wrong. Why are you wrong?” Аксиль [she]’s eyes were wild. She slammed the axe into the stone and stomped a foot against the ground like she was having a temper tantrum. Any semblance of sanity she may have had — no matter how little — was rapidly evaporating.

Normal attacks aren’t going to kill this crazy woman, but she doesn’t know about the Fragment of Возрождение [she] or Разлом [he]. I think I’ve gotten her guard low enough by now. I don’t have time to get a proper Formation done — not that I could do that anymore. I’ve only got one damn hand left.

“Come and find out,” Ной [he] replied. He raised his one remaining hand to Аксиль [she] and beckoned her forward.

Аксиль [she]’s eyes locked into his. The bottom of her jaw unhinged. Her mouth yawned open. And even though Ной [he] was already planning to die, a shudder ran down his spine. He was not about to get his face eaten off by a crazed nutjob.

He extended his senses into his soul, and power met them. The immense strength of Разлом [he] slammed into his body like the weight of a mountain. He pulled his lips back in a snarl. Black carved across his body, consuming his veins.

Аксиль [she] blurred.

Ной [he] dropped at the last second, shifting his weight and driving his injured shoulder into Аксиль [she]’s stomach. Her momentum knocked the breath from her lungs in a pained wheeze. Bone crunched against Ной [he]’s shoulder but he was nearly slammed to the floor form the force of her arrival. He wasn’t even sure whose bone it was that was breaking.

He swept Аксиль [she]’s feet out from under her. She stumbled, managing to keep herself from falling, but in the brief instant where she was off balance, Ной [he] struck. He struck her in the shoulder and spun the demoness around so her back was facing him. In the same motion, Ной [he] wrapped his good arm around her neck and jerking it taut.

A loud crack echoed through the air. Аксиль [she]’s head twisted a full one hundred and eighty degrees so she was nose-to-nose with Ной [he]. He could smell the carrion and rot on her breath, the blood splattered across her lips.

“Fuck that,” Ной [he] said, releasing her neck and striking Аксиль [she] in the jaw as her mouth opened to bite down on his face. Her head spun the rest of the circle, turning back to face away from him.

Аксиль [she] turned her head back toward him.

Ной [he] hit her chin again and spun her back around.

“Stop that!” Аксиль [she] hissed. She bucked against Ной [he]’s grip, but the Fragment of Self wasn’t held back by the activation of a Master Rune. Аксиль [she] was fast, but Ной [he] was stronger than she was. He clung to her back, refusing to let the demoness free of his grip. “Let me kill you!”

“No!” Ной [he] yelled back.

Разлом [he] thundered inside Ной [he]’s body. Its power continued to pour through him, growing in intensity until it was a raging ocean. Ной [he]’s grip tightened even further on Аксиль [she]. His lips pulled apart.

Аксиль [she] twisted turned to look at him once again. Her neck had definitely broken itself so many times at this point that her head was probably just spinning on a rotating point. A crack echoed, her jaw opened.

Then she hesitated. For an instant, something gave her pause. Her head tilted to the side. Words formed on her lips, but they didn’t get a chance to make it out.

Ной [he] released Разлом [he].

Jet black power screamed out of him. His veins snapped back to normal as the magic poured into Аксиль [she]’s body. A black point shimmered in the sky just above them.

“Turn around,” Ной [he] said, his lips pulling back in a grin. “You’re going to want to see this.”

He drove his forehead into Аксиль [she]’s nose at an angle. Her head was forced back to its normal position just in time to see a glistening onyx black spear take form above them. Аксиль [she]’s body stiffened. She drew in a breath — whether it was disbelief, surprise, or awe, Ной [he] never found out.

The spear crashed down.

Chapter 534: Rattle

The black spear plummeted from the sky and slammed straight into Аксиль [she]’s heart. It ripped through her body like it were made of paper, and continued down into Ной [he], pinning the both of them to the ground.

Аксиль [she] wheezed. She grasped at the handle of the massive spear, her hands struggling to pull it free. A line traced down her skin, running from the top of her skull all the way down her body.

Then she peeled apart like a ripe fruit, splattering to the ground on either side of Ной [he]. Blood bubbled from the thick wound in his chest, rushing past the haft of the spear even as it evaporated, dumping him unceremoniously to the ground.

Ной [he]’s consciousness fluttered. Pain punched into his chest and spread down his nerves, reaching for his throat and threatening to swallow him whole. He could feel his soul shuddering, trying to peel itself free of his body.

He held on for an instant longer and forced his head to the side. Аксиль [she]’s body wasn’t reforming anymore. Her corpse remained still. A tiny grin tugged at the corners of Ной [he]’s lips.

Then he died.

It had been a long time coming, all things considered. His death had been signed the instant Аксиль [she] had cut off his arm. He wasn’t about to go wandering around unable to play his violin. Death had been inevitable. It had just been a matter of when.

His soul drifted up into the air above his body, a band of dark energy forming around his throat. It pulled at him, trying to drag him into the tent where Мокси [she] and Ли [she] had retreated. Ной [he] resisted it for another few seconds to make sure Аксиль [she] remained exactly where he’d left her, then finally gave in.

Разлом [he] yanked on its leash and he blurred, hurtling to meet the new body forming for him.

A ripple of energy passed through the Damned Plains. It was so faint that its signature was little more than a blip in the grand scheme of things, the mark of a soul passing from one life into the next.

By no means was this soul a significant one. It held little strength, nor had it achieved any immense heights. It was simply the soul of a demon. An ordinary demon by most aspects. Most — but not all.

This soul had a single abnormality. Nothing more than a delicate brush stroke across its delicate blue surface, the mark of something greater. The small mark was hardly anything that normally would have been worthy of notice.

But, in a sea of blue souls, a tiny dot of black may as well have been a thundering roar in a silent valley. To anyone who may have been watching, such a difference was the difference between the sky and the earth.

Someone was indeed watching.

The darkness that was the cosmos shifted. A will pushed through it like a canoe through an ocean of black. Massive wispy fingers curled like clouds, passing through space and ether as one.

They closed in around the soul streaking from the Damned Plains, halting its path before it could reach the line. The glowing blue light coming from the soul vanished. The hand curled around the soul, enveloping it entirely.

Then, slowly, the fingers pulled open once more. Bands of black had wrapped the blue soul in its entirety like fishnet. Features bloomed across the soul. Arms followed after legs. A blurry face came in their wake, joined by the curling horn of a demon — and, finally, consciousness.

The soul looked down at itself, at the bindings enveloping its form. Then it raised its face again, the features growing concrete and defined. Awe swirled across the soul as it stared up into the starry cosmos surrounding it. Then it dropped to its knees.

“Лорд [he] Сиван [he],” Аксиль [she] breathed, prostrating herself on the ground. “I am not worthy of your attention. I did not think I would ever be granted such grace to lay eyes upon your power while I lived.”

“You were not,” a voice as cold as a winter storm responded.

Аксиль [she] hesitated. “I wasn’t?”

“Raise your head, Аксиль [she].”

He knows my name?

She rose just enough to see the cloudy black surface before her. Wisps of darkness twisted up from the palm of the massive hand to take the form of a rather plain looking man. He wore a gray suit and was of pale complexion.

The man’s lips were thin and almost entirely devoid of color. If he was a demon, he sported no horns. There was only a mop of dusty brown hair at the top of his head. His eyes were the only thing that could have been considered odd about him.

Where there should have been an iris, there was nothing but milky white. The man’s eyes were nothing but two perfectly flat and white orbs. A gaze that should have been empty and blind — but, when Аксиль [she] met it, was anything but.

“Лорд [he] Сиван [he]?” Аксиль [she] asked, confusion tightening its grip on her even further. Her memories were hazy. Twisted. The harder she thought, the more jumbled everything became. She’d been called upon. There had been a fight.

Excitement.

Disappointment.

And then… nothing.

It was like a chunk of her memories had been carved free and a weeping wound had been left in her mind where they had been.


Аксиль [she] groaned as a piercing headache jabbed into her skull like an ice pick. She clutched her skull and ground her teeth, fighting to keep herself from showing too much emotion in the presence of Лорд [he] Сиван [he] — if that was even who she stood before.

No. It must be. This power is unmistakable. It does not matter what form he has taken to greet me. I recognize this magic.

“Confusion is natural. Do not resist it,” Сиван [he]’s voice fell around Аксиль [she] like freezing spring rain.

A hand appeared in Аксиль [she]’s view. Plain and well-cared for. Smaller than her own. She stared at it, uncomprehending. A second passed. Neither of them spoke. Аксиль [she] swallowed. The pain was growing more intense with every passing second.

She extended her own hand and slowly accepted the offer.

A freezing river screamed through her head. It enveloped the pain and washed it away in an instant, leaving clarity in its wake. Аксиль [she]’s translucent eyes widened. She looked down at herself once more, then back up at the plain man standing above her.

“I died,” Аксиль [she] realized.

“So you did,” Сиван [he] said. He pulled Аксиль [she] to her feet, and Аксиль [she] realized that she was actually taller than he was.

“I… died?” Аксиль [she] repeated, the words sounding odd and hollow to her ears. She could not die. Death did not come for those who followed Лорд [he] Сиван [he]. There was pain. Defeat. Disappointment. All other aspects of life remained — but not death.

Сиван [he]’s followers could never do anything more than taste death. They could sample from its platter, feel its sensation as they danced from its grip, but never could they actually be caught in its grasp.

At least, that was what she had believed.

“An anomaly,” Сиван [he] agreed. “You died. And I would like to know how. It has been so long since I felt any fragment of my power leave this plane that I had to investigate myself. I thought that perhaps…”

His voice trailed off and he shook his head. “Never mind. Answer the question, my disciple. How is it that your soul was severed from its body? Such a thing should have been impossible unless you decided that you no longer wished to serve me. Is that the case?”

“No!” Аксиль [she] shook her head firmly. “I would never turn my back to you, Лорд [he] Сиван [he]. Serving you has brought beauty into my life. I have borne witness to such great things. Such indescribable awe that—”

The words froze in Аксиль [she]’s chest. A vision flicked through her mind. The memory of a black spear — and the canvas that had trailed in its wake. A piece of artwork that could no longer be merely described as beautiful.

It had swallowed the sky in its immensity. There were more strokes than her mind could comprehend, more designs than a mortal could ever study even if they had dedicated their entire life to it.

Perfection.

There was no other word to describe it. Perfected death, a completed painting that had been done by such a masterful hand that she would never have believed it existed had she not witnessed it herself — had she not joined the strokes of that canvas herself.

Паук [he] had been playing with her. He had pretended to be nothing more than a mere demon, but in the end, he had granted her wish. Every single stroke of perfection that had filled the sky was connected to him. They extended from his soul like the tendrils of a jellyfish trailing through the open sea behind it.

A tear welled in Аксиль [she]’s eyes. She had joined the beauty of the universe, entering the greatest canvas it had ever witnessed. There could have been no greater honor than entering it under Сиван [he]’s own hand.

“It was incredible,” Аксиль [she] breathed, barely even able to find her words once more. “I bore witness to beauty, Лорд [he] Сиван [he]. Did you gift this death to me? For my service?”

“Your passing was not at my hand,” Сиван [he] replied, his voice unchanging. “It was granted by another.”

“Incredible,” Аксиль [she] repeated. Her mind couldn’t manage to form any other words yet.

“Who did this immense beauty belong to?” Сиван [he] asked. “Who was able to kill you?”

“Паук [he].” Аксиль [she]’s voice drifted as memories prickled against her mind. “The one who possesses the rune you seek. I am sorry. I could not acquire it for you, Лорд [he] Сиван [he]. I grew too distracted. The beauty was too great.”

“Mistakes and life cannot exist independently of one another. It seems you were outmatched.” For the first time, Лорд [he] Сиван [he]’s voice changed. Something different entered his tone, but the emotion was foreign to Аксиль [she] and she could not understand it. “And now you are faced with a choice.”

“I am at your service, Лорд [he] Сиван [he].”

A tired laugh echoed through the stars swirling around them. “You are dead, Аксиль [she]. You are at nobody’s service. And thus is the choice you must make. Are you satisfied with your life and its conclusion? Prepared to move onto the great beyond?”

“My only regret is to not be permitted to witness such incredible beauty a second time.” A dreamy smile played across Аксиль [she]’s lips. Then it flickered. Her head tilted to the side. “But… what comes next? What awaits for me in the beyond?”

A long, slow sigh escaped Сиван [he] and the faintest smile pulled at the corners of his lips. “The wait awaits. A new future, bought at the cost of the present. You will be… different. Reborn.”

“Reborn?” A swirl of unease passed through Аксиль [she]’s stomach. “My memories?”

“Gone, I fear. As all things that pass into the beyond inevitably are.”

The unease turned to fear.

“I do not wish to forget what I saw,” Аксиль [she] said. “Is there another path? A way free of this? One in which I retain my knowledge?”

“Very rarely in life is there only a single path,” Сиван [he] said. His smile grew wider, but it never reached his eyes. “Death is not so different. Some things change, and some remain. But your death is not yet set in stone.”

“I’ll do whatever it takes,” Аксиль [she] said. “I don’t want to forget what I saw. I want to see more of it. I never want to forget.”

“Not all will be as it was,” Сиван [he] warned. “You will not return to what you left. Death is not one to be cheated lightly. It comes at cost. A great cost.”

“To me?”

Сиван [he] nodded.

“I will do it,” Аксиль [she] said. “I will remain in your service for as long as you grace me with your aid.”

“Your service to me has already ended,” Сиван [he] said with a gentle shake of his head. “You are mine no longer. That which connected us is already wiped clean. But you will do me one last favor before your life truly becomes yours once more.”

“Anything you desire.”

“Get me that rune — and find out more about this Паук [he] while you’re at it,” Сиван [he] said. “And this time, I suggest trying a different angle. I will not notice your death should it happen again.”

Аксиль [she] swallowed. The admonishment in Лорд [he] Сиван [he]’s tone was evident. She gave him a sharp nod. The idea of no longer being in his service burned her heart like a molten iron, but she would not beg or argue with him. To do so would have been to disgrace to his name.

“I will do as you ask,” Аксиль [she] swore. “I will not fail you twice. I will beg for the rune, should that be what is called of me.”

Сиван [he] smiled.

His body blew away into streams of black smoke.

The cloudy hand closed around Аксиль [she]. It collapsed in on itself, vanishing and leaving no trace of its passing. Аксиль [she]’s soul never made it to the Great Line. Its gentle glow disappeared with the passing of the massive hand, stolen like a kiss in the night.

A great distance away, within the Damned Plains upon the streets of the walking city of Трэдон [he], a black axe laying in a pool of blood on the cobbled street of a market started to rattle.

Chapter 535: Half

Ной [he] jerked upright, a throbbing headache pounding in his skull. Cold ground pressed into his backside and his clothes had been draped over his naked body like a blanket. The walls of a tent rose around him and the edge of Мокси [she]’s bed floated just behind him. Two blurry forms on the other side of the room slowly shifted to take Мокси [she] and Ли [she]’s forms.

“Did it work?” Ной [he] asked through a groan as he pulled his clothes on. If Аксиль [she] had somehow managed to survive Разлом [he], he had absolutely no desire to fight her naked. There were some rumors that he didn’t need following him.

A heavy fog hung around his head, but it wasn’t as bad as it could have been. He’d dealt the killing blow to both himself and Аксиль [she], so the soul damage he’d taken was minimal. Ной [he] was pretty sure he’d actually grown stronger by absorbing her energy. He couldn’t tell yet — that would have to wait until he could properly access his runes again.

“You cut her in half,” Мокси [she] confirmed. “I was watching, and I wasn’t the only one. The camp is probably minutes from chaos. You need to make another appearance as soon as you can if we want to prevent the Streetlords from trying to pull some stupid shit.”

“Figured,” Ной [he] said through a sigh.

Ли [she], whose head was poked through the flap in the tent, pulled back to glance at Ной [he] for a second before returning to her former position.

Мокси [she] held a hand out and Ной [he] took it, pulling him to his feet. She grabbed the lapel of his jacket and adjusted it before brushing some dust off his shoulders. After giving him one more look over with a critical eye, Мокси [she] stepped back and gave him a curt nod. “At least you got her.”

Ли [she] cleared her throat. “Uh… about that.”

They both looked over to her.

“What?” Ной [he] asked, a sense of dread gripping his stomach like an iron fist.

“She’s melting, but in reverse.”

Ной [he] pushed past Ли [she] and stepped out of the tent. He ground to a halt. The two halves of Аксиль [she]’s body — along with his own — laid dead in the center of the market square. They should have been laying in rest like good corpses, but it seemed somebody had forgotten to tell Аксиль [she] about that part.

Rivers of blood and viscera crawled across the ground. They gathered beside a large, black axe and twisted together like taffy. Bubbles burst against the flowing corpse-fluids. A thick, teeming red mass formed, a shape starting to appear within it.

Thick, gut-twisting squelching sounds violated the alley. Limbs pushed free of the visceral blob. The limbs formed hands and feet, formed a connecting torso and its head. Flashes of bone and organ bubbled up within the solidifying form like chunks of meat in a soup. In a vile way, that was exactly what they were.

Ной [he]’s jaw clenched. His powers were still sealed, and it would be twelve hours before his magic functioned again. Thoughts flashed through his mind as he searched for a way to stop Аксиль [she] from fully coming back.

If she took form again, Мокси [she] and Ли [she] wouldn’t be able to stop her. She was just too fast. And, even if they did, he wasn’t so sure that it would matter. Аксиль [she] just wouldn’t stay dead no matter what they did. This was a level of immortality he’d never seen before. Аксиль [she] was actually unkillable.

Chills gripped Ной [he]’s spine.

Разлом [he] still did more damage than anything else I’ve tried. My best might be killing myself again. I can access Разлом [he] while I’m a soul. It’ll fuck me up for quite some time, but the Fragment of Возрождение [she] should be able to handle patching me up once I break out of the coma.


“Мокси [she], Ли [she], get ready to run,” Ной [he] said softly.

“I could try to drink her before she finishes taking form,” Ли [she] offered, her features twisting in disgust.

It was one of the first times Ной [he] had ever seen Ли [she] unwilling to eat something. That didn’t reassure him in the slightest. He shook his head firmly. The last thing he wanted was Ли [she] somehow getting infected with whatever it was twisting Аксиль [she]’s mind.

“Just run,” Ной [he] said. He took a step toward Аксиль [she], flexing his fingers. When she came back to life, she’d kill him — and he’d return the favor with Разлом [he] once again. Given how much longer it had taken Аксиль [she] to regenerate this last time, he was willing to take his chances. It was the only shot he could take. They’d find out which one of their powers gave way first.

Muscles took form in the bloody blob. They were followed by patches of gray skin that spread like wildfire, rapidly stretching to cover Аксиль [she]’s body. Several mercifully placed scraps of white cloth from what remained of her clothes spared them all from seeing anything too mentally scarring.

A victorious cry split the air. Аксиль [she] thrust her hands into the air, claws curling toward the heavens. The remnants of the viscous fluid exploded into the air in a spout. Bloody rain pattered down around Аксиль [she] as her body took shape once more—

Ной [he] blinked.

Аксиль [she] was about half his height.

Her proportions and features hadn’t changed in the slightest, but she now stood no more than three feet tall. The remains of the clothing that had covered her were now practically a wedding gown.

The tiny Аксиль [she]’s victorious cry slowly petered out. Her hands lowered. She studied her palms, then slowly turned her gaze over to her axe. It was now considerably larger than she was. Wordlessly, Аксиль [she] took the uncomfortably long trip over to the weapon and grabbed it.

Her teeth ground as she heaved the weapon into the air with a pained grunt. It flew over her shoulder and slammed into the stone behind her. The weapon’s haft acted as a lever and shot up, catapulting Аксиль [she] into the air.

White robes fluttered like a drowning ghost as Аксиль [she] bounced across the ground. She scrambled to her feet and stormed back over to the axe. She hoisted it once more. The weapon swayed unsteadily in the air, but she managed to keep it from dropping a second time.

Ной [he] stared in mute — well, he wasn’t actually certain what emotion it was that he was feeling. It was certainly something.

At some point, Мокси [she] and Ли [she] had stepped out of the tent behind him. They both followed his gaze.

“What the fuck?” Мокси [she] asked.

“If you Разлом [he] her again, will she shrink a second time?” Ли [she] asked.

“I think I might still be dead,” Ной [he] muttered, shaking his head furiously.

Their words drew Аксиль [she]’s attention. The demon’s gaze snapped to them — and her eyes went as wide as saucers. Her axe pitched from her grip and crashed to the stone once more. This time around, she was smart enough to release the handle and avoid a second trip into the air.

“You died,” Аксиль [she] said, her lips parting in awe. Her voice, strangely enough, was exactly the same as it had been. “You died. I felt it. I saw it. We joined the canvas together. How is it that you still stand here?”

“Did you really think that killing me would be enough to make me die?” Ной [he] asked.

Мокси [she] and Ли [she] both looked at him.

“Really?” Мокси [she] mouthed. “That was lame.”

Ли [she] nodded.

“I’ve got a headache,” Ной [he] hissed. “Get off my case.”

Аксиль [she] swallowed heavily. She reached for her axe, but her hand never tightened around its shaft. Her eyes then flicked to the bodies on the ground beside her — or rather, what remained of them.

Ной [he] and Аксиль [she] realized at the exact same time that the number of corpses remaining on the ground did not quite line up. But, for the first time, it wasn’t Ной [he]’s corpse that was the source of his confusion.

There were one and a half bodies. Not two. Not one. One and a half.

Ной [he]’s body was just feet away from Аксиль [she], as was exactly half of her own body. The other half of her was gone. It struck Ной [he] that, now that he thought about it, this did make a certain amount of sense.

Аксиль [she] was just about half as tall as she’d been before. Somehow, she’d left half of herself behind when she’d come back to life.

“My body. My power. My runes. Лорд [he] Сиван [he] would not have done this. He would not return me to this world unable to fulfill his task,” Аксиль [she] muttered, her stunned words just loud enough to reach Ной [he]’s ears. Disbelief etched itself over her features. “What did you do? How is this possible?”

And, before Ной [he] could answer that he had absolutely no idea, he realized that he did know. Even through the headache pounding against his skull, Ной [he]’s eyes widened in realization.

He hadn’t just killed Аксиль [she]. He’d

Разлом [he]ed her. Not just her body. He’d Разлом [he]ed her runes, and possibly her soul as well. He’d cut everything that made up the being known as Аксиль [she] straight in half.

Chapter 536: Double Down

“How is this possible?” Аксиль [she] demanded. She stared at the palms of her hands like they held the answer she sought and found nothing. The small demoness’ gaze lifted to the half of her corpse that still laid on the ground, unmoving. “You severed my connection to myself? You died… but you lived? This is Лорд [he] Сиван [he]’s domain. It should not be possible for—”

Аксиль [she]’s words froze in her mouth like they’d turned to ice. Her eyes snapped to Ной [he] and bored into his skull with more intensity than his headache. Disbelief played across her features and her lips parted as she took a step back.

For Ной [he]’s part, he had absolutely no idea what was going through her head. The level of threat that she posed had practically died along with her. Even though he wasn’t about to completely dismiss her as an opponent, he was a little more concerned with what had just happened.

Разлом [he] had never managed anything like this before. He’d cut through people, cut through runes — but this was something else entirely. Something about Аксиль [she] as a whole had been cut through. It was either that or something with her revival had just gone really wrong, but given how exactly half of her body had been left behind when she’d come back, it would be bit too much of a coincidence to pretend the Master Rune was unrelated.

How much of Разлом [he] am I yet to understand? I know I’m still far from being able to fully control the complete strength of Разлом [he]. I just thought it would cut things harder, not do… whatever this is.

Ной [he]’s fingers twitched at his side. If he still access to his magic, he would have been strongly tempted to try Разлом [he]ing Аксиль [she] a second time.

I wonder if she’d die for good or if she’d come back at a quarter of her former size. Actually, that might be even worse. She’s manageable right now, but I don’t love the idea of a chihuahua sized Аксиль [she] running around and trying to nip at our ankles.

Ной [he] broke from his thoughts as Аксиль [she] grabbed at her axe again and heaved it into the air. She teetered back and forth but kept it aloft by bracing it against her shoulder. She thrust her free hand in Ной [he]’s direction and the axe pitched back. Аксиль [she] hurriedly re-caught it and steadied herself before settling to levy a glare at Ной [he].

“Is this a test?” Аксиль [she] asked, her voice measured and laden with suspicion. Her eyes darted around the square, flicking from Ли [she] to Мокси [she]. “Am I not yet returned to life?”

“Stand still and we can find out,” Ли [she] said, flexing her hand.

“Hold on,” Мокси [she] said as she held an arm up to stop Ли [she]. “Be careful. We don’t know what she’s capable of. It could just be an act, and she could have abilities beyond pure strength. She can come back from death. That’s not something you rush blindly into.”

“Death,” Аксиль [she] repeated. Her brow creased. Then her skin paled. Surprise rippled across her features and slackened her grip, launching the axe from her grip. Its head crashed down to the stone and its tip caught her in the chin, knocking her head back.

Аксиль [she] stumbled and grabbed at the growing bruise with a curse. “Damn this body. It’s so weak. Clumsy. I hate it.”

For a moment there, it almost looked as if she had something she was going to say. I’m not sure I can blame her forgetting it after getting clocked like that. But what are we suppose do about this?

Ной [he] studied Аксиль [she] with displeasure. The situation had not developed at all how he’d wanted it to. Аксиль [she] didn’t seem like a threat anymore, but he wasn’t about to risk Ли [she] or Мокси [she] by sending them to kill her and find out that she was hiding another trick. He couldn’t do much of anything himself either — his body was still cut from his magic.

Even his access to the Fragment of Self had been blocked. His reaction speed had returned to its normal, human limits. Ной [he] was nothing more than a normal human without any powers until the fog in his mind lifted away.

“Maybe we can throw some rocks,” Ли [she] offered in a low tone. “Throw enough rocks and we’ll eventually hit something.”

“Stoning a demon to death has a certain amount of irony in it, but I don’t think she’s just going to sit around while we fling shit at her. I could always run at her and get her to kill me so I can briefly access Разлом [he] again, but I’m going to get landed in another coma.”

“Absolutely not. We can’t have you pretending to be a corpse while we’re in the middle of the Damned Plains,” Мокси [she] hissed with a firm shake of her head.

“Aha!” Аксиль [she] exclaimed. She thrust a finger in Ной [he]’s direction again, this time unburdened by the weight of her axe and able to pull off the motion without inflicting bodily injury upon herself. “Give me your rune.”


Ной [he] stared at Аксиль [she]. It took him a second to realize she wasn’t trying to make some sort of joke. He squinted. “No.”

“You have to. I need it.”

“Why the hell would I ever give you my rune? You weren’t strong enough to take it from me when you were twice the woman you are now.”

Аксиль [she] looked down at herself, then back to Ной [he]. She crossed her arms in front of her chest and pressed her lips thin. “That was a low blow.”

“All blows against you are low,” Ли [she] said. “They have to be if we want to hit anything.”

The tiny demoness went to reply but trailed off as her eyes focused on something in the air above Ли [she]’s head. Her lips worked and she was silent for several long seconds before she shook herself off like a wet dog.

“No,” Аксиль [she] muttered to herself, shaking her head firmly. “No looking. Their canvases are far too distracting, Аксиль [she]. We cannot be distracted. Лорд [he] Сиван [he] gave us a mission. It must be accomplished. I cannot fail. Not again.”

Why is everyone so fucking batshit crazy? Would it be too much for us to run into a demon that’s perfectly logical? One that gives us a firm handshake and fucks off when he realizes that he’s outmatched? Why do I get landed with the one creepy shit that comes back to life as a tiny munchkin and starts talking to herself?

“I’m not giving you any of my runes,” Ной [he] said with a firm shake of his head. “I’ve cut you in half once, Аксиль [she]. Next time, I’ll do worse. This is your one warning. Don’t test me.”

“But I need one of your runes,” Аксиль [she] said, her face screwing up in annoyance. “I can’t leave until you give it to me. Those were Лорд [he] Сиван [he]’s instructions.”

She spoke with such matter-of-fact confidence that it gave Ной [he] a moment of pause. Аксиль [she] didn’t even seem like she was trying to threaten them. She was framing her words as if they had to give her what she wanted. Not because she would enforce it, but because Лорд [he] Сиван [he] would.

I swear I’ve heard his name before, but my damn head is so foggy I can’t quite remember where. Was he somehow allied to the Белкус [he] guy?

“Remind me who Лорд [he] Сиван [he] is?” Ной [he] asked, rubbing the bridge of his nose.

Аксиль [she]’s eyes twitched.

“You claim to be unaware of Лорд [he] Сиван [he]? This is impossible. All who walk within the Damned Plains know of him. He is the Ruler of the Golden City. The watcher of the Black Reaches. The Master of Death. The Eternal End. The strongest living demon within this plane of existence.”

Ной [he] scratched at the side of his cheek. He was starting to grow some stubble. It would probably be time to find a way to shave relatively soon.

I kind of remember something being mentioned about Сиван [he] with regard to the Black Reaches. I think that’s where a bunch of the runes I used to fuel my combinations came from. If he’s the master of the place, then why did he let someone stroll into his land and steal from him?

Also, nobody actually strong is going to stroll around touting stupid ass titles like that.

“If this bloke wants something from me, he’s welcome to ask for it himself. I’m not an unreasonable man. I’m occasionally willing to bargain. I’m not partial to dealing with anyone that tries to send an assassin after me before introducing themselves. Words exist for a reason, you know.”

Аксиль [she] tilted her head to the side. She scratched at the horn protruding from the side of her face in a remarkably similar motion to what Ной [he] had just done.

“Your words do not make sense. You request for someone to bargain. And yet, when I come to bargain, you refuse me.”

“You didn’t bargain. You tried to murder us.”

“An instrumental part of the process.”

“It most certainly is not,” Ной [he] snapped. He crossed his arms in front of his chest and stared down the bridge of his nose at Аксиль [she]. “Or did you realize you can’t win and then decide to pretend you came to bargain from the start?”

“No. I always came to bargain. I told you as much,” Аксиль [she] said.

“Bullshit,” Мокси [she] said. “You said you wanted to dance with Паук [he]. Then you tried to kill him — but he killed you first. Enough of the lies. I’ve got half a mind to see how far a solid kick to the chest can make you fly.”

“No bargain is complete without blood. Anyone unworthy of my blade would not be worth exchanging further words with,” Аксиль [she] insisted. Her eyes sparkled with zealotry and she stared up at Ной [he]. “Лорд [he] Сиван [he] himself returned me to this place. Your might was so immense that he has taken witness of it. I will fight you no more. To raise my blade against you would be to stand in Лорд [he] Сиван [he]’s path.”

I’m… not so sure I like the sound of that.

“I can kick her for you, Мокси [she],” Ли [she] offered. “I bet I could get her over the top of the buildings.”

“Do you really expect me to believe any of this?” Ной [he] asked, rubbing the bridge of his nose.

Аксиль [she] blinked. Genuine confusion passed over her features and her head tilted to the other side. “Why would you not? A demon of your immense strength has absolutely nothing to fear from me. I am nothing but a bug in your path. Further fighting would serve no purpose for either of us except for you to spit in Лорд [he] Сиван [he]’s face.”

Around the square, a few heads started to poke out of buildings as demons realized the fighting had stopped. There was no doubt in Ной [he]’s mind that these weren’t the only ones to witness the fight.

There were definitely people that had seen what happened. Had seen Аксиль [she] die and return — and seen him do the same. For several long seconds, Ной [he] thought. Аксиль [she] had a point if she was telling the truth.

It wouldn’t be long before news spread even further. Every action he did from here on out couldn’t just be a move played by Ной [he]. It had to be one by Паук [he]. A small grin pulled at the corner of his lips as a new idea laid itself out before him.

He’d laid even more of his cards on the table. And, in situations like that, there was one strategy that he was better at than any other.

Alright, Сиван [he]. Let’s play your game and see what it is you want from me.

Аксиль [she] had set everything up too perfectly for him to not take advantage of the situation.

It was time to double down.

Chapter 537: I Am Паук [he]

“You’re right about one thing,” Ной [he] said, blowing out an exaggerated breath and stretching his arms over his head with a yawn. There were a lot of Demons watching them — if he wanted to sell his strength properly, he had to completely commit to the bit. “The only reason to kill you again would be to figure out if you get shorter the second time around — but I won’t deny that it’s a tempting experiment.”

“I will not return a second time,” Аксиль [she] said. “My canvas has been painted. Лорд [he] Сиван [he]’s brush has completed me, and I am nothing more than what I appear.”

Thank you for making absolutely no sense. I love it. I really do. You know what? I’ll retract my earlier complaint that everyone I run into is batshit insane. I don’t care if you’re insane. But couldn’t they at least be the kind of insane where they spill all their plans and reveal everything in a way where it actually makes fucking sense?

“Perhaps,” Ной [he] said, going for the age old strategy developed through hours upon hours of school admin meetings of pretending he understood what was going on when he was completely lost. “But I’m afraid we’ve still got a problem.”

Аксиль [she]’s porcelain features furrowed, the unnaturally smooth portions of her face crumpling in ways that a human’s body was never meant to do. “What problem could we have? I am no threat. Eliminating me would be the same as digging the dirt out from Лорд [he] Сиван [he]’s toenail.”

I — what? Is she implying she’s worth no more than dirt beneath a toenail? If that’s the case, wouldn’t I literally be doing this guy a favor? Or is having dirt beneath your toenail somehow supposed to be a good thing in the Damned Plains?

“You made me waste my time,” Ной [he] said flatly. He looked down to his corpse, which laid on the ground behind Аксиль [she]. “That does not put me in a mood where I am particularly eager to bargain with you.”

She turned to follow his gaze, then looked back to him.

“I saved you time by killing four Rank 5 demons,” Аксиль [she] countered. “That should set us even.”

“I wanted to kill those demons,” Ной [he] snarled, striding up to Аксиль [she] and looming over her. “I was looking forward to playing with them. You saved me no time. All you did was steal my entertainment and force me to waste a scrap of my hair.”

Аксиль [she] turned to follow his gaze. Her eyes landed on the corpse lying on the ground. She turned back to look at Ной [he]. For the first time, a flicker of unease passed over her features. Аксиль [she]’s hands twitched at her sides and her weight shifted to her back foot.

Tension pulled the air taut.

The moment might have lasted a little longer if Ли [she] hadn’t made her way over to the shadow of a building near Ной [he]’s corpse and slowly reached out, snagging it by the wrist and slowly pulling it out of the light.

Ной [he] and Аксиль [she] both watched as Ли [she] consumed the body whole, swallowing the entire thing without so much as taking a bite. She sank into the darkness and rose back up in Мокси [she]’s shadow, averting her gaze and studying the wall as if she’d never moved.

Аксиль [she] blinked heavily. She opened her mouth, closed it, and then opened it again. “Did your ally just eat—”

“Stylist,” Ной [he] corrected. “That is my stylist. I do not enjoy leaving strands of my hair scattered around the ground like some animal. She is very good at her job.”

And Аксиль [she] hardly has any room to talk. I saw her biting the faces off more than a few different people, and she did her best to do it to me. That automatically disqualifies her from being grossed out by Ли [she]’s eating habits.

“You keep a demon around just to eat the bodies you leave behind?” Аксиль [she] asked, and Ной [he] couldn’t tell if there was awe, disbelief, or horror in her tone.

“Yes,” Ной [he] replied. “Do you have an issue with that?”

“Does she eat other bodies?”

“Not yours,” Ли [she] said. “You smell awful.”

“She keeps her diet refined,” Ной [he] said, feeling like the conversation was starting to veer off the rails and head straight for a brick wall. “Only the highest quality meat.”

There’s got to be a special place in hell for people that refer to their own bodies as high quality meat. Good thing they won’t keep me around there for long.


“Like squirrels,” Ли [she] said.

Аксиль [she] sniffed at her arm. Then she looked over to Ли [she]. “What are—”

“Enough of this,” Ной [he] snapped. The last thing he needed right now was for Ли [she] and Аксиль [she] to start getting into the specifics of Ли [she]’s diet or why Аксиль [she] smelled bad. “My patience is already thin. The only reason you aren’t dead a second time is because I have a degree of respect for…”

Shit. What was his name?

“Лорд [he] Seevan,” Ли [she] provided.

“Right,” Ной [he] said.

“Сиван [he],” Аксиль [she] corrected.

“That’s what Ли [she] meant. There was something stuck in her teeth,” Ной [he] said.

Ли [she] nodded empathetically. She reached into her mouth and yanked out a small fang, holding it up so Аксиль [she] could see. “Yup. This.”

“That is a tooth,” Аксиль [she] said. “One of your own teeth. It belongs in your mouth.”

“Does it?” Ли [she] asked. She squinted at the tooth, then ate it. “I guess it does. Good point.”

Аксиль [she] blinked heavily. Nobody said anything for several long seconds. That was definitely an improvement from all the yammer the demoness had been spouting about canvases and brushes. Maybe her former brain damage had been cured by dying — or split in half by Разлом [he]. It was either that or Ли [she] had confused Аксиль [she] so thoroughly that her mind had actually managed to wrap back around into being almost normal.

“Just tell me what it is Сиван [he] wants,” Ной [he] said, pinching the bridge of his nose. “And then I will determine if I am willing to give it over — and what you will have to pay for it.”

Аксиль [she] paused. “Pay?”

“Of course.” A slow smile spread across Ной [he]’s lips. “You didn’t think I’d be giving it to him for free, did you?”

“He’s lord Сиван [he].” The tone of Аксиль [she]’s answer might as well have changed her words to, of course I did.

“And I,” Ной [he] replied, his smile growing wider, “am Паук [he].”

“The enforcers are dead, Лорд [he] Белкус [he].”

Лорд [he] Белкус [he] shifted in his throne. The cold bone that made it up pressed into his back and loomed overhead, casting a shadow through the torchlit room. He’d had the throne built from the body of the last Лорд [he] of Трэдон [he] in a show of strength. The enormous chair was a display of power that cowed even the strongest demons that sought his audience — and there hadn’t been a day that Белкус [he] hadn’t regretted making it. The damned thing was the most uncomfortable seat in the entirety of the Damned Plains.

A messenger knelt on the blood red rug leading up to him. The Rank 4 demon was barely as tall as the City Лорд [he]’s knee and he kept his head bowed low to avoid meeting Белкус [he]’ gaze.

That was wise.

Anger, even more than what he was used to, swirled in Белкус [he]’ chest. Old wounds throbbed all along his chest and back, reminders of battles long past that had never truly healed. They always hurt the worst when things weren’t going to plan.

As of late, that seemed to be more often than not.

“Why?” Белкус [he] asked. His voice was flat and controlled, but his words echoed through the room like a thunderclap.

The demon kneeling far below him winced.

“They were killed, Лорд [he] Белкус [he]. By an operative of Лорд [he] Сиван [he].”

A cold hand clenched around Белкус [he]’ anger and snuffed it out like a candle in a winter storm. His back stiffened and his hands tightened around the armrests of his throne until the bone dug into his palm.

“What is Лорд [he] Сиван [he]’s creature doing interfering with matters in my city? Has Сиван [he] sided with the dissident that killed one that belonged to me?”

“I do not believe so, Лорд [he] Белкус [he].” The messenger shifted uncomfortably. “Паук [he] killed Лорд [he] Сиван [he]’s operative.”

Белкус [he] blinked.

“He… killed them? Permanently?”

“They came back, but it seemed the fight was over. Сиван [he]’s operative lost,” the messenger said. “The last I saw of them, they had gone into Паук [he]’s tent to discuss terms of her defeat.”

The demon hesitated. There was something he wasn’t saying. Белкус [he]’ eyes narrowed and he leaned forward in his throne.

“The rest of it. Tell me. Now.”

“Сиван [he]’s woman… she was scared. I’ve never seen one of Death’s followers show fear,” Белкус [he]’ messenger said, his voice shaking slightly. “She implied that Паук [he] may be powerful enough to draw Сиван [he]’s attention.”

Белкус [he] stared in disbelief. A demon powerful enough to draw the eyes of the Eternal End was no mere thorn in his side. Игрис [he] had reported that he was cleansing the streets of some filth that was trying to steal the underground from him — not picking a fight with a roaming Demon Лорд [he]. Ice prickled against his back and curled down his arms.

Someone of that strength in my city… this is Йоку [she]’s doing. She seeks to use my men like pawns, to turn this Demon Лорд [he]’s power against me and take the city for herself. I am not so easily tricked, wretched creature. I should have realized sooner.

“You will find Commander Зорин [he] immediately,” Белкус [he] ordered, his voice raising in volume and carving through the room like a blade. The situation had to be controlled before it grew any worse. Rumors spread like wildfire — and rumors drew those who sought power. They would make Йоку [she] grow stronger still. He would not allow it. Белкус [he]’ hand tightened into a fist. “Игрис [he] was a traitor working against me. Паук [he] did me a favor in his execution of the worthless swine. Inform him that his earlier orders are canceled. I have new commands for him.”

“It will be done as you say, Лорд [he] Белкус [he].” The messenger’s body trembled and Белкус [he] realized he was letting a minuscule amount of energy slip free of his body. He pulled his strength back and the messenger drew in a relieved breath. “What are your orders for Commander Зорин [he]?”

“He is to find this Паук [he],” Белкус [he] said, his jaw clenched as tight as wound steel. “And he is to invite him here. Зорин [he] will inform Паук [he] that he is called to an audience with me.”

Chapter 538: Bargaining

Ной [he] was having a little difficulty taking Аксиль [she] seriously.

Even when she’d been shrunk down to half her size, he’d still seen her as a potential threat. That was considerably harder to do when she sat in what could only be described as a glorified high chair for babies.

Мокси [she] had formed the contraption from vines and used one of the aforementioned plants to hoist Аксиль [she] into it before strapping her in like she was little more than an unruly child. Аксиль [she] hadn’t taken much notice of it, but it was wreaking untold amounts of havoc in Ной [he]’s mind.

“You have a Death Rune,” Аксиль [she] said for what Ной [he] suspected to be the third time. He’d glossed over the first few while trying to keep a straight face. “It belongs to Лорд [he] Сиван [he]. Give it to me so I may deliver it to him.”

Maybe I should give you a bottle of milk and a sucker instead.

“You’ll have to correct me if I’m wrong, but I do believe we just went over this,” Ной [he] said. He leaned back in the chair that Мокси [she] had made for him, thankfully one without a strap to keep him locked in place like a child, and crossed one leg over the other. “I’m not giving you — or Сиван [he] — anything. Bargaining, Аксиль [she]. Is the concept that foreign to you?”

“All which Лорд [he] Сиван [he] desires is his. There is no being in this plane of existence who can deny him his wishes. You are powerful.

Beautiful . Far more than I could ever dream to be. But even such power is nothing but a flit of wind in a hurricane when faced with Лорд [he] Сиван [he]. You have drawn his interest. Not his respect.”

Ной [he] nodded thoughtfully. “I see, I see. But you’ve missed something, Аксиль [she]. Сиван [he] isn’t here. If he truly wanted a rune I bought with my own money and spent my own effort getting, then he would have gotten it himself. I don’t see Сиван [he]. All I see is you.”

“I… speak for Лорд [he] Сиван [he].” There was a second of hesitation in Аксиль [she]’s voice that Ной [he] couldn’t have missed even if he’d wanted to. She shifted uncomfortably in her chair and glanced over to her axe, which Ли [she] had claimed and was eyeing curiously in the corner of the tent.

“You don’t sound so confident,” Moixe observed, leaning against the back of Ной [he]’s chair and arching an eyebrow. “We aren’t unreasonable. But if Сиван [he] is really this powerful, is he actually so pathetic as to be forced to beg for something that does not belong to him?”

“

Death belongs to him,” Аксиль [she] said. Reverence twisted through her words and her features sharpened.

Ной [he] blew out a sigh. They were getting nowhere. The brief flicker of respect that Аксиль [she] had formed for him after he’d come back to life had paled in face of her zealous love for Сиван [he]. Whoever the demon was, he certainly commanded quite a presence.

But I’ll be damned if some asshole who can’t even be bothered to show up himself browbeats us into giving up a damn Master Rune just because he thinks he gets the rights to everything with the word Death in the name.

There was a fine line he had to walk. Going too far and straight up spitting in Сиван [he]’s face was obviously a poor idea. Anyone who was strong enough to literally rip somebody else free of death’s grasp wasn’t someone Ной [he] was eager to make an enemy of — but nobody respected a pushover.

And if this Сиван [he] can actually control death… does he have something similar to Разлом [he]? Has he seen the afterlife? And how strong do you have to be to prevent someone else from dying? There’s a power I’d do a hell of a lot to get my hands on.

It would have helped if Ной [he] knew much of anything about Сиван [he]. Unfortunately, he had nothing to go by other than a half-insane half-sized demoness and rumors. That was far from ideal. This wasn’t the first time he’d been dealt a poor starting hand, though. There were ways around certain disadvantages. Not ways he was particularly eager to use, but ways nonetheless.


“Мокси [she], do you have any more Mind Meld Potions?”

In response, she wordlessly pulled a glimmering pink potion out from her bag and handed it to him. Аксиль [she]’s eyes followed the potion. Her head tilted to the side.

“

That is what you want to bargain?”

Ной [he] practically choked on his own saliva. “I’d dive into speeding traffic first. I will not be having any more rumors spread about me. I’ve already got more than enough of the damned things. I’m just… goddamn it. I was going to say I’m demonstrating something, but you’ve fucked it. Figuratively.”

“I can still try to kick her,” Ли [she] offered.

“You can’t just steal my offer,” Мокси [she] said. “Come up with your own.”

“My strategy is usually eating things.” Ли [she]’s nose scrunched in disgust and she shuddered. “I’m not eating her.”

“That is a wise choice. I am not edible,” Аксиль [she] said.

“Everything is edible, once,” Ли [she] said. “Most things tend to remain that way. You just smell like someone took a dump and then rolled it down a hill of dead bodies. Not appetizing at all.”

“If this is an attempt to elicit anger, it will not function. Followers of Сиван [he] are conditioned against such things. In the face of the immense beauty we are graced to witness, there is no insult that could ever take purchase in my mind.”

“Glad to hear it,” Ной [he] said, popping the top off the Mind Meld potion. He held tapped it with a finger. “Drink this.”

“No,” Аксиль [she] replied. “I will not allow you to enter my mind. Your power is beyond what I can manage to face, but it is nothing in comparison to Лорд [he] Сиван [he]. I will not turn my back on him.”

Ной [he] forced himself to choke down the slew of disgusted insults that nearly spewed from his throat. They would not have been particularly conducive to his Паук [he] persona. Granted, it was already starting to suffer from Ли [she]-itis.

At least the demons outside can’t see this. I think I’d be ruined if they did.

If she wouldn’t drink the potion, he wasn’t about to force her to. That was just wrong in multiple ways. It certainly made things more annoying for him. He needed a way to impress upon Аксиль [she] that they were not just walking money bags for Сиван [he] to dip his hand into.

It’s not like I can call on Разлом [he]’s power yet. I was hoping I might be able to pull something off in her mind since it’s all willpower and no real magic when you’re playing around in someone else’s head. If that didn’t work, I figured I’d just threaten her until something stuck. But if that won’t work either…

Damn it. I can’t believe I’m saying this, but I wish I had a Mind Rune. It’s not even like I’d be able to use it right now, but I would absolutely love to be able to poke my head into someone’s mind and crush them with my runic pressure or something.

“I see. In that case, it seems we might be here a while. I am not a particularly patient man, but I ironically turn out to be quite practiced in the art of waiting,” Ной [he] said with a shrug. “We can wait here as long as you’d like, Аксиль [she]. Let me know when you’re willing to bargain.”

“Do you really think you can outwait someone who has witnessed the immensity of death?” Аксиль [she] demanded. “I have met with Лорд [he] Сиван [he] personally. I cannot be blackmailed. If you wish to wait, I will wait. I will wait until my task is completed.”

“Сиван [he] is not the only one who bears power over death. And you, Аксиль [she], are not Сиван [he],” Ной [he] said, his voice going as silent as a snake’s whisper. His eyes flicked over to Ли [she] and his tone returned to normal. “Do you know where my grimoire is?”

Тим [he]e to sit here like a fucking idiot and bore all of us out of our minds. I need something to read so I can think about what Rune I’ll try to make next. Something with Mind for sure — but what kind of disaster has anything to do with the mind?

“I put it over here,” Ли [she] said, ducking under Мокси [she]’s bed of vines to root around beneath it. She snagged his book and tugged it out. She walked backed over to Ной [he], barely able to hold the huge grimoire against her chest, and handed it to him.

I am really glad this thing is smart enough to decide who it allows to hold it. It would be really damn frustrating if I was the only one that could pick it up. Would probably get lost somewhere when I died.

“Thanks,” Ной [he] said, thunking the book down before him. It looked like this was going to take quite a while, but at least he had some runes to study —

A stifled gasp cut through the room. Ной [he]’s head jerked up to the source of the noise, rising halfway from his chair in preparation for yet another person trying to kill them, but there was no attack coming.

Аксиль [she] was staring straight at the grimoire, and her eyes were wide in abject horror.

“What,” Аксиль [she] whispered, pulling back against her chair as if trying to slide through the vines and sink into the ground, “is that?
